story:
Are you ready to capture every moment in of your life and turn it into smooth and steady cinematic videos with Rigiet? 

With a total of seven different shooting modes, Rigiet's got you covered in every situation.

 

 

Whether you want to film in landscape, portrait or underslung position, Rigiet can automatically detect and adjust to the position that you want to film in. 

 

Can you think of any other stabilizer that can do this?

We've spent a tremendous amount of effort to design and engineer Rigiet, so that you can continue to shoot videos while in underslung position. Rigiet is the only stabilizer on the market that can do this. 

 

Another great engineering feature that Rigiet can do is to adjust the position by hand. The gimbal will listen to you and stay in the same position.

The control panel is what makes Rigiet special. Our easy-to-use control panel allows you to quickly switch between photo and video mode, front and rear camera and zoom in and out!

 

Rigiet is truly one-of-a-kind stabilizer. It can charge your phone while you are shooting videos. You can even simultaneously charge your phone and Rigiet with a power bank! Can you think of another stabilizer that can do that?

 

 

Are you an action sports fan? Use Rigiet with your GoPro to capture cinematic shots like never before. (Mount required)

 

We've designed Rigiet to be compatible with tripods, so you can use it with any tripod without the need for additional accessories.

 

 

Through the Rigiet app, simply drag-and-drop any object you want to auto-track. Rigiet will follow the object and keep it in the frame for a perfect shot. It works for both front and rear camera, and during even during streaming!

 

Share your favorite moments with your friends and family through a livestream on any social media network. Don’t worry if you’re about to run out of battery doing the stream, Rigiet's got you covered!

 

Want to capture something in slowmotion? Slow down every frame for a perfect slowmotion scene! 

Rigiet has three different panorama modes. Whether you want five, nine or 12 photos stitched together for a great panorama photo, Rigiet can get the job done.

 

See Full Resolution Photos (incl. other panorama modes and motion timelapse).

After you’ve shot your great photo or video with Rigiet, it is time to share them with friends on social media. Rigiet's app allows you to share content directly on the following social media networks: 

 

The Rigiet is the most versatile and advanced stabilizer on the market, compatible with many accessories. Here's a list of accessories that will work with Rigiet out of the box -- there will be more to come!

 Rigiet Walkthrough

 

 Running/Stairs test

 Auto-Tracking
 

 Motion Time Lapse

 

 

 

The Rigiet team was formed in Connecticut in early 2015, coming from Yale and HIT. We are all photography lovers and we thought that a smartphone stabilizer would be the best thing ever: it would eliminate shaking from smartphone content, and create cinematic photos, all things that had never been possible with budget of under $200. So we decided to make our own, and that's our Rigiet was born.

story:
XL Platinum Edge

The affordable nano drone with professional-grade specs for all skill levels

Features:

Wifi transmission system provides easy and fun FPV flight.
14.6MP 120° FOV wide angle HD camera can take photos and record 4K/ 1080P videos.
Foldable design, portable and easy to carry.
Tiltable camera to adjust view angle.
Unique fuselage design and high quality painting, outstanding appearance.
Upgraded 2.4G 4CH transmitter for your easy control.
The latest 6-axis flight control system, provides super stable flight.
With headless mode, and one-key return care free to fly.
High/low speed mode and 3D flip function provide you cool flying experience.
Equipped with barometer and height hold function, easy to fly.

In The Press

Complete User-Control All From One Exclusive App.

Get that perfect shot, video, or selfie. Perfect 360° spin for aerial panorama photos. Live stream technology for instant sharing.

Set the XL Platinum Edge to auto-follow your GPS location, or fly it from your smart device.

Your photos and videos immediately sync to your iPhone/Android storage.

Beginner pilots can navigate with confidence and advanced pilots will love The XL Platinum's reliability.

Our designs have been tested and proven. The XL Platinum Edge went through rigorous testing and we've been working on perfecting the technology just for you.

XL Platinum Edge is the product of an almost decade-old team with a background in bringing intelligent hardware and mobile-compatible products to the masses at an affordable price. We felt that it was time someone connected the bridge between affordable drones and high-quality tech. We proudly present The XL Platinum Edge. 

Tech Specs

Wifi transmission system provides easy and fun FPV flight.
14.6MP 120° FOV wide angle HD camera can take photos and record 4K/ 1080P videos.
Foldable design, portable and easy to carry.
Tiltable camera to adjust view angle.
Unique fuselage design and high quality painting, outstanding appearance.
Upgraded 2.4G 4CH transmitter for your easy control.
The latest 6-axis flight control system, provides super stable flight.
With headless mode, and one-key return care free to fly.
High/low speed mode and 3D flip function provide you cool flying experience.
Equipped with barometer and height hold function, easy to fly.What is it?A smartphone-controlled quadcopter nano-drone that takes photos and videos.

Who created it? Apex Technology, an innovative technology company based in Los Angeles, California that seeks to bring our customers high-quality, competitively priced products.

Why should we use it? When you need a professional drone with 4K camera and hovering capabilities that will enable you to see the world from another angle. The XL Platinum Edge is also useful whenever you need to capture an exciting selfie, whether you're attending a party or climbing a mountain.

Where can we buy it? Right here, right now on Indiegogo.

What do we get when we order? 1 XL Platinum Edge nano-drone, 1 set propeller protection set, 2 batteries (2,000mAhs), 2 sets of propellers, 1 charger, 1 64GB micro SD card, 1 user manual, 1 Platinum Edge app.

Why are you crowdfunding? To offer our earliest supporters the best prices possible. We're excited to bring XL Platinum Edge technology to Indiegogo and beyond!

story:
ALWAYS WITH YOU

 

     

     

     

     

    Get 10% from your pledges by joining our Kickbooster campaign ;)

     

     

     

     

     

     

    Don't let Evo's slim dimensions fool you. Shoot amazing full HD videos and photos with its bright 5 MP sensor.  See it for yourself. 




     

     

     

    The usual set you'll have to bring or remember to take along with you always.  

    All you need with Evo. 

     

     

     

     

     

     

     

    EVO APP FOR iOS AND ANDROID

    The free iOS and Android app lets you easily set up and manage your camera experience.

     

    With Evo GoCam taken out of the case, the Evo case will still allow for wireless charging.

    Fill out the SURVEY to add a phone model to the list. 

     

     

     

     

     

     

    WHAT'S IN THE BOX

     

     

     

    LIMITED NUMBERED EDITION

    To celebratate the last days of our campaign, we decided to drop the most beautiful and exclusive edition of Evo yet.  We are incredibly proud to present our new and numbered Special Edition of the Evo GoCam, with a beautiful crystal like finish and a fully translucent body. 

    We will manufacture only 99 units of this version, and each of them we’ll be numbered accordingly.  And that’s not all: you will be able to get only this weekend. After that, there will be no more Translucent Evo GoCam made.


    EVO REWARDS

     

    MEET THE ABLETECH TEAM

    Italian Design. American Engineering

    Our vision: to help you capture yours. Evo GoCam offers users more ways to capture images and record crisp video from unexplored angles. With the ability to link multiple Evos simultaneously, taking photos and video is now a shared experience. As technology is increasingly integrated into each facet of your life, our team seeks to develop tech that anticipates and accommodates your lifestyle and purpose.
     

    WHY INDIEGOGO

    We’ve created a fully functional prototype and we are ready for production.  The team has spent the last several months putting the Evo GoCam through its paces, all over the world.  We've explored lots of ways to bring Evo GoCam  to life, but the only way we can see it getting into the hands of others is to use Indiegogo. 

    We want to make it more affordable and the only way we can do that is by manufacturing in large numbers. So far,  we have been able to fund the development of the project, but now we need your help to take the product further.  A successful Indiegogo campaign will fund final software and firmware updates and manufacture the first batch of Evo Go Cams. 

    More than anything, we need your support and feedback. We want as many people as possible to see and use our product and take the Evo GoCam on their adventures.  Get your hands on an Evo GoCam early and at a great price, please back our project! 

    Thank you from all of us at Team AbleTech.

     

     

     

     

    ON TRACK TO DELIVER

     

    SHIPPING

    We are able to ship worldwide. VAT and GST not included. Please see reward details for the shipping cost that applies to you.

     

    We plan to ship the product in OCTOBER 2018*. We will keep you up to date on our progress and the expected delivery date of your order. *Actual ship dates may vary. We will keep you notified of your product ship date.

     

    FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS



    ABOUT
     

    What is Evo GoCam? 

    It  is the world’s first case-Integrated, external camera for your smartphone. Thanks to a custom made  sticky mount,  the thin and light  Evo Camera can attach to almost any surface securely. It can be  removed easily with no residue.  Securely store and carry the camera in the  Evo Smartphone Case. 

    Why should we use the Evo GoCam? 

    Capture the best selfies, group photos/videos from unique angles and POVs. Check live streams recorded by Evo GoCam anywhere,  anytime right on your phone.

    Who created the Evo GoCam? 

    It was Mario Bertucci's idea after observing that he was not in any images or videos he took of his infant son, Emanuele.  He established AbleTech  Inc to design and develop his idea of an in-phone camera with a sticky back- the Evo GoCam - and share it with the world. 

    How does it work? 

    Simply turn the Evo Camera on, connect it to your phone either via WLAN or to the internet via Wi-Fi, and then manage it with the Evo app.

    Where is it manufactured? 

    Evo GoCam will be manufactured in and distributed from the US.


    PRODUCT FEATURES

    What colors are available? 

    Evo GoCam is currently available in Red, White and Black.  Other colors will be announced during the campaign, including limited edition colors, exclusive to the Indiegogo campaign. 

    What are the other Evo GoCam features? 

    It comes with built-in Wi-Fi,  Motion Sensing  for alarms and surveillance,  Parking  and Dash Cam assistance, live streams. full HD videos, and the Evo App for social media sharing and image/video editing and filters. 

    Can multiple Evo GoCams connect? 

    Yes, via Wi-Fi in both WLAN and Internet modes. Control and manage all GoCams with the Evo App on your phone. 


    TECH SPECS

    What is the battery life? 

    The Evo GoCam  can be used  continuously for two hours and can be charged wirelessly or with the micro USB cable provided. 

    Can the Evo GoCam record and stream in HD? 

    It records videos at 1080p 30 fps for a smooth and crisp video, even in live streaming mode.

    What are the dimensions? 

    The Evo Camera is 120mm/4.72" long, 30mm/1.18 wide and  6mm/0.24" thick.  Dimensions of the Smartphone Case vary depending on the phone manufacturer and model. 

    Is it waterproof? 

    The Evo GoCam is splash proof and a waterproof case is available. 

    ABOUT THE EVO APP

    What can we expect from the Evo app? 

    Use the Evo app to manage, add, remove Evo  Cameras. The app captures photos, videos, live streams and edits and shares  content via social media.  

    What operating systems are compatible with the app? 

    It will be work with iOS and Android current releases and updates will be released via the App Store and Google Play.  
     

    CUSTOMER SERVICE

    Is there a warranty?

    It comes with a one year limited warranty which may vary by country or state. 

    What is your refund policy?

    Refunds are processed on a case-by-case basis and need to be locked prior to production & shipment. We will not be able to refund orders once shipped.

    What is  the return / exchange policy?

     You may exchange it for a new one within 30 days, less shipping & handling fees.

    Can  I upgrade my pre-order?

    Contact support@abletechsrl.com and we'll be happy to assist with the upgrade. 

    How can I check the status of my pre-order?

    We are committed  to provide  backers with frequent campaign and order  status updates via email, social media and the Indiegogo campaign page.  Once  orders are shipped, we'll send a tracking number to each backer as soon as it is available. 

    Who should I contact if I'm interested in a distribution partnership? 

    We welcome distribution and dealer inquiries.  Please contact our CEO at mario.bertucci@abletechsrl.com. 

    Can I be an Evo GoCam Beta Tester? 

    Only Backers are eligible to become Beta Testers. Pre-order your Evo GoCam and then send us an email to support@abletechsrl.com with your order confirmation number to receive more info.

    If I have other questions, who should I contact?

    Press: press@abletechsrl.com
    Investment Inquiries: mario.bertucci@abletechsrl.com
    Support: support@abletechsrl.com

story:
About this project

The physical design of light meters hasn’t changed much in the last few decades. And using a light meter hasn’t changed either - it has always been a very inefficient process.  The photographer carries the meter into the set, takes a measurement, and then returns to fiddle with the lights or camera. And repeat. With all the advances in sensor technology and electronic design, we felt that smartphone infrastructure could be harnessed to create a new, breakthrough meter design that delivers accurate measurements with incredibly improved productivity as well.

We took that idea to photographers and filmmakers to learn more about their needs.  We brainstormed and devised a truly unique light meter.  

  • We included features that would help the photographer get the right exposure and white balance faster – improving productivity on the set and reducing editing time spent fixing exposure and color issues.
  • We made the meter measure light and color, avoiding the need to buy two separate devices.
  • We separated the light sensor from the controls and display, and then replaced the controls & display with a device everyone already carries - a smartphone.  That made the meter smaller, lower cost, and more convenient.
  • We also developed one of the best reasons for photographers to own a smartwatch - providing light and color readings right to your wrist.  That leaves your hands free to adjusts lights, carry your camera, interact with the talent, or whatever else you need to do.  Now the meter can even watch the light while you’re busy, warning you when something important changes.  

The result of all this work is the Illuminati Meter: a compact device for measuring light and color.  But it really functions as your lighting assistant – helping you be more productive, more engaged with your subject. That allows you to concentrate on creating beautiful images.

Whether you create moving or still images the Illuminati light and color meter helps you measure the light in your scene – all kinds of light - efficiently and accurately. The small, lightweight meter is controlled by your smartphone using the Illuminati meter app which will be available for both Apple iOS and Android phones. Color temperature and exposure readings are transmitted from the meter to your smartphone using Bluetooth wireless technology. If you have a smartwatch paired with your smartphone, the meter readings show up there as well for a hands-free metering experience.

The meter measures exposure and color temperature from continuous sources such as LEDs, halogen, HMI, and, of course, the sun. It also measures strobes, giving you the correct exposure and color temperature - and it will even measure strobe duration. It also has a strobe + ambient mode to help you balance the exposure and also the color of the light. You can also connect multiple Illuminati meters to your smartphone and monitor multiple light simultaneously.

The illuminati light and color meter also offers several convenient mounting options including a ¼-20 socket, a lanyard channel, and a rare-earth magnet on the back which can be used with to mount the meter directly to metal objects, or with the set of Illuminati magnetic mounting attachments.

This is the first time all these features have been available in a light metering product at such an attractive price: $249 + shipping on Indiegogo right now.

We’re dedicated to advancing your ability to make your vision come to life with simple, powerful imaging and exposure measurement tools. The Illuminati Wireless Meter is designed to be the most versatile light and color meter ever available. We plan to keep expanding its capabilities beyond the initial release with new app features and firmware updates. This is one gadget you won’t want to leave behind.

If you want to master photography to capture your life, adventures, or for your profession, you need to get your color and exposure right. To get those really great photos, you have to stop shooting under just the ambient light, and really take control. You can't rely on your camera’s automatic options to give the look you want. The Illuminati meter gives all the information you, the modern creator, needs. We save you time and give you the confidence to focus on what matters–your vision.

We hope you agree, and want to join us in the pursuit of amazing photos and video. Continue reading to discover all the features and capabilities of the Illuminati Meter, as well as technical specifications. You can also watch some helpful demo videos made by our team and pro-photographers who’ve had the chance to beta test the meter. Finally, read what the media has to say about Illuminati Meter.

If you have any questions or comments, be sure to contact us. We’re excited to bring our product to you and can’t wait to see how it helps photographers and videographers around the world.

"Light makes photography. Embrace light. Admire it. Love it. But above all, know light. Know it for all you are worth, and you will know the key to photography."  

— George Eastman

 

Illuminati Meter plus Android Phone (iOS available, too!)

 

The Illuminati meter is the world's first Bluetooth light and color meter that works wirelessly with smartphones.  

Traditional light meters combine the sensor and display into one bulky device.  The Illuminati meter discards all that extra weight and keeps only the most critical parts.  Small and wireless, you place the Illuminati meter anywhere in your scene.  It sends readings in real time to your phone or smartwatch while you are free to stay behind your camera or adjust lights.

The Illuminati meter can also continuously monitor the ambient lighting and color. User-programmable alarms will warn you if the brightness changes because of a cloud floating overhead or the color temperature changes during the golden hour. Always know your lighting and get more good shots under changing conditions.

The Illuminati meter is also the first system to let you use multiple sensors simultaneously. You can meter foregrounds and backgrounds, set strobe ratios, or monitor and manage multiple light sources (including flash!) or large areas at the same time. Stop wasting valuable time running between lights or scene locations.

You can even use your smartwatch to trigger the meters remotely, monitor readings constantly and receive critical notifications about exposure or color shifts. You can get readings continuously without ever having to take out your phone or put your camera down. We’re first to do that, too!

Best of all, it’s simple to use and small. Check it out:

(Anatomy of an Illuminati meter)

 

No sweat. Here is a video we made in our office in Santa Clara, CA.

Tech Specs

 

  • One (1) Illuminati Bluetooth Light and Color Meter
  • One (1) Storage/Carry Case
  • One (1) Professional version of the Illuminati App ($20 Anticipated Value after Indiegogo)
  • One (1) Offset Finger-T Accessory Clip. Can be rotated to tilt the meter at different angles
  • One (1) Alligator Accessory Clip. Affix to clothes, hook-and-loop straps, etc
  • Two (2) AAA alkaline batteries (TBD)
  • One (1) Instruction card, which includes: How to open battery case & install batteries, App download instructions Link to user manual & website Link to website

We solved a bunch of real-world problems for visual artists, content-creators and professionals

Auto White Balance (AWB) Doesn’t Always Work

(Left: Too cool, Center: Neutral, Right: Too warm)

Letting the camera decide how to set white balance might sound convenient.  But when it fails, you get bad skin tones, inaccurate colors, and even different colors shot-to-shot. Instead, use the Illuminati meter to get the light’s true color temperature and set white balance correctly. Leave automatic color mishaps behind.  Stop wasting time fixing it in Photoshop® or Lightroom® by getting it right before you press the shutter button.  

Wrong Exposures in Tough Lighting Conditions

(Left: Overexposed (lost highlights) Right: Properly exposed)

Autoexposure works fine for typical scenes. Truly creative images aren’t typical. You have to control your camera, not the other way around. Subjects like a bride in a stunning white gown next to a groom in dark tuxedo, or a model backlit or under a spotlight can cause any camera to struggle.  

Measuring the light falling on your subject (incident) instead of bouncing back to the camera (reflected), will let you always nail the exposure. First time, every time.

Unnatural or Unexpected Colors when Mixing Lighting

(Left: Daylight only, Middle: Daylight + Tungsten, Right: Daylight plus matched color balance)

A shot ruined by mixed lighting can be almost impossible to fix when editing your RAW files. If your flash doesn’t match the ambient, you’re bound to get odd shadow colors. A fill light can ruin an otherwise gorgeous golden sunset.  Use the Illuminati meter’s strobe and ambient color measuring to match your strobes to the ambient and avoid mixed color casts.  

Scenes with multiple light sources or odd sources, like LEDs or fluorescent lights, can also be problematic. Measure your sources separately with the Illuminati meter and instantly know how to filter or white balance to get the look you want.  You even can use multiple meters in your scene to do it even faster.

We’re also including a GEL MODE in the app to help you choose the right color correction gels, even for hard-to-match lights like LEDs.

Change Happens

Sometimes a cloud passes before the sun, or one of your flashes stops working. If you don’t know when it happens, you may have to reshoot the photos or just plain loose the shots.  Bummer.  Avoid that with up to 15 user-programmable alarm notifications.  The app can even automatically compare readings from several meters and send you warnings of color changes, color mismatch, or changes in relative brightness. 

 

Your Time is Money

When you’re a pro, all the time spent correcting images afterwards eats into your profit. Get each shot right and spend less time correcting exposure and color.

(© Tony Corbell)

Setting up Lighting Ratios  

Know the exposure difference between your main light and fill or background light. Measure all of them and see the difference in f-stops. It’s easy and fast to set the same ratios up again anywhere.

(© Tony Corbell)

Stay in the Flow

Setting and checking lighting during a photoshoot can detract from the energy between a photographer and her model or clients.  Avoid those, “Hold on a sec, I have to check the lighting…” moments by having the answers in your pocket or on your wrist.  You can also quietly ask assistants to go make adjustments since you already know what to fix!

 

 

Level up as Director of Photography

With multiple Illuminati meters on the set, you can be behind the camera or in the video village while working with your gaffers to craft the lighting.

 

Be the Best Gaffer on Set  

If you’re handling the lights and the DP calls for adjustments for a light in an awkward place (happens, right?), you can place your meter in the sweet spot and clamber up to the light to make changes and see the results on your phone or watch.  Gel the light, adjust the power or adjust the color temperature–you’ll get all the right info, faster.

Change Happens

Save Time when Color Grading   

When the editing is done and you’re grading your footage, you’ll appreciate the exposure and colors all being in the right place. Don’t lose any highlights or shadows to something you could have fixed on set. Measure now with Illuminati meters and spend less time gnashing your teeth during color grading.

Rapid Green Screen Illumination

A badly lit green screen won’t mask out properly.  Using a grid of Illuminati meters in front of your green screen lets you get behind the lights and adjust them while seeing the results in Continuous Mode in the palm of your hand. The LEDs on the meters will show you which areas are too bright or too dark. When all the meters glow green, you’re good to go.

Matching and Correcting Light Sources  

You’ve got many lights on your set. They may be rented and unknown, or from different manufacturers.  Plus, not all lights are made the same (or accurately report or display their color temperature).  On top of that, many bulbs drift color temperature over time with use. Phew!

With the Illuminati meter, you will measure, know and correct all your light sources to match (or tailor to taste) before rolling camera.

 

​

Measure the brightness of both ambient and strobe lighting

  • Measuring modes: Tv, Av, Sv, strobe ratio priority
  • Strobe-to-total ratio is how much of the light comes from the strobe

 

Measure color of both ambient and strobes

  • One meter for both types of readings
  • Helps you detect and correct color differences to prevent mixed lighting, or craft deliberate neutral + warm/cool lighting scenarios

Connect multiple sensors to your phone

 

(Measure the foreground and background simultaneously with multiple meters)

  • Meter large areas to get uniform lighting
  • Measure strobe ratios (foreground/background or main/fill/hair, etc.)
  • Simultaneously measure color of different light sources, e.g. daylight from windows and artificial lighting

Measures color in both color temperature and chromaticity

(Two Chromaticity measurements compared)

  

(Color temperature reading on app)

  • Color temperature is ideal for setting camera white balance and color correcting natural sources
  • Chromaticity helps you color correct artificial sources like LEDs and fluorescents, or other sources that may not emit full chroma spectrum or have a tint

Measures color of strobe and ambient

(Strobe + Ambient Exposure with matched color © Tony Corbell)

  • Helps you detect and correct color differences to prevent mixed lighting

Trigger a meter reading

  • from the app
  • from your watch
  • from button on the meter
  • continuous ambient monitoring

(Trigger the meter from your smartwatch)

Flash Triggering  

  • Strobe photo trigger with automatic preflash rejection
  • Use a sync cable from Illuminati Meter sync port to remotely trigger strobes

Spring-loaded Retractable Dome

  • Dome toggles up/down much like a ballpoint pen cap
  • Dome up for metering people or other 3D objects and multiple light sources at same time
  • Dome down for metering flat objects or single light sources
  • Safety feature: accidental pressure on the dome will push it into meter body instead of cracking.

RGB Status Indicator LEDs on meter face

  • Used for displaying status information - battery warning, BLE connection status, etc.
  • Primarily used to display user-programmable light and color level alarms. The LEDs are a great way to check lighting conditions with even looking at your phone.

Powered by two AAA batteries

  • Battery life is approximately 6 months
  • Easy to find, easy to replace
  • No need to worry about charging an internal or proprietary battery

Custom Alarms warn you when lighting changes

Set up to 15 different alarms per device to monitor any parameter:

  • ambient or strobe light level
  • ambient or strobe color temp
  • ambient or strobe chromaticity coordinates (x or y)

Set any type of limits

  • upper or lower limits
  • within a range
  • outside a range
  • # stops change in brightness

Wireless firmware upgrades

  • You will benefit from all new features and bug fixes

Multiple mounting options

(Magnetic mount in action)

  • ¼-20 tripod mount
  • Holes for lanyard or necklace
  • Rear rare-earth magnet

(All the Magnetic Accessory Prototypes)

Magnetic Accessories  

Any magnetic accessory can be used to clip the meter to a thin surface like curtains, a jacket, shirt, reflector, and more.

Finger T

  • Also doubles as a kickstand to support meter at an angle on a table
  • Hold the meter between two fingers while leaving the rest of your hand free

Offset Finger T

  • Like the Finger T, but better!
  • Rotating the top alters the angle to adjust from 90 deg to 45 deg for standing nearly vertical or at an upward angle

(Using the offset-T to tilt the meter at various angles)

Alligator Clip  

  • Clip firmly to collars, ties, and other clothing
  • Clip to a hook-and-loop strap or cord

Alligator Clip on Jeans Pocket

Tie Loops  

  • Use this when you mount the meter on to a C-Stand, boom arm, pole, or any round objec

(Tie Loops on Strap)

Don't forget the built-in lanyard loop on the meter body!

Indiegogo backers get the Pro version for life (Anticipated Value $20). Retail customers will get Basic version and can purchase Pro version for an additional cost.

Check out our video demo of the app and meter working together.

The current app is a functional prototype.  We have not finalized the user interface.  That's one reason why we need your help!

(Startup screens and video metering)

(Ambient reading screens showing exposure, color temp, and chromaticity)

(Strobe reading screens showing exposure, color temp, and chromaticity)

Manage Multiple Meters

  • Compute multi-meter readings like minimum and maximum readings, average level and more

Video Modes

  • Shutter angles, f-stop, ISO, frame rate (fps)

Photography

  • Aperture, shutter speed, f-stop, ISO

Flash

  • Exposure value (aperture, ISO, f-stop and ISO)
  • Flash-to-ambient ratio

Color Temperature

  • Displays ambient and strobe color temperature individually
  • Slider to set target color temperature. Displays shows the mired color shift.
  • Use the button “Copy reading to target” to quickly pick a reading to use as a reference. Then compare other readings from different lights to the reference light. Good for matching lights.

Chromaticity Plot

  • Shows exact color coordinates of both ambient and strobe in CIE XYZ gamut (entire visible spectrum of light), with a gamut indicator triangle for sRGB
  • Shows not only color temperature, but magenta-green color shift (tint) between lights
  • Great for matching to odd lights like LEDs or fluorescents

Software Development Kit (SDK)

We are planning on releasing an SDK after our backers receive their rewards so that other innovative programmers and hardware developers can do fun and interesting things with the Illuminati Meter. We’re looking forward to what is possible when more minds apply their ideas and creativity in this space.

“As many things have changed in the medium of photography, the one constant element has been light. The quality and color of light in a photograph is what gives meaning and definition to the activity. The direction is what gives the photograph a sense of time and moment, and critical is the difference between the light and shadow. The light meter is still one of the most important tools for creative photographers to use in making their work. The Illuminati meter gives the photographer more information than we have ever had, and ways to use that information that we have only dreamed about.”

— Dennis Keeley, Chair at Art Center College of Design in Pasadena, CA

“I have been promoting the need for and importance of light meters for the past twenty years. Now for the first time, there is finally a new way to measure light and color that is affordable and accurate, with cutting edge technology. Illuminati is here and I for one will use it every day."

— Tony Corbell, Photographer/Lighting Evangelist

“Finally, a photographer’s tool that will change the way you work and simplify precision control with color and exposure using your smart device… the Illuminati. A tool for today’s professional image maker! Measure a range of mixed lighting from ambient to strobe but most important, a wealth of information and control at our fingertips at a reasonable cost."

— Eddie Tapp, M.Photog., MEI, Cr., API Certified Professional Photographer, Explorer of Light - Canon USA, Photoshop Hall of Fame, Certified Drone Pilot, Delkin ImageMaker, Triple Scoop Music, Coloratti - X-Rite, Legion of Lume, DJI Ambassador, Ilford Master Coach

We exhibited a preview of the Illuminati Meter at WPPI 2017.  

This is our first Indiegogo, but it isn’t our first rodeo...

What is ready to go?

We know how to make light meters. Our sister company, Peripheral Vision, designs and sells scientific-grade light and color meters for camera image quality testing. Their products are used by dozens of the best known camera companies all over the world, including Silicon Valley giants.

The Illuminati meter final mechanical design is complete. We already use the same plastics suppliers to make much larger and more complex parts. The electrical design is also complete.

(Exploded view)

We have working Android and Android Wear apps that all our Alpha testers love.  

Also, we’ve patented some major features in the Illuminati Meter and more patents are pending. We’ve made some real breakthroughs during development, and more are on the way.

What is next?

When we ship the meters, the iOS version will be ready for Apple iPhone and iPad owners.

Complete radio EMI/compliance testing Develop the production apps for both iOS and Android Complete production test and calibration.

Why We Need your Help

We’ve spent our own money prototyping the ideas and iterating forward to turn an idea into a real working product. But funding mass production includes making plastic molds, regulatory testing, production testing and calibration processes, retail packaging, app user interface design and coding, and more. These all come at a cost.

By backing our project, we’ll have the proper funds to bring this truly innovative product to you, the people who most believe that possible is worth supporting. Please help us bring the dream to life.

(Development & Production Schedule)

Illuminati Instruments was founded in 2017 by Michael Okincha. Michael designed the electronics and wrote the firmware.

Michael knows how to build cameras. He has worked on all types of cameras - scientific, medical, DSLRs, mobile phone cameras, security, automotive, and video conferencing systems.

He worked in many technical, marketing, and management roles at companies such as Foveon, Agilent, Flextronics, and Omnivision. Michael designed and managed the first camera with Foveon's X3 sensor technology, the Sigma SD9.

In 2010 Michael founded Peripheral Vision (PV), a camera design consulting business. PV has helped over sixty clients, including the largest manufacturers in Silicon Valley, develop products with cameras. PV also develops automated camera test systems. The PV team includes a broad range of skills, including hardware, firmware, software, production testing, color science, and optics.

One of PV's services is camera image quality testing.  As part of that work, PV developed a line of light & color meters, including the Isolight and Puck meters. The Illuminati meter is based on that work.

Rudy Guttosch was raised in a family-owned commercial photography business and spent several years in digital imaging sales and development at Hasselblad USA and its parent company in Sweden. Most recently, he worked at digital image sensor developer Foveon. He holds BS/MS degrees in Imaging Science from Rochester Institute of Technology.

Tom Walker is a product designer with over 25 years experience. Now based in Asia but with extensive experience working with international clients, both Blue Chip and other projects, such as the 3Doodler.

We’ve been working on this for over three years. We’re really confident we can bring this product to market and grateful for your support backing our project or even telling someone you know who loves photography, filmmaking or creating content. We appreciate you!

Our pledge to you: We will communicate openly and honestly about the process with our backer community.

Disclaimer: iPhone, Apple, Apple logo and Android, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Lightroom, Foveon, Agilent, Flextronics, Omnivision, Hasselblad, and 3Doodler are all registered trademarks of their respective owners.
story_txt:
About this projectThe physical design of light meters hasn’t changed much in the last few decades. And using a light meter hasn’t changed either - it has always been a very inefficient process.  The photographer carries the meter into the set, takes a measurement, and then returns to fiddle with the lights or camera. And repeat. With all the advances in sensor technology and electronic design, we felt that smartphone infrastructure could be harnessed to create a new, breakthrough meter design that delivers accurate measurements with incredibly improved productivity as well.We took that idea to photographers and filmmakers to learn more about their needs.  We brainstormed and devised a truly unique light meter.  
We included features that would help the photographer get the right exposure and white balance faster – improving productivity on the set and reducing editing time spent fixing exposure and color issues.
We made the meter measure light and color, avoiding the need to buy two separate devices.
We separated the light sensor from the controls and display, and then replaced the controls & display with a device everyone already carries - a smartphone.  That made the meter smaller, lower cost, and more convenient.
We also developed one of the best reasons for photographers to own a smartwatch - providing light and color readings right to your wrist.  That leaves your hands free to adjusts lights, carry your camera, interact with the talent, or whatever else you need to do.  Now the meter can even watch the light while you’re busy, warning you when something important changes.  
The result of all this work is the Illuminati Meter: a compact device for measuring light and color.  But it really functions as your lighting assistant – helping you be more productive, more engaged with your subject. That allows you to concentrate on creating beautiful images.Whether you create moving or still images the Illuminati light and color meter helps you measure the light in your scene – all kinds of light - efficiently and accurately. The small, lightweight meter is controlled by your smartphone using the Illuminati meter app which will be available for both Apple iOS and Android phones. Color temperature and exposure readings are transmitted from the meter to your smartphone using Bluetooth wireless technology. If you have a smartwatch paired with your smartphone, the meter readings show up there as well for a hands-free metering experience.The meter measures exposure and color temperature from continuous sources such as LEDs, halogen, HMI, and, of course, the sun. It also measures strobes, giving you the correct exposure and color temperature - and it will even measure strobe duration. It also has a strobe + ambient mode to help you balance the exposure and also the color of the light. You can also connect multiple Illuminati meters to your smartphone and monitor multiple light simultaneously.The illuminati light and color meter also offers several convenient mounting options including a ¼-20 socket, a lanyard channel, and a rare-earth magnet on the back which can be used with to mount the meter directly to metal objects, or with the set of Illuminati magnetic mounting attachments.This is the first time all these features have been available in a light metering product at such an attractive price: $249 + shipping on Indiegogo right now.We’re dedicated to advancing your ability to make your vision come to life with simple, powerful imaging and exposure measurement tools. The Illuminati Wireless Meter is designed to be the most versatile light and color meter ever available. We plan to keep expanding its capabilities beyond the initial release with new app features and firmware updates. This is one gadget you won’t want to leave behind.If you want to master photography to capture your life, adventures, or for your profession, you need to get your color and exposure right. To get those really great photos, you have to stop shooting under just the ambient light, and really take control. You can't rely on your camera’s automatic options to give the look you want. The Illuminati meter gives all the information you, the modern creator, needs. We save you time and give you the confidence to focus on what matters–your vision.We hope you agree, and want to join us in the pursuit of amazing photos and video. Continue reading to discover all the features and capabilities of the Illuminati Meter, as well as technical specifications. You can also watch some helpful demo videos made by our team and pro-photographers who’ve had the chance to beta test the meter. Finally, read what the media has to say about Illuminati Meter.If you have any questions or comments, be sure to contact us. We’re excited to bring our product to you and can’t wait to see how it helps photographers and videographers around the world."Light makes photography. Embrace light. Admire it. Love it. But above all, know light. Know it for all you are worth, and you will know the key to photography."  — George Eastman Illuminati Meter plus Android Phone (iOS available, too!) The Illuminati meter is the world's first Bluetooth light and color meter that works wirelessly with smartphones.  Traditional light meters combine the sensor and display into one bulky device.  The Illuminati meter discards all that extra weight and keeps only the most critical parts.  Small and wireless, you place the Illuminati meter anywhere in your scene.  It sends readings in real time to your phone or smartwatch while you are free to stay behind your camera or adjust lights.The Illuminati meter can also continuously monitor the ambient lighting and color. User-programmable alarms will warn you if the brightness changes because of a cloud floating overhead or the color temperature changes during the golden hour. Always know your lighting and get more good shots under changing conditions.The Illuminati meter is also the first system to let you use multiple sensors simultaneously. You can meter foregrounds and backgrounds, set strobe ratios, or monitor and manage multiple light sources (including flash!) or large areas at the same time. Stop wasting valuable time running between lights or scene locations.You can even use your smartwatch to trigger the meters remotely, monitor readings constantly and receive critical notifications about exposure or color shifts. You can get readings continuously without ever having to take out your phone or put your camera down. We’re first to do that, too!Best of all, it’s simple to use and small. Check it out:(Anatomy of an Illuminati meter) No sweat. Here is a video we made in our office in Santa Clara, CA.Tech Specs 
One (1) Illuminati Bluetooth Light and Color Meter
One (1) Storage/Carry Case
One (1) Professional version of the Illuminati App ($20 Anticipated Value after Indiegogo)
One (1) Offset Finger-T Accessory Clip. Can be rotated to tilt the meter at different angles
One (1) Alligator Accessory Clip. Affix to clothes, hook-and-loop straps, etc
Two (2) AAA alkaline batteries (TBD)

(Using the offset-T to tilt the meter at various angles)Alligator Clip

Clip to a hook-and-loop strap or cord
Alligator Clip on Jeans PocketTie Loops  Use this when you mount the meter on to a C-Stand, boom arm, pole, or any round objec(Tie Loops on Strap)Don't forget the built-in lanyard loop on the meter body!Indiegogo backers get the Pro version for life (Anticipated Value $20). Retail customers will get Basic version and can purchase Pro version for an additional cost.Check out our video demo of the app and meter working together.The current app is a functional prototype.  We have not finalized the user interface.  That's one reason why we need your help!(Startup screens and video metering)(Ambient reading screens showing exposure, color temp, and chromaticity)(Strobe reading screens showing exposure, color temp, and chromaticity)Manage Multiple MetersCompute multi-meter readings like minimum and maximum readings, average level and moreVideo ModesShutter angles, f-stop, ISO, frame rate (fps)PhotographyAperture, shutter speed, f-stop, ISOFlash
Exposure value (aperture, ISO, f-stop and ISO)
Flash-to-ambient ratio
Color Temperature
Displays ambient and strobe color temperature individually
Slider to set target color temperature. Displays shows the mired color shift.
Use the button “Copy reading to target” to quickly pick a reading to use as a reference. Then compare other readings from different lights to the reference light. Good for matching lights.
Chromaticity Plot
Shows exact color coordinates of both ambient and strobe in CIE XYZ gamut (entire visible spectrum of light), with a gamut indicator triangle for sRGB
Shows not only color temperature, but magenta-green color shift (tint) between lights
Great for matching to odd lights like LEDs or fluorescents
Software Development Kit (SDK)We are planning on releasing an SDK after our backers receive their rewards so that other innovative programmers and hardware developers can do fun and interesting things with the Illuminati Meter. We’re looking forward to what is possible when more minds apply their ideas and creativity in this space.“As many things have changed in the medium of photography, the one constant element has been light. The quality and color of light in a photograph is what gives meaning and definition to the activity. The direction is what gives the photograph a sense of time and moment, and critical is the difference between the light and shadow. The light meter is still one of the most important tools for creative photographers to use in making their work. The Illuminati meter gives the photographer more information than we have ever had, and ways to use that information that we have only dreamed about.”— Dennis Keeley, Chair at Art Center College of Design in Pasadena, CA“I have been promoting the need for and importance of light meters for the past twenty years. Now for the first time, there is finally a new way to measure light and color that is affordable and accurate, with cutting edge technology. Illuminati is here and I for one will use it every day."— Tony Corbell, Photographer/Lighting Evangelist“Finally, a photographer’s tool that will change the way you work and simplify precision control with color and exposure using your smart device… the Illuminati. A tool for today’s professional image maker! Measure a range of mixed lighting from ambient to strobe but most important, a wealth of information and control at our fingertips at a reasonable cost."— Eddie Tapp, M.Photog., MEI, Cr., API Certified Professional Photographer, Explorer of Light - Canon USA, Photoshop Hall of Fame, Certified Drone Pilot, Delkin ImageMaker, Triple Scoop Music, Coloratti - X-Rite, Legion of Lume, DJI Ambassador, Ilford Master CoachWe exhibited a preview of the Illuminati Meter at WPPI 2017.  This is our first Indiegogo, but it isn’t our first rodeo...What is ready to go?We know how to make light meters. Our sister company, Peripheral Vision, designs and sells scientific-grade light and color meters for camera image quality testing. Their products are used by dozens of the best known camera companies all over the world, including Silicon Valley giants.The Illuminati meter final mechanical design is complete. We already use the same plastics suppliers to make much larger and more complex parts. The electrical design is also complete.(Exploded view)We have working Android and Android Wear apps that all our Alpha testers love.  Also, we’ve patented some major features in the Illuminati Meter and more patents are pending. We’ve made some real breakthroughs during development, and more are on the way.What is next?When we ship the meters, the iOS version will be ready for Apple iPhone and iPad owners.Complete radio EMI/compliance testing Develop the production apps for both iOS and Android Complete production test and calibration.Why We Need your HelpWe’ve spent our own money prototyping the ideas and iterating forward to turn an idea into a real working product. But funding mass production includes making plastic molds, regulatory testing, production testing and calibration processes, retail packaging, app user interface design and coding, and more. These all come at a cost.By backing our project, we’ll have the proper funds to bring this truly innovative product to you, the people who most believe that possible is worth supporting. Please help us bring the dream to life.(Development & Production Schedule)Illuminati Instruments was founded in 2017 by Michael Okincha. Michael designed the electronics and wrote the firmware.Michael knows how to build cameras. He has worked on all types of cameras - scientific, medical, DSLRs, mobile phone cameras, security, automotive, and video conferencing systems.He worked in many technical, marketing, and management roles at companies such as Foveon, Agilent, Flextronics, and Omnivision. Michael designed and managed the first camera with Foveon's X3 sensor technology, the Sigma SD9.In 2010 Michael founded Peripheral Vision (PV), a camera design consulting business. PV has helped over sixty clients, including the largest manufacturers in Silicon Valley, develop products with cameras. PV also develops automated camera test systems. The PV team includes a broad range of skills, including hardware, firmware, software, production testing, color science, and optics.One of PV's services is camera image quality testing.  As part of that work, PV developed a line of light & color meters, including the Isolight and Puck meters. The Illuminati meter is based on that work.Rudy Guttosch was raised in a family-owned commercial photography business and spent several years in digital imaging sales and development at Hasselblad USA and its parent company in Sweden. Most recently, he worked at digital image sensor developer Foveon. He holds BS/MS degrees in Imaging Science from Rochester Institute of Technology.Tom Walker is a product designer with over 25 years experience. Now based in Asia but with extensive experience working with international clients, both Blue Chip and other projects, such as the 3Doodler.We’ve been working on this for over three years. We’re really confident we can bring this product to market and grateful for your support backing our project or even telling someone you know who loves photography, filmmaking or creating content. We appreciate you!Our pledge to you: We will communicate openly and honestly about the process with our backer community.Disclaimer: iPhone, Apple, Apple logo and Android, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Lightroom, Foveon, Agilent, Flextronics, Omnivision, Hasselblad, and 3Doodler are all registered trademarks of their respective owners.

story:
“SLOPES” is the world's first polyhedron support for GoPro. Thanks for its polyhedron bottom and 3-in-1 slot, “SLOPES” provides 20 different ways to put your GoPro, with a body even smaller than a GoPro housing. No tripod is needed any longer.

Compatibility
GoPro Hero4 Silver/Black
GoPro Hero3+ Silver/Black
GoPro Hero3 White/Silver/Black

 

3-in-1 slot

 

polyhedron bottom

The angle of each slope is clearly marked with digits.

 

The high-rise sample image above was taken with a GoPro in the SLOPES' vertical slot, standing by the 30°  slope.

 

The 20 positions of SLOPES take different conditions into consideration, including: 7 landscape pitches, 8 portrait pitches and 4 rolls. When you want to keep it flat on the ground, but be afraid of scratching your GoPro(especialy the version who has a back LCD screen), the upward mode will be helpful.

 

 

 

 

 

 

SLOPES provides unrivaled positioning speed. All you need to do is to plug and place, which could be finished in 2 seconds.

 

 

Ultra fast setup will strengthen your faith to capture.

Even gloved hand could handle it.

 

Ultra slim body enable shooting in smaller space.

 

 

You can use it almost everywhere should there be a small piece of platform. The whole world would be your tripod!

 

 

 

 

Side joints allows you to connect two stands side by side for 3D shooting.

 

 

 

Shoot your own 3D movies (The medium/narrow field of view and 60FPS or higher  is recommended.) Make a red/cyan 3D or any other types. Have fun!

 

 

 

 

 

Natrual composition will be made from the views with similar angle.
Being able to duplicate the exact same angle is truly a time saver.

 

 

 

SLOPES can provide ultra-low viewpoint!

 

 

 

Without housing, it avoids issues like low quality audio recording, lens glare and overheating.

 

 

 

Connect more stands with their side joints, enabling special visual effects like ”bullet time”.  More SLOPES, more fun!

 

 

 

Look who's talking about SLOPES!

 

 

For more info, please visit our official website: www.rogeti.com

THANK YOU !

story:
Vimble S is the gimbal for your mobile phone. It is an intelligent monopod that keeps your phone stable no matter how much you move your hands, even when you are walking or on a skateboard. No longer do you need fancy, expensive equipment to create seamless videos and photos; professional, quality content is at your fingertips with just your smartphone and a Vimble S. With our dedication, we spared no effort to ensure a user-friendly and ergonomic experience.

Moreover, to ensure the product quality and supply, we’ve partnered with Feiyu Tech, a leading gimbal manufacturer, to produce a user-friendly, ergonomic experience.

We want to keep the best of our memory by recording, documenting and taking photos. Your child's first piano performance, first family gathering, wedding and many and many adventures that you want to tell the world.

There are 32 million hours of video uploaded to Youtube every year. There are 880 billion photos taken each year. That's why we want to create a device that will help us all create the best videos and record our awesome moments seamlessly. 

Hardware

Quick setup - Slip in your phone, get the Vimble S started and begin to record. Never lose memorable moments.

Superior stabilization - Vimble S’s 3-axis stabilization system fully integrates itself with the smartphone to cancel out movement in 3 directions, keeping the smartphone still even when your hands shake.

Integrated control panel - Utilizing an intelligent design, Vimble S’s control panel requires only one hand to effortlessly operate the gimbal and change the camera's settings.

Quality manufacturing - We spent great effort in the key areas of production and monitor the every single process ourselves to ensure the seamless quality.

Flexible orientation - Vimble S allows you to easily maneuver your phone in a standard, portrait, underslung or flash light orientation.

UX-focused engineering  

 

Software

Our very own ViCam App, available for iOS and Android, enables Bluetooth connectivity (BLE) between your smartphone and the gimbal. Within our app, we’ve developed the following special features to optimize your Vimble S experience:

Time-lapse - Create a beautiful montage of passing time in video or photo form with a few simple clicks.

Face tracking tool - The Vimble S will recognize and follow the movement of a face (perfect for vlogging!) even as it moves out of the camera’s range. Works both when the unit is freestanding or handheld.

180° Panorama - The panorama mode in our ViCam app effortlessly commands your Vimble S to stably rotate itself a full 180 degrees and capture your surroundings in a perfect panoramic shot.

Selfie - using front or rotated back camera and burst mode.

Low light mode - Vimble S’s Night Mode allows you take crisp, noise-free nighttime photography with continuous 0.5 second exposure shooting.

Other features 

Family and friends’ personal paparazzi - you enjoy looking back on every holiday, celebration, birthday and the people that made it special.

The outdoor enthusiast - you love to capture the picturesque scenery from your latest adventure.

The aspiring director - record your crazy adventures simply with Vimble S and create amazing artworks.

The passionate vlogger - you want to share with your fans the latest updates of your life and live stream the moments.

In Aug 2014, Rian came up with an idea of inventing a smartphone stabilizer. Not only did he want to make it easy to use but also affordable for everyone. Rian started working on designs and making prototypes as a hobby, and when he saw the results, he wanted to share it with all photographers and videographers.

Aug 2015, first industrial design

Jan 2016, CES in Las Vegas, first US exhibition

Jun 2016, Vimble X came into reality

Jul 2016, first batch of Vimble X

From July 2016 to present, we have been working tirelessly in early stages of Vimble S prototype. We focused most of our research and development on some brand new features and also the enhancement in the key functionalities and design.

Team experience: Our team has a range of experience from mechanical computing and electronic engineering to business education. At the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, we realized we shared the same passion to create a product that will help people capture pictures and videos in an easy way, and at a low price.

Risks and challenges

Supply chain 
Our team has formed a partnership with Feiyu Tech, a leading manufacture in the mobile gimbal market. Delay of production and distribution tends to happen to many companies. If that ever happens, we promise you that we will be honest and transparent about the situations. However, with Feiyu Tech’s strong production capability and capacity, we have faith that we will deliver our product on schedule.

Product quality 
To make every single product function perfectly is impossible. However, our team is collaborating with one of the leading mobile gimbal companies in the industry, Feiyu Tech. We will closely work with Feiyu Tech to carefully ensure the best quality in each and every unit we product!

story:
How many times have you wanted to take a picture or video on the sly? Now, with Meerkat, you can do that and much more.

When we made the first prototypes of the Meerkat Mirror, everyone we showed it to was super-enthused about it. So we knew we had to make this awesome invention available to anyone. We've only scratched the surface--we can't wait to see what fun and clever uses for Meerkat you come up with.

Your contribution will bring us one step closer to production. Indiegogo funds will enable us to get tooling made to produce Meerkat as a high-quality, low cost US-made product.

As a contributor, you'll have a unique place in the launch of this trendsetting project. You'll know that you helped make it possible, with your name on our Friends of Meerkat page and of course our endless thanks. Better yet, the first Meerkat Mirrors available to the public will be reserved exclusively for our indiegogo contributors--so you'll get your hands on it before anyone else.

Make your contribution today. Then tell 5 friends about Meerkat, Tweet about it, share it on Facebook, and invite them to do the same. 'Stealth mode' is fun. So is making Meerkat one of the most successful indiegogo projects ever. Let's get it started!

In Black & White AND COLOR

Meerkats will be molded in tough ABS plastic. You have your choice of Black or White, and you can custom colorize YOUR Meerkat with any of TEN COLOR SKINS! Every Meerkat comes with ALL 10 color skins.

Meerkats molded in BLACK:

Merrekats molded in WHITE:

New! Camouflage skin! Included with every Meerkat!:


The Technical Stuff

Meerkat's mirror is high quality glass, not plastic. So it will resist scratches and last a long, long time. The mirror is sized and shaped to maximize the image and minimize vignetting--in most applications, it gives you same full image as your smartphone camera.

Meerkat attaches easily to most smartphones (even if you have a protective case) with a rugged but removable adhesive strip.  When you're not using it, it quickly folds flat. Thin and out of the way, you'll hardly know it's there:



Mirror Image

The image from Meerkat is flipped, because it's a mirror-image (of course!). In most cases that doesn't matter, but if you want, you can flip the image with our free MeerFlip app, available for Apple as well as Android phones.

See us on

Digital Trends

CrowdFundFusion

All iStuff

Spy Goodies

iPhoneness

TechMASH

story:
An experienced Indiegogo team is back!
This time we proudly present you OMNIO LAMP.

Originally conceived as a portrait and item photography lamp, Omnio Lamp turned into the most versatile lighting instrument ever.

Like no other lamp, Omnio Lamp has 4 pivoting arms, built-in barn doors, 264 finest LEDs providing a staggering 4200 Lumens of professional, flicker-free light, and a CRI 98.9 for skin tones. It gives light from 4 different sides at the same time. A programmable and intuitive 12 button display enables accurate control of brightness and color temperature with ease. The lamp is portable, maneuverable and adaptable with standard tripods, holders and hooks. 

In other words: Omnio Lamp is an entire professional studio in your hands giving you endless lighting possibilities exactly where and how you need it.

 

Talking about us





4 pivoting arms with built-in LEDs.

FOUR pivoting arms give SOFT light from FOUR DIFFERENT sides. With 264 built-in LEDs totaling 4200 Lumens of lights, there are no more technical restrains.

Built-in barn doors.

Built-in barn doors open to full 120 degrees angle. When inverted, each arm gives 2 rays of light in opposite directions: one direct and sharp and the other-reflected and very diffused.

Rotating arms for endless possibilities.

Choose between wide beam light when open or thin and precise when nearly closed. 
 

Premium flicker free light.

With broad color temperature and accurate brightness control, you get premium flicker-free light at any brightness level, shutter speed or frame rate.

Tungsten to daylight.

From tungsten to daylight: 2700K fixed, in a range from 3150-5700K adjustable with a step of 25, and fixed 6300K( Kelvin). Brightness control 0-100 with a step of 1 (with fast forward). Accurate color temperature through the entire dimming range. 

Mighty CRI: Only sun gives better light.

Omnio Lamp has median Color Rendering Index (CRI) > 95 and CRI 98,9 for skin tones. Only sun gives better light. Just think about all the possibilities!

Paint with light AND shadows.


Change mood in a split second. Shape light with ease and precision by simply twisting your palm or pressing one button.


SPREAD THE WORD!

Use the Indiegogo SHARE tools on top of the page 
to help us spread word!




Programmable Intuitive Display Control.

An Intuitive, smart and programmable 12 button display is your new game field and a true game changer. Adjust brightness and color temperature to your liking. When you find your favorite light setup, save it in on the home button (press & hold for 3 seconds). Need different light? Go ahead make changes in brightness and color temperature, turn/off separate arms, you can always get back to last saved setup by a short click. Want to save new setup instead of old one? Press & hold for 3 seconds again. Your new set up is now saved.

 

Standard 1/4'' Mounting Socket.



Standard 1/4'' - 20 mounting socket enables you to place or mount a lamp directly onto standard light stands, tripods or arms. Socket is also used to attach accessories like batteries, extended 5th arm, hooks, handles and more.


 

DC adapter. Rechargeable battery block. Or BOTH.

Omnio Lamp operates from DC adapter, a rechargeable battery block, or both. Rechargeable battery block consists of our battery housing and 9xAA NIMH batteries of your choice. You don't need to take batteries out of housing to charge them. You can plug in battery block into the lamp while it is connected to an adapter.

Lamp will be operating from adapter via battery block, and batteries will be charging at the same time. Like a laptop, you can unplug lamp with battery from adapter at any time and go. If there is no need for battery block, you can plug the adapter directly into the lamp. And, of course, you can always charge battery block separately from the lamp by plugging to adapter directly.   

• Adapter input: 100-240VAC, 50/60Hz 1,4-0.7A

• Output: 15V 4A, 60W

• Optional car 12V socket cable

• Power socket standard 2.1x5.5mm


 

PORTABLE.

Lightweight and foldable Omnio Lamp stands anywhere. Fold the lamp with one hand and you are ready to go!

Made to last & impress.

Rigid metal housing. Industrial-grade plastics. Anodized aluminum hands. Stainless steel for the strength of pivoting parts and joints. Lightweight bamboo. Custom electronic systems. All made for optimal performance and great style.


 

Embraced with adapter(s).

The light is soft, almost without shadows, but in case you still need a softbox, we’ve prepared adapters for Elinchrom and Bowens standards.



Use special effects for any scenario you might have. All programs are controlled by speed (frequency), brightness and color temperature. Use filters to add different colors or to make light beam even bigger.

 

Enlighten anything you're working on.

 Intelligent and beautiful, powerful and unexpected Omnio Lamp has no limits.  For anything requiring light, Omnio Lamp will provide the perfect setting: Interview, photo of video shoot, Advanced portrait photography, object shoot (great for e-commerce), reading and working, outdoor filming or beautiful decor.


The unlimited possibilities of Omnio Lamp

Use Omnio Lamp anywhere: professional filming, photo &video production, range of home and office tasks. Use it as a filming or commercial lamp, table or floor lamp or decor.

Omnio Lamp is made for all of us who love professional yet practical products; who want versatility without sacrificing quality.


 

Super Early Bird OMNIO LAMP KIT
$415 [56% OFF]
All you need for your lighting needs. Makes your work and life easier.
Items included: Omnio lamp + hook + battery housing + mounting pin + short mounting pin + DC adapter 60W 15V 5 meter
Estimated delivery: February 2019

$1120 [40% OFF]
All you need for your lighting needs DOUBLED.
Makes your work and life TWOx easier.
Items included: 2x (Omnio lamp + hook + battery housing + mounting pin + short mounting pin + DC adapter 60W 15V 5 meter)
Estimated delivery: February 2019

x3 INDIEGOGO OMNIO LAMP KIT
$1665 [41% OFF]
All you need for your lighting needs TRIPLED.
Makes your work and life THREEx easier.
Items included: 3x(Omnio lamp + hook + battery housing + mounting pin + short mounting pin + DC adapter 60W 15V 5 meter)
Estimated delivery: February 2019

Light our Way $10
You love OMNIO LAMP and want to be part of our story, but can't pledge for a full product. We appreciate your support and will feel your love! We will send regular updates and shout LOVE, LIGHT and THANK YOUs to internet universe and social network universum. We will regularly update you on our progress and news.
 

ADDITIONAL BATTERY HOUSING
$79 [34% OFF]
Two is always better than one.  Makes your work and life easier.
No separate shipping. Only available with Omnio Lamp kits.
Items included: battery housing + mounting pin
Estimated delivery: February 2019

No separate shipping.  Only available with Omnio Lamp kits.

$24

$22
Extension cord from adapter to the lamp. Makes your work and life easier.
No separate shipping.  Only available with Omnio Lamp kits.
