story:
What is the ULH?

 

 

 A black silicone cone that will stretch fit to any lens, the Ultimate Lens Hood is an incredibly versatile bit of kit. Attach facing forwards to block out unwanted glare and reflections when shooting through a window, or fit backwards to protect your equipment from the elements.

The 60mm diameter for the ULH refers to your lens BODY size, NOT the filter size. If you have a 58mm filter, then you will want the full size ULH as the lens body will be larger. 

 What does it do?

Removing glare by day and reflections by night, the ULH can be used any time you need it. Whether you're shooting through a hotel window, a high-rise observation deck, the window of a bus or through an enclosure at the zoo - the ULH makes a massive difference, transforming a bad photo into a great one even before you start editing! 

 

 

  • Fits to your lens, rather than attaching to the glass. This means you're free to move around, change your angle and adjust your camera settings without having to detach anything. 
  • Leaves no marks on the window. This'll keep you on the good side of venue managers and their staff! The ULH is made of silicone, and is designed to rest against the glass, rather than attach to it.
  • Perfect for crowded areas. Often the busiest tourist attractions leave very little room - or time - for great images. With the ULH on your lens, you take up no more room than you would normally, but your photos will come out better than anyone else's. 
  • Get drone-looking shots, without a drone. Ok, this one is a bit of a stretch, but you'll get such clear photos out of high-rise buildings that people won't believe they were taken through glass at all. Most cities around the world have banned the use of drones, so this is your next best option to get those cityscape bangers! (also works through helicopter windows...)
  • Much more effective than a CPL. Polarising filters are known to modify and remove some reflections at certain angles but don't work to fully block the glare (especially at night). A good quality CPL is expensive, they change the colours in your photo and you'll need adapter rings to fit them to all your lenses. If you already own a CPL, add the ULH to your kit bag and get the best of both! (and the added weatherproofing the ULH provides!)

 

 

Who is it for?

The ULH is a must-have accessory for photographers, filmmakers, and travellers alike. It's one of those things that while you may not use it every day, it'll earn its place in your bag in no time at all. If you've ever wanted landscape photos through a window, a time-lapse of take off and landing, or the perfect shot of a tiger at the zoo - the Ultimate Lens Hood is for you. (unintentional rhyme there.)

 

 

 How do I use it?

The ULH can be used freehand or on a tripod. The freedom to move around without any complicated setup is a real bonus in popular tourist locations and zoos where lots of wandering people make available space limited. Not to mention many of these venues have banned tripods entirely. 

 

 

With options to stretch directly over the lens itself, or onto your existing rigid hood, the ULH will fit any lens body diameter upwards of 60mm. You can tilt your camera to shoot at a massive range of angles, and even use wide lenses. (*fit-tested up to 128mm - Canon 200mm F2.0. Wide tested to 16mm at full frame with no problems)

Shown above stretched over the 115mm diameter hood from the Canon 100-400 lens, the ULH could comfortably stretch even further. There is also a smaller version called the ULHmini for all smaller lenses and cameras (inc. Moment, ExoLens & Lemuro)

 

 

There are a huge range of lenses out there, so that's why the ULH is launching in two sizes. Generally speaking, if you're shooting with a DSLR, Mirrorless or Bridge camera then you'll likely be needing the full size ULH.

 

 

 If you shoot with a smaller camera, your smartphone (with a Moment, Lemuro or Olloclip-type lens), or a pocket point and shoot then you're likely to be needing the ULHmini. (see below)

 

 

 The easiest way to find out is to measure your lens body diameter, or look at the specification on the manufactures website. It's not the filter size you need to measure, it is the overall body width. 

If you're unsure which size is right for you email  Support@UltimateLensHood.com and I'll get the answer to you!

 

 

Be prepared to be questioned by everyone about where you got the ULH, because anyone that sees it in action wishes they had one! Finding people to help demonstrate the ULH certainly wasn't a challenge, and no members of staff at test locations have ever made any complaints. 

 

 

Whether you're using a Moment lens on your smartphone, a point and shoot camera (such as Canon G7X or Sony RX100), or a lens too small for the full size ULH - the ULHmini is what you need take incredible photos through glass and cut out that reflection.

 

 

The ULHmini works in the exact same way as its bigger brother, allowing you to shoot at a wide range of angles and even use wide lenses (such as Moment 18mm). Made from the same super tough, yet stretchy silicone, the ULHmini can be fitted to lens diameters from 25-60mm with ease. It will also help weatherproof most point and shoot cameras too!

 

 

 It wouldn't be a truly versatile piece of equipment unless it did more than one thing. For those not shooting in an urban environment all that often, the ULH makes a brilliant cover to help protect your camera from the elements.  

 

 

While not a completely watertight solution, fitting the ULH in reverse does add a lot of protection to your setup. Whether it be rain or spray, mud or snow, sand or gravel - the ULH keeps all unwanted debris off the camera and lens while maintaining easy access to all the buttons. 

 

 

ULH does not prevent anything getting onto the front element. This can be sealed up by attaching a protection (or simple UV) filter to the front of your lens, as the manufactures recommend. Crucially, the ULH will keep the camera clean and prevent any ingress into the buttons or lens mount. 

 

 

Whether you're using a weather sealed camera and lens combination or not, it doesn't hurt to have a bit of extra protection. If you're not using a weather sealed combo, it's even more important to keep it covered when in less than ideal conditions!

 

 

An unexpected but extremely useful function: The Ultimate Lens Hood makes a great changing pad. Whether you're looking to swap lenses on a rough and uneven surface, needing to put your camera down on the sand, or just looking to protect your camera from scratches when you stop for lunch - the ULH is the perfect travel companion.

 

^ check out the prototype gallery at the top of the page for more images comparing side-by-sides and the result of the ULH in a wide range of environments. 

 

 

The idea for the ULH was born from a trip to Japan back in 2015. Back then I was a snowboard instructor, and was lucky enough to travel from the UK to Japan for the best winter season of my life. Before getting started I spent a few days exploring Tokyo, and almost all of my photos from inside the many observation decks/towers turned out rubbish. [fully crap]

By day, the issue was the suns glare bouncing off the glass, and at night it was reflection from interior lights that transformed all the windows into mirrors. I could see everyone around me was struggling with the same problem, and I bet if you're still reading this far into the campaign then you've also had your fair share of these issues too!

 

 

Fast forward to now - with lots of past projects under my belt - the ULH is finally ready to launch! I have developed it through several iterations to arrive on what I fully believe to be the best combination of size, stretchiness and toughness for it to truly live up to the title of Ultimate Lens Hood.

 

 

Made from a compression moulded silicone, the initial tooling for the full size ULH is already paid for and complete. There are a few minor modifications I am planning to make. The first is to make the outer brim a little chunkier - this will help it hold its shape a bit better, and the second is to add in the ULH branding marks. The ULHmini tooling will be started during the campaign! 

 

 

One of the early discoveries was the colour: The ULH has to be black. Any other colour gives a horribly tinted vignette as it reflects the light and changes the colour of your photos. Black doesn't reflect any light, and therefore doesn't vignette or tint. Simples! 

 

 So that's pretty much everything I think there is to say on the ULH! 

As I said in the video, I am really pleased with this product and am super excited to get production started. This is far from my first Kickstarter campaign, and will definitely not be the last either! 

 

 

If you have any questions, please message me directly or comment on the campaign and I will do my best to get back to you as soon as I can! If there are frequent questions, I will add to the FAQ. 

So now you've seen the full campaign...

If you like the ULH please pick your pledge tier from the options above and share the campaign with everyone you know! I need your help to get this funded, and into the hands of filmmakers and photographers all round the world. 

Thank you for reading to the end, and thank you for your support :)
story_txt:
What is the ULH?   A black silicone cone that will stretch fit to any lens, the Ultimate Lens Hood is an incredibly versatile bit of kit. Attach facing forwards to block out unwanted glare and reflections when shooting through a window, or fit backwards to protect your equipment from the elements.The 60mm diameter for the ULH refers to your lens BODY size, NOT the filter size. If you have a 58mm filter, then you will want the full size ULH as the lens body will be larger.  What does it do?Removing glare by day and reflections by night, the ULH can be used any time you need it. Whether you're shooting through a hotel window, a high-rise observation deck, the window of a bus or through an enclosure at the zoo - the ULH makes a massive difference, transforming a bad photo into a great one even before you start editing!   

Fits to your lens, rather than attaching to the glass. This means you're free to move around, change your angle and adjust your camera settings without having to detach anything. 

Leaves no marks on the window. This'll keep you on the good side of venue managers and their staff! The ULH is made of silicone, and is designed to rest against the glass, rather than attach to it.

Perfect for crowded areas. Often the busiest tourist attractions leave very little room - or time - for great images. With the ULH on your lens, you take up no more room than you would normally, but your photos will come out better than anyone else's. 

Get drone-looking shots, without a drone. Ok, this one is a bit of a stretch, but you'll get such clear photos out of high-rise buildings that people won't believe they were taken through glass at all. Most cities around the world have banned the use of drones, so this is your next best option to get those cityscape bangers! (also works through helicopter windows...)


Much more effective than a CPL. Polarising filters are known to modify and remove some reflections at certain angles but don't work to fully block the glare (especially at night). A good quality CPL is expensive, they change the colours in your photo and you'll need adapter rings to fit them to all your lenses. If you already own a CPL, add the ULH to your kit bag and get the best of both! (and the added weatherproofing the ULH provides!)
  Who is it for?The ULH is a must-have accessory for photographers, filmmakers, and travellers alike. It's one of those things that while you may not use it every day, it'll earn its place in your bag in no time at all. If you've ever wanted landscape photos through a window, a time-lapse of take off and landing, or the perfect shot of a tiger at the zoo - the Ultimate Lens Hood is for you. (unintentional rhyme there.)   How do I use it?The ULH can be used freehand or on a tripod. The freedom to move around without any complicated setup is a real bonus in popular tourist locations and zoos where lots of wandering people make available space limited. Not to mention many of these venues have banned tripods entirely.   With options to stretch directly over the lens itself, or onto your existing rigid hood, the ULH will fit any lens body diameter upwards of 60mm. You can tilt your camera to shoot at a massive range of angles, and even use wide lenses. (*fit-tested up to 128mm - Canon 200mm F2.0. Wide tested to 16mm at full frame with no problems)Shown above stretched over the 115mm diameter hood from the Canon 100-400 lens, the ULH could comfortably stretch even further. There is also a smaller version called the ULHmini for all smaller lenses and cameras (inc. Moment, ExoLens & Lemuro)  There are a huge range of lenses out there, so that's why the ULH is launching in two sizes. Generally speaking, if you're shooting with a DSLR, Mirrorless or Bridge camera then you'll likely be needing the full size ULH.    If you shoot with a smaller camera, your smartphone (with a Moment, Lemuro or Olloclip-type lens), or a pocket point and shoot then you're likely to be needing the ULHmini. (see below)   The easiest way to find out is to measure your lens body diameter, or look at the specification on the manufactures website. It's not the filter size you need to measure, it is the overall body width. If you're unsure which size is right for you email  Support@UltimateLensHood.com and I'll get the answer to you!  Be prepared to be questioned by everyone about where you got the ULH, because anyone that sees it in action wishes they had one! Finding people to help demonstrate the ULH certainly wasn't a challenge, and no members of staff at test locations have ever made any complaints.   Whether you're using a Moment lens on your smartphone, a point and shoot camera (such as Canon G7X or Sony RX100), or a lens too small for the full size ULH - the ULHmini is what you need take incredible photos through glass and cut out that reflection.  The ULHmini works in the exact same way as its bigger brother, allowing you to shoot at a wide range of angles and even use wide lenses (such as Moment 18mm). Made from the same super tough, yet stretchy silicone, the ULHmini can be fitted to lens diameters from 25-60mm with ease. It will also help weatherproof most point and shoot cameras too!   It wouldn't be a truly versatile piece of equipment unless it did more than one thing. For those not shooting in an urban environment all that often, the ULH makes a brilliant cover to help protect your camera from the elements.    While not a completely watertight solution, fitting the ULH in reverse does add a lot of protection to your setup. Whether it be rain or spray, mud or snow, sand or gravel - the ULH keeps all unwanted debris off the camera and lens while maintaining easy access to all the buttons.   ULH does not prevent anything getting onto the front element. This can be sealed up by attaching a protection (or simple UV) filter to the front of your lens, as the manufactures recommend. Crucially, the ULH will keep the camera clean and prevent any ingress into the buttons or lens mount.   Whether you're using a weather sealed camera and lens combination or not, it doesn't hurt to have a bit of extra protection. If you're not using a weather sealed combo, it's even more important to keep it covered when in less than ideal conditions!  An unexpected but extremely useful function: The Ultimate Lens Hood makes a great changing pad. Whether you're looking to swap lenses on a rough and uneven surface, needing to put your camera down on the sand, or just looking to protect your camera from scratches when you stop for lunch - the ULH is the perfect travel companion. ^ check out the prototype gallery at the top of the page for more images comparing side-by-sides and the result of the ULH in a wide range of environments.   The idea for the ULH was born from a trip to Japan back in 2015. Back then I was a snowboard instructor, and was lucky enough to travel from the UK to Japan for the best winter season of my life. Before getting started I spent a few days exploring Tokyo, and almost all of my photos from inside the many observation decks/towers turned out rubbish. [fully crap]By day, the issue was the suns glare bouncing off the glass, and at night it was reflection from interior lights that transformed all the windows into mirrors. I could see everyone around me was struggling with the same problem, and I bet if you're still reading this far into the campaign then you've also had your fair share of these issues too!  Fast forward to now - with lots of past projects under my belt - the ULH is finally ready to launch! I have developed it through several iterations to arrive on what I fully believe to be the best combination of size, stretchiness and toughness for it to truly live up to the title of Ultimate Lens Hood.  Made from a compression moulded silicone, the initial tooling for the full size ULH is already paid for and complete. There are a few minor modifications I am planning to make. The first is to make the outer brim a little chunkier - this will help it hold its shape a bit better, and the second is to add in the ULH branding marks. The ULHmini tooling will be started during the campaign!   One of the early discoveries was the colour: The ULH has to be black. Any other colour gives a horribly tinted vignette as it reflects the light and changes the colour of your photos. Black doesn't reflect any light, and therefore doesn't vignette or tint. Simples!   So that's pretty much everything I think there is to say on the ULH! As I said in the video, I am really pleased with this product and am super excited to get production started. This is far from my first Kickstarter campaign, and will definitely not be the last either!    If you have any questions, please message me directly or comment on the campaign and I will do my best to get back to you as soon as I can! If there are frequent questions, I will add to the FAQ. So now you've seen the full campaign...If you like the ULH please pick your pledge tier from the options above and share the campaign with everyone you know! I need your help to get this funded, and into the hands of filmmakers and photographers all round the world. Thank you for reading to the end, and thank you for your support :)   For near-daily updates, behind the scenes content and more example images, follow @the_ULH on Instagram :)
  RIP to the bravest tripod I ever knew. I might have gone a BIT excessive with that spray. ULH took it like a champ, camera was totally unharmed.
 Just timelapsin' away...

story:
About us

My name is Emanuele, I’m 36, I’m married, and I’m the dad of one beautiful baby boy. My wife Romana and I are keen travellers and enthusiast photographers - in 2010 we set off on our first around the world trip and started our travel and photography blog, which you can see here: www.thesiracusas.com 

Although photography is not our first job, we make some money from it and we expect our income stream from photography to increase steadily in the near future. 

Some of our travel photography work has ended up on several publishing outlets, including a travel magazine, the Daily Mail online, and the National Geographic stock. In 2011 I received an honourable mention at the PX3, Prix de la Photographie, Paris. We also do occasional jobs as photographers for a local marketing agency and we’ve covered several local events as freelance photographers. 

Why this campaign?

One month ago thieves broke into our home and stole our gear. The  camera insurance we bought in Ireland before we set off on our extended trip expired a few months ago and we were still looking to find a suitable insurer here in Italy. So we weren't covered and fate intervened.

Apart from the shock of having been robbed, I don't know which broke our hearts more: the loss of the master files of 99% of our travel photography portfolio, or the actual financial damage, at a time when we can't afford to buy new cameras, lenses and computers. In any case, we didn't sleep for nights afterwards.

A month has passed and even though we’ve tried everything, the chances of getting our stuff back now are pretty much nonexistent.

Photography is our life passion, and we are working hard towards making it into a full time job. Now with the new responsibilities of bringing up our baby boy, the hit is even more unfortunate, and we need all the help we can get. 

A couple of friends pointed us to Indiegogo and encouraged us to start a campaign to try to recover some of the cost of buying new gear before we hit the market. We were a bit doubtful at first but then we asked another bunch of friends and they all thought starting this campaign was a good idea, given the woeful situation we’re in. 

How much you're trying to raise?

Apart from our laptops, the hard disks where our photos were stored, and some camera accessories like memory cards, replacement batteries, chargers and filters, this is what we’ve lost-

Cameras:

  • Canon 5d Mark II
  • Canon 500d

Lenses

  • Canon 24-105 f/4
  • Canon 16-35 f/2.8
  • Canon 50 f/1.8

Lights

  • Canon Speedlite 580 EX II
  • Canon Transmitter ST e2

Now, the whole damage amounts to the equivalent of about $8000, and although it would be great to raise the whole the amount through this campaign, we’re starting at $3000 which would be enough to buy a second hand full frame camera and perhaps a decent general purpose lens to live with for a while (I do need to factor in Indiegogo's and PayPal fees).

What do I get?

In exchange for your help we’re giving out some of our prints (look at the perks on the sidebar for more details) and hopefully this will make it worthwhile for you. You can pick your prints from this Flickr album, and leave us a comment or contact us privately to tell us your pick.

We bet one or more of our prints would be a great fit in your living room! 

And if I want to help further?

if you want to help us even more, please consider any of the following:

  • spread the word - share this campaign with your friends on your social networks or on email, and ask them to give us a hand
  • do you have any extra remote freelance job for us? Send it our way. We do translations (EN to PT and/or IT), instructional design, corporate training & development consultancy, photography and photography related assignments, and customer service. Any extra income is very welcome!
  • are you able to help us buy photography gear at a discounted price? Shoot us an email


Thanks for your time and contribution!

story:
This product was developed and designed for over a year with great care for the smallest of detail. We are asking for your support for our fabulous product. I believe that everyone deserves the possibility of controlling whatever he wants to see.

Do you want to see???

Do you want to control the knowledge??

Do you want to enjoy the special and magical moments even when you can't be there in person???

Do you want to feel safe??

You can have all this at this great price and only on our website!!!

All this will be in your favor, by helping us fulfill our dream.

A few words about our product – the camera:

This camera is like having a third eye, which allows you the control and the knowledge of the special times, the expected and unexpected times, the magical times, and all the little surprises on the way which make life so meaningful.


The camera is a small device that you can put anywhere and it gives you the exact picture of what is happening in the place that we would like to be. Making us a part of what is going on even without anyone knowing that we are there.

The camera has a very simple and user friendly program activation, the design is exceptional and sharing the application and the movie are simple.


The battery works for roughly 10 operational hours, the photographing uses a SIM card and doesn't have to be connected wirelessly when the network is not available.

While the camera is working you are able to take still photos in order to save a moment forever, those special important moments. With a click on your smart phone you can save it directly to you phone's memory.

story:
Introducing PBC by CDA-TEK

With all of of the First Wave backers of our previous campaign having now received their PBCs, we are now beginning a second campaign to offer the to more backers.

You can view the original campaign here 

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/pbc-blackmagic-pocket-cinema-camera-controller/x/22750367/

The PBC is a pocket sized device that enables you to control and monitor the settings of your Blackmagic Pocket Cinema camera wirelessly over Bluetooth.

The two switches on the PBC have three operational modes ; Single click, double click and long click, each of which can have a different function assigned to them.

This flexibility means you can configure the PBC to switch between controlling up to six different settings on the camera including aperture, ISO, White Balance, Auto Focus, Auto Exposure and of course start stop of recording.

The current settings of the camera are displayed on the PBC's bright daylight readable screen which you can configure in any one of four different colour schemes. In addition the screen switches to red to provide a clear visual reference when the camera is recording.

From power on, the PBC connects to your camera in under 5 seconds and its large capacity internal rechargeable battery provides over five hours of continuous run time as well as being able to powered directly by USB.

Whilst the PBC is a small handheld device it can of course be mounted to a rig or gimbal or even the camera itself using a tripod adapter rail.

As well as offering direct control of the camera functionality itself, the PBC can also be used as a wireless interface hub to incorporate both the Tilta Nucleus Nano focus wheel and our own upcoming PXP expander module (*PXP expander module will be available before the end of Q2 2020).

With the Nucleus Nano wheel in Bluteooth mode, the PBC enables you to have focus control of native and adapted EF lenses on your camera with compatible adapters without requiring gears, motors or additional power as well as being able to start and stop recording. 

As the PBC operates in tandem with the Nucleus Nano wheel, this combination offers you complete hands off control of the camera, something which is very beneficial when it is mounted on a gimbal.

Using our PXP module you can also expand the possibilities of the PBC with an additional five assignable physical switches to directly control camera functions as well as an inbuilt focus control wheel. 

When will the PBC ship?

Whether you are using the Nucleus Nano wheel or own PXP to control focus, you are able to use the PBC to store two focus points and then use the focus limiter function to prevent overshooting when transitioning between them.

All of the PBC's settings and focus control functions are fully compatible with both the Blackmagic Pocket 4K and Pocket6K cameras.

What We Need & What You Get

The PBC is feature complete from a software and hardware perspective and all of our First Wave backers have received their production units.

We are now seeking funding purely for production rather than development.

We have 3 levels of pre-order perks, each with a different discount level from the retail price of the PBC.

The first two tiers of pre-order (Very Early Bird and Early Bird) are limited to the first 5 orders for each.

About CDA-TEK

We are a small company based in Dublin, Ireland and specialise in developing custom camera control solutions.

Our 3C Android app was made available for sale in early 2019 and is a comprehensive remote control system for the Blackmagic Pocket4K Cinema Camera and has received several feature upgrades including the integration of the Tilta Nucleus Nano focus wheel.

3C will be shortly receive an update to enable it to be compatible with the Blackmagic Pocket6K Cinema Camera.

We have also shown a development version of an innovative LIDAR based continuous autofocus system that is highly anticipated by users of the Blackmagic Cinema Cameras.

The PBC will act as an interface hub between the camera and the LIDAR auto focus system.

Risks & Challenges

The PBC is feature complete from a software and hardware perspective so is a low risk project to support as the funding is purely for production of the units.

As with every project as it enters production, there may be unexpected challenges in terms of component supply and shipping delays from suppliers but as we do not have a reliance on a single supplier for any component, we are confident that this risk has been mitigated as much as possible and our First Wave campaign units were all shipped exactly on time.

story:
*Huge thanks and love to all who have contributed! :)  You can still help me and contribute as long as you see the status of my campaign as "InDemand", I have raised $862 of an $1199 stretch goal to fund a portrait lens. With your help, I can make this happen! Just select your perk and "check out"

STRETCH GOAL: PORTRAIT LENS. 71% FUNDED, $862 raised so far, $337 needed!

My stretch goal is the portrait-length Zeiss Batis 85mm f/1.8 Lens which features maximum aperture for greater focus control and enhanced low-light shooting.  As long as you see the status of my campaign as "InDemand" we can still meet this goal and I thank you in advance for your consideration, contributions as well as for continuing to share my campaign with your communities! 

I want you to know that even if we don't reach this goal that 100% of the contributions that I receive will all go towards my photography equipment goals so let's see what can be accomplished with half a month's time! Even if I can make it half way there that would be incredible as it would greatly expedite my journey to owning this amazing tool and getting to work with it :) - Jeremy

Thanks for looking at my project! My Story:

  • My name is Jeremy Glickstein.  I was born, raised and still reside in Chicago, Illinois. I am a lifelong storyteller. I come from a family of artists and creators. Art is in my blood. I am a freelance marketer and growing / aspiring photographer. 
  • My original photography has been shot mostly with a smartphone and some on borrowed digital cameras. I do not own a professional digital camera but thanks to you, I soon will. Please view my stretch goals to see how you can help expand my mission by funding a portrait lens. I have had an overwhelming response to my photos and am often being asked, "Can I get a print of this?" and "Are you doing professional gigs yet?" and "Are you going to have any gallery shows soon?"  I am asking for your help to get me on the road to making all of this happen. I work extremely hard on my local marketing business and accomplishing this will greatly help me add to my creative efforts across the board.
  • Not only will this aid me in establishing myself as a photographer but it will allow me to meet the growing demand from my community and produce high quality prints of my work as well as potentially land professional gigs and gallery showings. It will also allow me to add a new photography service to my freelance marketing business.


My Campaign Goals & What Perks Are Available 

  •  SO WHAT DID MY INITIAL $ ASK COVER?  

    -1 full frame, professional level Sony A7 camera body
    -1 professional level 55m Zeiss lens
    -Memory card & backup battery
    -Insurance for the camera and lens

*Why the Sony A7? It is the most affordable beginner full frame camera available from my favorite camera company and will be an amazing tool to start with. 
*Why a 55mm lens? Because it is a solid, medium focal length that will give me some flexibility to work with, especially for my style of street photography. 
Now that my initial goal has been funded, I'm so excited to share my stretch goals for additional lenses and equipment to build up my arsenal for different projects and services!  :)

  • PERKS!!! I am extra excited about my pledge perks because for the limited time of my project I am going to make some of my mobile/Instagram photos that started the fire for this project available to YOU! There are some cool companies that will place small versions of Instagram images on different promo items like magnets, 4" x 4" metal frames and nifty photo books. HINT: If I reach my stretch goals and then get over-funded, I will unlock new perks that will include prints shot with the new camera!!! Fingers crossed! (*PLEASE NOTE THAT IF WANT A PLEDGE REWARD SENT TO YOU THAT YOU NEED TO ACTUALLY CLAIM A PERK  WHEN CHECKING OUT SO THAT I KNOW THIS AND HAVE YOUR MAILING ADDRESS. THANK YOU!)
  • If I don't reach my initial goal, don't fret! You can rest assured that the funds raised will go into my savings account while I work on gathering the rest of the budget!

The Impact

  • I believe that my project is valuable to the contributor and to the world because I already have demand for professional prints, offers to buy my work as well as participate in event photography and have gotten a lot of questions about when I may have gallery showings. But of course, I can't do this until I have the proper equipment and training. Additionally, there are stores and merchants in the Chicagoland area who have expressed interest in displaying my work for sale once I have high quality prints available. I truly believe that I have a creative message to spread with my photography and I hope you see potential in my work as well!
  • I invite you to view all of my work on my Instagram account. It's really an amazing and supportive community and I have learned so much from my Insta-friends! https://www.instagram.com/weareagenius/ As you view it, please imagine where my photography can scale to with premium equipment upgrades.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You can share this page on your social media accounts!
  • You can email this page to your friends!
Thanks for your time and consideration, here's to making some art happen! 
-Jeremy
*A very special thank you goes out to my awesome friend Bryan Y. Schulz of http://fastvideomedia.com/ for helping me out and making my campaign video! Please consider checking out his website for your video production needs.

story: I have been a photographer most of my life. I have always preferred landscape and wildlife photography to people, but over the last few years I have started shooting more conventions and events. I shoot with a group of like minded 'togs in Atlanta that go by, Guy Behind The Camera. Please continue to support all your various charities, but if you have any left over, please consider helping a budding photographer out. Anything is appreciated.

I have always preferred landscape and wildlife photography to people, but over the last few years I have started shooting more conventions and events. I shoot with a group of like minded 'togs in Atlanta that go by, Guy Behind The Camera. Please continue to support all your various charities, but if you have any left over, please consider helping a budding photographer out. Anything is appreciated.

story:
Hello!

My name is Dustin Lane and I am 17 years old. I began practicing and studying photography when I was 13 and I now feel that I am nearly ready to become a professional photographer. My dream is to be able to travel the world and document that beautiful thing called 'life'. 
Currently, I am attending school in the morning and working a job in the afternoon to save up for a car. In just under a year I am hoping to be able to set off on my journey, but I have a problem; I don't have the photography equipment I need and what I need is quite expensive, especially with my low income.

All I need is a good camera to start me out. I can invest in the other equipment later.
A new camera would give me this:
  • A better source of income
  • Equipment that would allow me to be more creative
  • The photo quality I need to do professional work
  • The ability to follow my passion
  • The chance to show people the extraordinary moments of ordinary life
Some of my current works can be found at http://500px.com/dragonlair
If you have any questions at all, I can be contacted at justdusting@gmail.com

What You Get

  • If you donate anything, you get the first 10 good photos I take with the new camera in high quality digital format, ready to print.
  • $20 and up and you get access to the first 20 good photos.
  • $60 and you get access to the first 50 good photos + 1 free 8x10 print of your choice shipped anywhere in the USA + Periodic letters (email or physical) telling what I've been doing.
  • $150+ Access to all my best photos for the first year (there will be many) + Personalized 'thank-you' letter + 2 8x10 prints of your choice shipped anywhere in the USA + Periodic letters (email or physical) telling what I've up to.
Please note that I can not deliver prints unless I reach my goal of at least $2500 (I will send the digital images when I get the camera and take them, and I will send off the letters and emails regardless of whether I reach my goal or not.)

What I need

  • $2500 will cover the basics. The Sony Alpha A7ii with kit lens. This is really all I need.
  • $3000 will enable me to also get a very nice prime lens.
  • $3500+ and I will be able to purchase basic studio equipment along with the camera kit and prime lens.

The Impact

I will provide free basic photography services for:

  • People who really can't afford it
  • Churches and other small local nonprofits 
  • Weddings for people who can't afford a photographer (Wedding photography is normally extremely expensive)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't spare the money to help me out, I understand. I wouldn't be able to either. Here are some free ways you can help me:

  • Look at my photos and give me a honest review
  • Give me tips on photography
  • Tell your friends and/or family about me and my work

Thank-you for considering my cause. I greatly appreciate it.

story:
Table of content
  • What is it
  • Featured
  • How does it work
  • Product & Specs
  • What others say
  • About COSYSPEED & Why Crowd-Funding
  • Accessories
  • Schedule
  • Risks & Challenges
  • Team & Thanks :-)
  • FAQ


Are you a street or travel photographer? Do you like hiking or walking around in cities for many hours with your beloved camera? Do you want to have your camera always ready within a second for the next photo – just as quick as a sling strap but with the safety of a bag?

The CAMSLINGER Streetomatic is a new and unique Camera Bag Concept that is super Quick, super Safe and super Comfy. It was originally designed for Mirrorless Cameras, but you can of course use a CAMSLINGER Streetomatic for your small or mid-sized DSLR or Superzoom Camera. You can wear it super comfy at the hip or over your shoulder.


Wear your CAMSLINGER Streetomatic at the hip or over your shoulder

 

FOR WHOM IS A CAMSLINGER STREETOMATIC?

  • Street Photographers
  • Travel Photographers
  • Journalists
  • Family Photographers
  • Outdoor Photographers
  • Wedding Photographers

FOR WHAT GEAR IS A CAMSLINGER STREETOMATIC?

  • Mirrorless Cameras
  • DSLRs
  • Superzoom Cameras
  • Action Cameras
  • Lenses (when using a sling strap for your cam)
  • Travel Stuff 

Do you use a sling strap?

Many photographers use a sling strap. You too? Are you amazed by the speed of the one-handed access to your camera? But on the other side you would wish to have your gear safe against rain and bumps when not in use? Then the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic is the perfect solution for you!







The 1-hand/1-second concept

When you use a CAMSLINGER Streetomatic you can access your camera super quick. Just move your hand intuitively to the bag at your hip, open it, grab the cam and take your picture - all with one hand and within a second.

1) Open your CAMSLINGER Streetomatic with one hand
2) Grab your camera
3) Draw your camera and take your photo


 In a CAMSLINGER Streetomatic your gear is safe against rain, bumps, dust and the view of strangers. The bag is made out of robust, durable and water resistant Nylon D600 fabrics that will last for a long period of use. And for those cases when you have to walk through heavy rain for hours, you can use the included rain cover. This will give you the absolute safe feeling, that your gear is well protected. 

Raincover in use and attached to the belt


To keep the CAMSLINGER as slim as possible, we use robust but thin PE plates as a padding instead of the traditional thicker foam material. 


Safety against dropping – the FINGERCAMSTRAP

To have your camera safe against accidential dropping and at the same time ready without delay (as you would have a delay when attaching a strap around your neck or wrist) we developped the FINGERCAMSTRAP. It comes free with every CAMSLINGER Streetomatic and is easily attachable without any loss of time.

No limitation when operating your camera 
Attach intuitively and without any loss of time when grabing your camera


A CAMSLINGER Streetomatic is super comfy to wear even the whole day long. When used at the hip, your back is free of any weight! When used as a sling bag over your shoulder, you still have all the features like the quick, one-handed access.


The CAMSLINGER has a fixed belt and is free movable around your hip.


Carrying position of the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic is low on the thigh. Hence it is super intuitively accessible and the weight of your gear is super comfy on your thigh.

 

Included accessory bags for spare batteries, SD cards and your phone are super comfy to access.



 

In a CAMSLINGER Streetomatic you can carry what you need for a day out shooting: a camera, one, two, three lenses, spare batteries, small accessories and your phone. All super quick accessible but safely stored when not in use. And it is super comfy for many hours.




The CAMSLINGER Streetomatic

Thomas Leuthard Edition

Thomas Leuthard is one of the most influental street photographers of our times. The Edition bag comes in whole black with a stitching of Thomas signature on the front. Thomas relinquishes to all profits of the Edition and so from each CAMSLINGER Streetomatic Thomas Leuthard Edition 10 EUR go into a Street Kids Project in Burundi. Please see Thomas Leuthards website here.

The Street Kids Project in Burundi is supervised by German non-profit organisation Burundikids .e.V. (www.burundikids.org). The collected money from this campaign will be used to buy school equipment for 80 children living in the "Centre Birashoboka for Street Children" in Burundis capital Bujumbura. For detailed information please visit the website of Burundikids.


What fits in a CAMSLINGER Streetomatic?

It's very easy to look for the dimensions of your camera and then you'll see, if your gear will fit in. The CAMSLINGER Streetomatic has inner diemnsions of 175mm/7" (l) x 155mm/6" (h) and 85mm to 105mm/3.4" to 4.2" (d) due to a flexible back. Here are some examples and more are to find in the gallery... 


Reviews of the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic

  

Link to the Review at www.mirrorlessons.com

Link to the Review at Thomas.Leuthard.Photography

Link to the Review at Streethunters.net (See a CANON 6D in the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic)
 

Link to the Review at The PhoblographerLink to the Review at The Phoblographer (See FUJI cameras inside the Streetomatic)

Quotes from users of the original CAMSLINGER 

HAJE JAN KAMPS, author of Focus on Travel Photography and 10 other photography books – “I’ve been using the original Camslinger since launch, and I haven’t looked back. My Sony A7 has found its perfect companion: Safe from the rain and hidden away from thieving eyes, but always at my fingertips. The additional freedom gained from not needing to have a strap on my camera is magical, too.”

STEVE HUFF – "It’s so comfortable to wear as well as beeing 100% functional that it was a pleasure to wear and walk around with.”

THOMAS LEUTHARD – “The ultimate bag for the mirrorless hero.”

ALEX COGHE – "I love the “always ready” concept of these bags, that makes you some sort of new urban gunslinger with a camera instead of a colt."

MIRROR LESSONS – “The CAMSLINGERs are an easy and practical solution, and above all, a joy to use. I cannot imagine setting out on a photography outing or assignment without one anymore.”

THE PHOBLOGRAPHER – "It’s a great solution for those with back problems, photographers on set or a wedding ..."

HERBERT PIEL – “There are really not much accessories that I would recommend with conviction, but now here comes the CAMSLINGER…”

GABOR RICHTER – “I’ve never been that fast to grab my cam. The CAMSLINGER is not only super comfy in daily use, but also super practical.”

KROLOP & GERST – “The CAMSLINGER is just insanely good!”

STREETHUNTERS.NET – “The Cosyspeed Camslinger Camera Bag is a fine product that I enjoy using very much. After a month it has become my number one choice for when I hit the streets…”



COSYSPEED GmbH is a German based brand and the first company in the world that is focused exclusively on accessories for mirrorless cameras. In 2014 COSYSPEED launched its first product the "CAMSLINGER 160 Camera Bag for Mirrorless Cameras". COSYSPEEDS philosophy is to develop innovative products for photographers and on the other side support actively development aid projects. The first product from this approach is the CAMPILLOW, made in a project in Burundi (and presumably the first photo product made in Africa).

While COSYSPEED GmbH is still a normal company, it is planned for 2016 to turn COSYSPEED into a non-profit company – the first one in the photo industry. To be able to do that we need your support in this campaign, because our financial situation needs to be more stable to do this turn. So come with us and create something NEW in an industry that cares for one of the most passionable things in the world – photography! 

Why doing a crowd-funding campaign for the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic?

The CAMSLINGER Streetomatic is the result of one and a half year of experiences with the original CAMSLINGER 160 bag. To launch the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic, we simply do not have the funds, nevertheless we invested already a good amount of the profits from the first product into the development of the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic. The Streetomatic is tested by many involved photographers and now ready for production. We just need your support to realize this amazing bag! 


In addition to the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic you can choose some useful accessories:

BELTEXTENSION to extend the belt of the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic up to 165 cm / 65"


 

CAMPILLOW for the safe storage of your camera on your desk. With this perk you will support a development aid project in Burundi. 


Furthermore you can use the accessory bags from the original CAMSLINGER 160 series to put for example an additional lens on the belt of your CAMSLINGER Streetomatic. Please visit the COSYSPEED website.



April 2014 – July 2015 | Collecting ideas

March 2015 – August 2015 | Prototyping

April 2015 – July 2015 | Testing

August 2015 | Finalizing production-ready prototypes

September 2015 | INDIEGOGO campaign

October 2015 | Payment of the funds from the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic Thomas Leuthard Edition to the Street Kids Project in Burundi

October 2015 – November 2015 | Production

December 2015 – January 2016| Shipping in our warehouses US and Germany

January 2016 | Shipping to backers

February 2016 | Beginning shippment to distributors


The CAMSLINGER Streetomatic is an already ready-to-production product and will be manufactured as soon as the campaign is successfully completed. The production-ready-prototypes are already tested by well known photographers and do work without any problem. As COSYSPEED has already several products in production, we can access an already well working chain of high quality manufacturing, shipment and distribution. 

Our main manufacturer is located in the Chinese Shenzen area and run by a German manufacturing company. It is guaranteed that quality is on a very high standard and that all workers are working under very good and proven conditions.

With a successful campaign in the back there are in our opinion no real risks. Only serious circumstances are a risk, such as natural desasters or a deep economic crisis.  

The main challenge is to make this campaign a success. And with your help and recommandations it is realistic that we can master this amazing time in September 2015.




Thomas Ludwig, CEO and founder of COSYSPEED

Thomas Ludwig has had an advertising agency in Germany for almost 20 years and was working as development aid worker for the German Development Service in African countries. He is a photo nerd since many years and has a passion for street photography (but not much time for it). He lives with his family near Hamburg/Germany.

At first glance this seems to be a rather small team, but there are many more in the background who were involved into this project. So it's time to say THANKS!

-----------------------------------------------

The CAMSLINGER Streetomatic was developped with support of many photographers and especially street photographers, as a small and quick accessible bag seems to be ideal for street photography.

A very special thanks goes of course to Thomas Leuthard, whos ideas flowed in the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic and who is the patron to the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic Thomas Leuthard Edition. Our philosophies of passion for innovative gear and supporting projects in development countries found a perfect synergy in the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic. The CAMSLINGER Streetomatic is a bag developped out of Thomas daily practice and might be usable for many street photographers. 

Furthermore we'd like to thank Spyros Papaspyropoulos, Alex Coghe, Herbert Piel, Heather Broster & Mathieu Gasquet, Chris Gampat, Simon Ellingworth, Gabor Richter, the team from our German distributor Enjoyyourcamera and many others for their thoughts and ideas.

We'd like to thank Hanna and Sammi from the design and manufacturing team for their constant and constructive support. Stephanie, Leonharda and Annette from the design team of the original CAMSLINGER for the basic development of the CAMSLINGER concept. The Team from PROBIS Hamburg and Foto Gressung Saarbrücken for helping us out with product images. Jan Wagner for the great video he made for the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic (and many other COSYSPEED videos). Antonia, Friederike and Robin for standing in front of the camera. Haje Jan Kamps for being one of the most amiable guys we met in the last years for helping us with his experiences out of many crowd-funding campaigns.  Elliot Paul Stern for his outstsanding kindness, constructive ideas and thoughts. Michael, Bernhard and Horst for their support in general and last but not least my wonderful wife Friederike and sweet little daughter Elfriede for being so patient and supporting a nerd realizing his humble visions.

And many thanks to all you guys that are not mentioned here. All of you wonderful peops out there are part of this project and without you we won't be where we are.

When do you ship the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic?

Shipping starts mid January and we hope to get all Streetomatics to backers by the end of January.

Do I have to pay customs or VAT or shipping?

We are shipping from warehouses/distributors in the US, Canada, Japan, Germany, the UK, and Spain. So in these countries (and the EU) you dont have to pay customs. In other countries it might be, that you have to pay customs depending on the particular customs regulations in your country.

VAT is basically included in every shipping respectively is not applicable in almost every destination

Shipping is 5 $US and will be collected when backing

Who are you and what will you do with the money raised in this campaign?

COSYSPEED GmbH is a German company (Ltd.) based near Frankfurt/Germany. The money from this campaign will be used for the manufacturing of the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic bags and transportation fees/custom fees.

What will happen to my money if you do not reach the goal of 17.500 $US

We are using the flexible option with allows to collect the backed money even if the targeted 17.500 $US will not be reached. However we would start the manufacturing process if we reach 12.000 $US and will ship as planned in January. If we do not reach 12.000 $US, we will refund the collected money to the backers.


DO YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS ABOUT THIS CAMPAIGN YOU'D LIKE TO BE ANSWERED? JUST DROP US SOME LINES...

It was originally designed for Mirrorless Cameras, but you can of course use a CAMSLINGER Streetomatic for your small or mid-sized DSLR or Superzoom Camera. You can wear it super comfy at the hip or over your shoulder.


Wear your CAMSLINGER Streetomatic at the hip or over your shoulder


 

FOR WHOM IS A CAMSLINGER STREETOMATIC?


Street Photographers
Travel Photographers
Journalists
Family Photographers
Outdoor Photographers
Wedding Photographers

FOR WHAT GEAR IS A CAMSLINGER STREETOMATIC?

Mirrorless Cameras
DSLRs
Superzoom Cameras
Action Cameras
Lenses (when using a sling strap for your cam)
Travel Stuff 


Do you use a sling strap?
Many photographers use a sling strap. You too? Are you amazed by the speed of the one-handed access to your camera? But on the other side you would wish to have your gear safe against rain and bumps when not in use? Then the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic is the perfect solution for you!




















The 1-hand/1-second concept

When you use a CAMSLINGER Streetomatic you can access your camera super quick. Just move your hand intuitively to the bag at your hip, open it, grab the cam and take your picture - all with one hand and within a second.



1) Open your CAMSLINGER Streetomatic with one hand2) Grab your camera3) Draw your camera and take your photo








 In a CAMSLINGER Streetomatic your gear is safe against rain, bumps, dust and the view of strangers. The bag is made out of robust, durable and water resistant Nylon D600 fabrics that will last for a long period of use. And for those cases when you have to walk through heavy rain for hours, you can use the included rain cover. This will give you the absolute safe feeling, that your gear is well protected. 
Raincover in use and attached to the belt

To keep the CAMSLINGER as slim as possible, we use robust but thin PE plates as a padding instead of the traditional thicker foam material. 


Safety against dropping – the FINGERCAMSTRAP
 To have your camera safe against accidential dropping and at the same time ready without delay (as you would have a delay when attaching a strap around your neck or wrist) we developped the FINGERCAMSTRAP. It comes free with every CAMSLINGER Streetomatic and is easily attachable without any loss of time.
No limitation when operating your camera Attach intuitively and without any loss of time when grabing your camera




A CAMSLINGER Streetomatic is super comfy to wear even the whole day long. When used at the hip, your back is free of any weight! When used as a sling bag over your shoulder, you still have all the features like the quick, one-handed access.

The CAMSLINGER has a fixed belt and is free movable around your hip.


Carrying position of the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic is low on the thigh. Hence it is super intuitively accessible and the weight of your gear is super comfy on your thigh.


 

Included accessory bags for spare batteries, SD cards and your phone are super comfy to access.






 
In a CAMSLINGER Streetomatic you can carry what you need for a day out shooting: a camera, one, two, three lenses, spare batteries, small accessories and your phone. All super quick accessible but safely stored when not in use. And it is super comfy for many hours.




  

The CAMSLINGER Streetomatic

Thomas Leuthard Edition Thomas Leuthard is one of the most influental street photographers of our times. The Edition bag comes in whole black with a stitching of Thomas signature on the front. Thomas relinquishes to all profits of the Edition and so from each CAMSLINGER Streetomatic Thomas Leuthard Edition 10 EUR go into a Street Kids Project in Burundi. Please see Thomas Leuthards website here.
The Street Kids Project in Burundi is supervised by German non-profit organisation Burundikids .e.V. (www.burundikids.org). The collected money from this campaign will be used to buy school equipment for 80 children living in the "Centre Birashoboka for Street Children" in Burundis capital Bujumbura. For detailed information please visit the website of Burundikids.


What fits in a CAMSLINGER Streetomatic?It's very easy to look for the dimensions of your camera and then you'll see, if your gear will fit in. The CAMSLINGER Streetomatic has inner diemnsions of 175mm/7" (l) x 155mm/6" (h) and 85mm to 105mm/3.4" to 4.2" (d) due to a flexible back. Here are some examples and more are to find in the gallery... 





Reviews of the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic
  
Link to the Review at www.mirrorlessons.com

Link to the Review at Thomas.Leuthard.Photography


Link to the Review at Streethunters.net (See a CANON 6D in the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic)
 Link to the Review at The PhoblographerLink to the Review at The Phoblographer (See FUJI cameras inside the Streetomatic)
Quotes from users of the original CAMSLINGER 
HAJE JAN KAMPS, author of Focus on Travel Photography and 10 other photography books – “I’ve been using the original Camslinger since launch, and I haven’t looked back. My Sony A7 has found its perfect companion: Safe from the rain and hidden away from thieving eyes, but always at my fingertips. The additional freedom gained from not needing to have a strap on my camera is magical, too.”

STEVE HUFF – "It’s so comfortable to wear as well as beeing 100% functional that it was a pleasure to wear and walk around with.”

THOMAS LEUTHARD – “The ultimate bag for the mirrorless hero.”
ALEX COGHE – "I love the “always ready” concept of these bags, that makes you some sort of new urban gunslinger with a camera instead of a colt."
MIRROR LESSONS – “The CAMSLINGERs are an easy and practical solution, and above all, a joy to use. I cannot imagine setting out on a photography outing or assignment without one anymore.”
THE PHOBLOGRAPHER – "It’s a great solution for those with back problems, photographers on set or a wedding ..."
HERBERT PIEL – “There are really not much accessories that I would recommend with conviction, but now here comes the CAMSLINGER…”
GABOR RICHTER – “I’ve never been that fast to grab my cam. The CAMSLINGER is not only super comfy in daily use, but also super practical.”
KROLOP & GERST – “The CAMSLINGER is just insanely good!”
STREETHUNTERS.NET – “The Cosyspeed Camslinger Camera Bag is a fine product that I enjoy using very much. After a month it has become my number one choice for when I hit the streets…”





COSYSPEED GmbH is a German based brand and the first company in the world that is focused exclusively on accessories for mirrorless cameras. In 2014 COSYSPEED launched its first product the "CAMSLINGER 160 Camera Bag for Mirrorless Cameras". COSYSPEEDS philosophy is to develop innovative products for photographers and on the other side support actively development aid projects. The first product from this approach is the CAMPILLOW, made in a project in Burundi (and presumably the first photo product made in Africa).


While COSYSPEED GmbH is still a normal company, it is planned for 2016 to turn COSYSPEED into a non-profit company – the first one in the photo industry. To be able to do that we need your support in this campaign, because our financial situation needs to be more stable to do this turn. So come with us and create something NEW in an industry that cares for one of the most passionable things in the world – photography! 
Why doing a crowd-funding campaign for the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic?
The CAMSLINGER Streetomatic is the result of one and a half year of experiences with the original CAMSLINGER 160 bag. To launch the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic, we simply do not have the funds, nevertheless we invested already a good amount of the profits from the first product into the development of the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic. The Streetomatic is tested by many involved photographers and now ready for production. We just need your support to realize this amazing bag! 




In addition to the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic you can choose some useful accessories:

BELTEXTENSION to extend the belt of the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic up to 165 cm / 65"


 
CAMPILLOW for the safe storage of your camera on your desk. With this perk you will support a development aid project in Burundi. 

Furthermore you can use the accessory bags from the original CAMSLINGER 160 series to put for example an additional lens on the belt of your CAMSLINGER Streetomatic. Please visit the COSYSPEED website.



April 2014 – July 2015 | Collecting ideas
March 2015 – August 2015 | Prototyping
April 2015 – July 2015 | Testing
August 2015 | Finalizing production-ready prototypes
September 2015 | INDIEGOGO campaign
October 2015 | Payment of the funds from the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic Thomas Leuthard Edition to the Street Kids Project in Burundi
October 2015 – November 2015 | Production
December 2015 – January 2016| Shipping in our warehouses US and Germany
January 2016 | Shipping to backers
February 2016 | Beginning shippment to distributors



The CAMSLINGER Streetomatic is an already ready-to-production product and will be manufactured as soon as the campaign is successfully completed. The production-ready-prototypes are already tested by well known photographers and do work without any problem. As COSYSPEED has already several products in production, we can access an already well working chain of high quality manufacturing, shipment and distribution. Our main manufacturer is located in the Chinese Shenzen area and run by a German manufacturing company. It is guaranteed that quality is on a very high standard and that all workers are working under very good and proven conditions.
With a successful campaign in the back there are in our opinion no real risks. Only serious circumstances are a risk, such as natural desasters or a deep economic crisis.  
The main challenge is to make this campaign a success. And with your help and recommandations it is realistic that we can master this amazing time in September 2015.





Thomas Ludwig, CEO and founder of COSYSPEED
Thomas Ludwig has had an advertising agency in Germany for almost 20 years and was working as development aid worker for the German Development Service in African countries. He is a photo nerd since many years and has a passion for street photography (but not much time for it). He lives with his family near Hamburg/Germany.
At first glance this seems to be a rather small team, but there are many more in the background who were involved into this project. So it's time to say THANKS!
-----------------------------------------------

The CAMSLINGER Streetomatic was developped with support of many photographers and especially street photographers, as a small and quick accessible bag seems to be ideal for street photography.
A very special thanks goes of course to Thomas Leuthard, whos ideas flowed in the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic and who is the patron to the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic Thomas Leuthard Edition. Our philosophies of passion for innovative gear and supporting projects in development countries found a perfect synergy in the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic. The CAMSLINGER Streetomatic is a bag developped out of Thomas daily practice and might be usable for many street photographers. 
Furthermore we'd like to thank Spyros Papaspyropoulos, Alex Coghe, Herbert Piel, Heather Broster & Mathieu Gasquet, Chris Gampat, Simon Ellingworth, Gabor Richter, the team from our German distributor Enjoyyourcamera and many others for their thoughts and ideas.
We'd like to thank Hanna and Sammi from the design and manufacturing team for their constant and constructive support. Stephanie, Leonharda and Annette from the design team of the original CAMSLINGER for the basic development of the CAMSLINGER concept. The Team from PROBIS Hamburg and Foto Gressung Saarbrücken for helping us out with product images. Jan Wagner for the great video he made for the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic (and many other COSYSPEED videos). Antonia, Friederike and Robin for standing in front of the camera. Haje Jan Kamps for being one of the most amiable guys we met in the last years for helping us with his experiences out of many crowd-funding campaigns.  Elliot Paul Stern for his outstsanding kindness, constructive ideas and thoughts. Michael, Bernhard and Horst for their support in general and last but not least my wonderful wife Friederike and sweet little daughter Elfriede for being so patient and supporting a nerd realizing his humble visions.
And many thanks to all you guys that are not mentioned here. All of you wonderful peops out there are part of this project and without you we won't be where we are.


When do you ship the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic?Shipping starts mid January and we hope to get all Streetomatics to backers by the end of January.
Do I have to pay customs or VAT or shipping?
We are shipping from warehouses/distributors in the US, Canada, Japan, Germany, the UK, and Spain. So in these countries (and the EU) you dont have to pay customs. In other countries it might be, that you have to pay customs depending on the particular customs regulations in your country.
VAT is basically included in every shipping respectively is not applicable in almost every destination
Shipping is 5 $US and will be collected when backing
Who are you and what will you do with the money raised in this campaign?
COSYSPEED GmbH is a German company (Ltd.) based near Frankfurt/Germany. The money from this campaign will be used for the manufacturing of the CAMSLINGER Streetomatic bags and transportation fees/custom fees.
What will happen to my money if you do not reach the goal of 17.500 $US
We are using the flexible option with allows to collect the backed money even if the targeted 17.500 $US will not be reached. However we would start the manufacturing process if we reach 12.000 $US and will ship as planned in January. If we do not reach 12.000 $US, we will refund the collected money to the backers.

DO YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS ABOUT THIS CAMPAIGN YOU'D LIKE TO BE ANSWERED? JUST DROP US SOME LINES...

story:
• Winner Startup Live Vienna 2015
  • Winner ProMountain Startup Village 2016
  • Winner Post Startup Challenge at Pioneers Festival 2016
  •  

 

Videos allow us to tell our story and enjoy them with our friends. Unfortunately they are often blurry and shaky because we are in motion. So how can you capture stunning moments smoothly? Take control and let STABYLIZR help you, to make better videos.

HOW IT WORKS

STABYLIZR is an innovative mechanical stabilization system. It damps and minimizes your body movements so they don't get transferred to your action camera. The result is smooth and steady footage without dealing with postproduction software. It saves your time and money. 

The innovative patent-submitted construction allows a compact, lightweight and robust design. Your STABYLIZR is 100% waterproof, always ready and needs no battery.

 

a professional mechanical stabilization system. It is ideal for capturing your special moments, everyday, sport and action activities. You do not need any technical knowledge to film with STABYLIZR. It is very easy. 

 

TRIPOD FUNCTION: even when you are not in movement your STABYLIZR helps you to make better videos. Through its construction and robust design you can easily use it as a tripod on rough surfaces, trees, handrails, basically everywhere.

 

BASIC GRIP (Included) 

The Basic Grip is included. It is made out durable soft foam and feels just great in your hand. The whole system is so lightweight that it can even float. For heavier setups please add a floaty backdoor. 

 

 

 

 POWER GRIP

We love smart gadgets and we hate running out of battery! So we added a power bar in our POWER GRIP which allows you to charge your GoPro or other devices up to two times. Get it in addition with one STABYLIZR for just 30€ (34$) instead of 49€ (55$).

 

 

 

STABYLIZR works with GoPro Hero and Hero [2,3,3+,4,Session] and GoPro sized cameras. The max. camera size you can use with the Stabylizr is the GoPro Hero3 with the old big housing plus BacPac that equals the measurements of 78x69x48mm (3.07x2.68x1.89in). UPDATE: Xiaomi YI can unfortunately only be used in the frame not the housing.

The STABYLIZR head is compatible with every GoPro mount. 

You can use STABYLIZR and your action camera with: 

  • Different housings 
  • Frames
  • Battery and LCD BacPac

The system can be easily adopted with the balancing nuts. 

SUPER EASY SET UP: 

1) Plug in and align your camera

 

 

2) Adjust the balancing nut and start filming smooth footage  

 

 

 


STABYLIZR

 

  • Size: 158x120x76mm (6.2x4.7x3in)
  • Weight: 240g/0.53lbs (STABYLIZR without camera) 
  • Material: PAGF- Polyamide reinforced with glass fiber 
  • 2-Axis (Degree Coverage): Pitch (140°) and Roll (360°) 
  • 100% Waterproof

 

POWER GRIP:

  • Capacity: 2200mAh, Input: 5V, 1000mA; Output: 5V, 1000mA 

 

 

OUR STORY

We love to capture our sport and outdoor activities. But we were not always happy with the result. Since solutions on the market did not fit our needs, we decided to build our own stabilization system. With an engineering degree in background and a lot of creativity we built the first prototype from the components of a toilet lid and roller skates. A year and many more prototypes later we created STABYLIZR: a compact and easy to use system for everyone. 

 

 

Thanks to all of our friends, family, and backers who have supported and encouraged us throughout this whole process. We could not have done this without you! We would like to specially thank the following people who have helped us throughout our campaign:

  • Video: Filmabteilung H4 (Natascha Gertlbauer und David Brucker)
  • Graphic Design: Nadja Boubachta
  • PR: Florian Schauer-Bieche
  • Models, Makeup: Fedor, Liis, Lynette, Tamara, Victoria, Nico, Chris
  • Support from Switzerland: Timon Renfer, Roland Malaluan
  • Andreas Ruthner, Dominic Haffner and many more

 

 

 

With your help we can bring STABYLIZR to life. We have a fully functional 3D printed prototype, which produces amazing footage and is ready for mass production. We have everything set with our suppliers, production and assembling partners in Austria. By backing our campaign you will help us fund the tooling, first manufacturing run and packaging costs. Thanks to your support and our partners we will be ready to start production as soon as we reach our campaign goal. We are excited to deliver a great product at an affordable price.

There is one more thing: Please share our project on your network!  A few clicks for you make a big difference for us. 

 

 

UPDATE: PRODUCTION HAS STARTED

We have been working for over a year on STABYLIZR and developed a fully functional 3D printed prototype. We are mass production ready! We have our suppliers and production partners ready to produce all parts that we need in the required quality and quantity. To guarantee quality, shorten communication channels and support local economy we decided to fully rely on Austrian partners. We will start with the plastic injection molding production as soon as we hit our target! 

 

 

 

 

 

However, we know that life is not always fully predictable and there might be unforeseen troubles waiting for us on the road to mass production. We have a great network of industry experts and other startups that have manufactured products before. We will further leverage this network to ensure we can bring STABYLIZR to life and into your hands.

The main challenges we see are in manufacturing: We have experienced partners that help us to get STABYLIZR to the required level of quality. We have worked closely with our partners during the production of STABYLIZR prototypes and they are eager to support our project. We have consciously chosen partners in Austria who we can fully rely on to make sure the product is delivered in the right quality and on time.

 

Videos ermöglichen es uns unsere Geschichte zu erzählen und diese mit unseren Freunden zu teilen. Dabei befinden wir uns jedoch oft in Bewegung, was wiederum zu verwackelten und unscharfen Videos führt. Übernimm die Kontrolle und mach dank STABYLIZR bessere und fließendere Videoaufnahmen.

WIE FUNKTIONIERT DAS

STABYLIZR ist ein innovatives mechanisches Kamerastabilisierungssystem. Es gleicht die Bewegungen zwischen deinem Körper und der Actioncamera aus. Dadurch entstehen verwackelungsarme und fließende Aufnahmen, ohne nachträgliche Bearbeitung. Spare Zeit und Geld.

Durch die innovative zum Patent eingereichte Konstruktion ist ein kompaktes, leichtes und robustes Design möglich. STABYLIZR ist 100% wasserdicht, allzeit bereit und benötigt keine Batterien.

 

ein professioneller mechanischer Stabilisator. Ideal um besondere Anlässe, alltägliche und sportliche Aktivitäten zu filmen. Mit STABYLIZR zu filmen ist super einfach und benötigt keinerlei Vorkenntnisse. 

 

STATIV FUNKTION: Selbst wenn du einmal nicht in Bewegung bist, hilft dir STABYLIZR dabei, bessere Videos zu machen. Durch seine Konstruktionsform und sein robustes Design dient er als Stativ auf unebenen Flächen, Stangen, Bäumen, nahezu überall. 

 

BAISC GRIP (inkludiert) 

 

Der Basic Grip ist im Lieferumfang enthalten. Er wird aus widerstandsfähigem, weichem Schaumstoff hergestellt und liegt großartig in der Hand. Das ganze System ist so leicht, dass es sogar schwimmfähig ist. Für schwerere Setups empfehlen wir jedoch zusätzlichen die Floaty Backdoor. 

 

 

 

POWER GRIP 

Wir lieben smarte Gadgets und hassen es keinen Akku mehr zu haben. Deswegen haben wir in unserem POWER GRIP eine Power Bar integriert mit der die GoPro oder andere Geräte bis zu zweimal aufgeladen werden können. Dieser kann zusätzlich zum STABYLIZR für nur 30€ statt 49€ bestellt werden.

 

Hol dir deinen POWER GRIP für nur €30!

 

 

STABYLIZR funktioniert mit der GoPro Hero und Hero [2,3,3+,4,Session]  und Actioncameras im GoPro Format. Die Actioncam darf maximal so groß sein wie die GoPro Hero3 mit großem Gehäuse und BacPac. Das enspricht einer Abmessung von etwa 78x69x48mm. UPDATE: Xiaomi YI kann leider nur im Frame nicht in dem Housing benutzt werden. 

Der Kopf des STABYLIZR ist mit jedem Standard GoPro mount kompatibel.

 STABYLIZR kann mit deiner Actioncamera und 

  • Verschiedenen Gehäusen, 
  • Rahmen und 
  • zusätzlichen Akku und LCD BacPacs 

eingesetzt werden. Durch die Balancemutter kann das System ganz einfach abgestimmt werden. 

SUPER EINFACHES SETUP 

1) Anstecken und Ausrichten der Kamera 

 

 

 2) Abstimmung der Balancemutter und schon kannst du loslegen. 

 

 

 

STABYLIZR

  • Größe: 158x120x76mm 
  • Gewicht: 240g (STABYLIZR ohne Kamera) 
  • Material: PAGF- Polyamid mit Glassfaser verstärkt 
  •  2-Achsen: Nicken (140°) und Rollen (360°) 
  •  100% Wasserfest

POWER GRIP 

Kapazität: 2200mAh, Input: 5V, 1000mA; Output: 5V, 1000mA 

 

 

 

 

Unsere Geschichte 

Wir lieben es, unsere Sport und Outdoor Aktivitäten zu filmen. Mit dem Resultat waren wir leider oft nicht zufrieden. Da die derzeitigen Lösungen auf dem Markt unsere Bedürfnisse nicht erfüllt haben, beschlossen wir unser eigenes System zu entwickeln. Mit einem Maschinenbauabschluss in der Tasche und viel Kreativität entstand der erste Prototyp, aus den Komponenten eines Klodeckels und Rollerskates. Ein Jahr und viele Prototypen später haben wir STABYLIZR kreiert: ein kompaktes, einfaches System für alle. 

 

 

An dieser Stelle möchten wir uns gerne bei unseren Freunden, Familie und Unterstützern bedanken, die uns während des gesamten Prozesses immer Beiseite gestanden sind. Speziell in Bezug auf die Kampagne möchten wir folgenden Personen danken: 

  • Video: Filmabteilung H4 (Natascha Gertlbauer und David Brucker), 
  • Graphic Design: Nadja Boubachta, 
  • PR: Florian Schauer-Bieche 
  • Models, MakeUp: Fedor, Liis, Lynette, Tamara, Victoria, Nico, Chris 
  • Support aus der Schweiz: Timon Renfer, Roland Malaluan 
  • Andreas Ruthner, Dominic Haffner und viele mehr

 

 

 

Mit deiner Unterstützung können wir STABYLIZR zum Leben erwecken. Wir haben vollfunktionsfähige 3D gedruckte Prototypen, die großartige Videos erzeugen. Mit unseren Fertigungs- und Assemblierungspartnern aus Österreich haben wir alle notwendigen Schritte für die Produktion festgelegt und können mit der Massenproduktion sofort starten. Durch deine Unterstützung werden die Werkzeugformen, die erste Produktionsserie und die Verpackung finanziert. Nach dem Erreichen des Zieles starten wir sofort mit der Produktion. Wir freuen uns, ein super Produkt zu einem guten Preis liefern zu können. 

Bitte unterstütz uns indem du die Kampagne in deinem Netzwerk teilst. Ein paar Klicks für dich, machen für uns einen Riesenunterschied. 

 

 

 

UPDATE: PRODUKTION BEGONNEN 

Nach über einem Jahr an der Entwicklung von STABYLIZR haben wir nun vollfunktionsfähige 3D gedruckte Prototypen. Unsere Zuliefer- und Fertigungspartner sind bereit, die Komponenten in der notwendigen Qualität und Quantität zu produzieren. Um die Qualität sicherzustellen, Kommunikationswege zu verkürzen und die lokale Wirtschaft zu unterstützen, haben wir uns für Produktionspartner in Österreich entschieden. Diese stehen in den Startlöchern! Sobald wir das Ziel erreicht haben, starten wir mit der Spritzgussfertigung.

 

Risiken und Herausforderungen

 

Uns ist bewusst, dass immer etwas Unvorhersehbares eintreten kann und uns Hindernisse auf dem Weg zur Auslieferung begegnen werden. Wir bauen deswegen auf ein Netwerk aus Experten und anderen Startups, die bereits Produkte produziert haben. Dieses erweitern wir ständig, um sicherzustellen, dass wir STABYLIZR in der richtigen Qualität und nach Zeitplan zu dir liefern können. 

Die größte Herausforderung stellt die Produktion dar, daher vertrauen wir hier auf einen erfahrenen Partner, mit dem wir bereits während der Entwicklung der Prototypen zusammengearbeitet haben. Alle produktionstechnisch notwendigen Anpassungen wurden bereits durchgeführt. Wir haben uns bewusst für österreichische Produktions- und Assemblierungspartner entschieden auf die wir uns voll verlassen können, um so zu garantieren, dass wir wie geplant ausliefern.
story_txt:
Thank you for your support! This project has ended! 
We are not selling anymore!
 
 

Winner Startup Live Vienna 2015
Winner ProMountain Startup Village 2016

Winner Post Startup Challenge at Pioneers Festival 2016
