story:
We believe in a world where everyone has access to the experiences of the few, where our ability to see the extraordinary is not limited by distance, physical ability, savings, or courage to chase the adventure.

LucidCam is a stereoscopic 3D camera which captures the world as you see and hear it. The 180° wide-angle lenses enable an active view, and spacial audio enhances every experience.






The VR Experience ... 


LucidCam captures 180° footage for all VR headsets to make any content creator look like a rock star!

Take it Anywhere | SLIM design fits right in your pocket. Wear it, mount it or carry LucidCam as easily as your smart phone.


Capture Anything | SHOW any experience in 3D, 180° FULL HD with 1080p per eye video & 2K per eye photo quality. 


Simple to Use | ONE button for image capture, video capture, and setting manipulation. 



Here's How It Works ... 





The LOOK & FEEL of LucidCam ...



View REAL Content NOW with the LucidApp!

LucidCam for iOS

LucidCam for Android


Like THIS Video of Our Indiegogo Launch Party ...

DOWNLOAD THIS VIDEO



Check Out More Samples on YouTube ...




TechCrunch:
Meet The LucidCam, The Future Of Consumer VR

The Washington Post:

The Camera That Could Bring Virtual Reality to The Masses


DOWNLOAD THE LUCIDCAM PRESS KIT



The Lumiere Award for Technology Innovation 2015

Ascend Award for "Best New Startup" at The Sierra Ventures CXO Summit

"2015 Innovation for the Future Award" Given By Beijing University & Hanhai Investment







3D / 180° Footage in one MP4 file

1-Button Point-and-Shoot

1-Switch Video and Pictures

Compatible with Editing Software

Portable, Fits-In-Your-Pocket or On a Mount

Playback on Phone or VR Headset

Ready to Scale into 360° {Stretch Goal} 


DIMENSIONS: 
5.15" (131mm) long by 2.65" (67.3mm) tall by 1.02" (26mm) deep

WEIGHT:
8 oz (225 g)

RESOLUTION:
FULL HD - 1080p each eye video/ 2K each eye pictures

FRAME RATE:
30fps

BATTERY:
up to 1hr, lithium-ion battery

OPTICS:
FOV 190° x 120°, Fixed F/2.2 Aperture

AUDIO:
2 microphones for stereo/binaural caption

PORTS:
Input/Output: MicroUSB - data transfer/charging, HDMI, MicroSD

MODES:
Video - mp4 and Photo - jpg

APPS:
iOS & Android, view VR videos on your smart phone

STEREOSCOPIC IMAGE STABILIZATION

SPLASH PROOF  {Water Proof Stretch Goal}  



Our Impact Together ...

We are a team of passionate Berkeley & Stanford engineers who believe in bringing Virtual Reality to everyone. Therefore, we created the world's first 3D AND 180° stereoscopic consumer camera. This small, portable device empowers anyone to easily capture experiences with true depth and peripheral sight in order to create an immersive reality to share with everyone.  

There are infinite applications for Virtual Reality (VR), but wouldn't that potential be wasted if only a limited number of people have access to it? 

Contributing to this campaign helps our team put one of these devices into the hands of all consumers, so we can all create and share unending VR content. 

Our goal is to raise $100,000 to fund our manufacturing ramp-up and production of LucidCam in mass quantities. We have worked tirelessly for the last two years to rethink the current video market and break down multiple camera module solutions into only a 2-lens compact system.

Let's go skydiving with friends from our living rooms, or experience underground ruins with family across the globe, or we can let everyone see what we’re doing on any adventure. 

Which is why we want to reward you for contributing to us at the start of our journey ...


$10  THANK YOU!

$25  T-Shirt + 10% Future Discount

$59  T-Shirt + 3 Cardboards 

$299  Super Early Bird

$349  Early Bird + 2 Cardboards

$399  LucidCam + Selfie Stick + 5 Cardboards + 5% Future Discount

$499  LucidCam + 3 mounts (3 clips, 1 cap, 1 chest) + 5 Cardboards

$599  LucidCam + Mobile Tripod + 8 Cardboards + Production Collaboration

$2,999  Domestic Travel + LucidCam + T-Shirt + Experience

$5,999  International Travel + LucidCam + T-Shirt + Experience


WE WANT TO REWARD YOU FOR HELPING US SPREAD THE WORD!

REFERRAL PROGRAM INSTRUCTIONS: 

In order for us to track your referrals, use the share options to the left of our story (while logged into IndieoGoGo) to create share-links that are custom to YOU! 

Use these share options to invite your network to check us out! Anyone using your link to purchase a LucidCam will show up in our dashboard as a referral from YOU!






How Your Money Will Help Us Grow ...

We are asking for $100,000 to fund the ramp-up of manufacturing on LucidCams to bring our product to the mass market.  


Thank You from Our Tireless Team! 


We believe that VR belongs to all of us (not just big movie studios), because innovative content can only be created when the masses have access to it. Back our project and help us bring VR to everyone to unfold the disruptive power of Virtual Reality.

How You Can Help Us Further ...

Not everybody has the financial resources to support us, but even the smallest bit of contribution does actually count. Be our evangelist by driving our message on FACEBOOK, following us on TWITTER and asking friends and family to back us. 

Imagine a world with unlimited possibilities through VR and only we together can make it happen!


Design for Manufacturing Risk:
We've done everything to reduce risks for manufacturing ramp up. Our team is aware of the challenges which will happen in mass production. Should we encounter risks, then it comes from design changes and feedback during the campaign which we want to build in. At the end of the day we just want to ship the best product to you.

Forecasting Risk:
We’ve done our very best to forecast demand and create a solid production plan. We’ve learned a lot from the past, but sometimes forecasts don’t always hit the mark. Should we miss projections, we’ll let you know the reasons and fix it as quickly as possible.

Supply Chain Risk:
We’ve built a very capable team who have worked for many years in the industry. However, component delays and unexpected shortages can occur. If this happens, we’ll be sure to keep you informed and work to quickly solve the problem.



What is the difference between LucidCam and the Oculus Rift?
Oculus Rift is a VR headset which serves as a display device. LucidCam is a VR camera which serves as capture device. We want to help you CREATE the content that other devices help you view.


Why 180 degrees instead of 360 degrees?
Capturing in 180 degrees has many benefits in regards to portability, storytelling, shooting, and scalability. Reducing a VR camera to 180 degrees makes it small and easy to fit into your pocket. With 180 degrees you still give the immersion, but limit the user to the right content and field of view. 180 degrees allows you to do normal point-and-shoot without capturing yourself or other things you don’t want to capture. Additionally, 180 degrees is scalable into 360, but 360 is difficult to reduce down in form factor.


What sensors does LucidCam use?
Sony sensors similar to GoPro.


How big is the on-board storage?
On-board storage will be 16GB and you can extend it with any micro SD to higher capacities.


General Industry Questions

What is Virtual Reality?
Virtual Reality is an immersive video experience. Now you can watch 3D movies with a wide field of view. VR is a three-dimensional, computer generated environment which can be explored and interacted with. With LucidCam you can capture your own real environments and play it back in VR headsets.


Do I need a VR headset to watch the experience?
All you need is a smartphone to experience motion tracking, a feature intrinsic to the VR experience. Our app in iOS and Android allow you to switch to 2D and still feel like you are there. However, to experience full VR immersion with 3D, a headset is required.
story_txt:
We believe in a world where everyone has access to the experiences of the few, where our ability to see the extraordinary is not limited by distance, physical ability, savings, or courage to chase the adventure.LucidCam is a stereoscopic 3D camera which captures the world as you see and hear it. The 180° wide-angle lenses enable an active view, and spacial audio enhances every experience.The VR Experience ... 

LucidCam captures 180° footage for all VR headsets to make any content creator look like a rock star!

Take it Anywhere | SLIM design fits right in your pocket. Wear it, mount it or carry LucidCam as easily as your smart phone.



Capture Anything | SHOW any experience in 3D, 180° FULL HD with 1080p per eye video & 2K per eye photo quality. 




Simple to Use | ONE button for image capture, video capture, and setting manipulation. 


Here's How It Works ... 










The LOOK & FEEL of LucidCam ...
  


View REAL Content NOW with the LucidApp!

LucidCam for iOS



LucidCam for Android



Like THIS Video of Our Indiegogo Launch Party ...
DOWNLOAD THIS VIDEO






Check Out More Samples on YouTube ...











TechCrunch:

Meet The LucidCam, The Future Of Consumer VR





The Washington Post:


The Camera That Could Bring Virtual Reality to The Masses





DOWNLOAD THE LUCIDCAM PRESS KIT



The Lumiere Award for Technology Innovation 2015
Ascend Award for "Best New Startup" at The Sierra Ventures CXO Summit
"2015 Innovation for the Future Award" Given By Beijing University & Hanhai Investment



















3D / 180° Footage in one MP4 file
1-Button Point-and-Shoot
1-Switch Video and Pictures
Compatible with Editing Software
Portable, Fits-In-Your-Pocket or On a Mount
Playback on Phone or VR Headset

Ready to Scale into 360° {Stretch Goal} 





DIMENSIONS: 5.15" (131mm) long by 2.65" (67.3mm) tall by 1.02" (26mm) deep
WEIGHT: 8 oz (225 g)
RESOLUTION: FULL HD - 1080p each eye video/ 2K each eye pictures
FRAME RATE: 30fps
BATTERY: up to 1hr, lithium-ion battery
OPTICS: FOV 190° x 120°, Fixed F/2.2 Aperture
AUDIO: 2 microphones for stereo/binaural caption
PORTS: Input/Output: MicroUSB - data transfer/charging, HDMI, MicroSD
MODES: Video - mp4 and Photo - jpg
APPS: iOS & Android, view VR videos on your smart phone
STEREOSCOPIC IMAGE STABILIZATION
SPLASH PROOF  {Water Proof Stretch Goal}  






Our Impact Together ...

We are a team of passionate Berkeley & Stanford engineers who believe in bringing Virtual Reality to everyone. Therefore, we created the world's first 3D AND 180° stereoscopic consumer camera. This small, portable device empowers anyone to easily capture experiences with true depth and peripheral sight in order to create an immersive reality to share with everyone.  
There are infinite applications for Virtual Reality (VR), but wouldn't that potential be wasted if only a limited number of people have access to it? 
Contributing to this campaign helps our team put one of these devices into the hands of all consumers, so we can all create and share unending VR content. 
Our goal is to raise $100,000 to fund our manufacturing ramp-up and production of LucidCam in mass quantities. We have worked tirelessly for the last two years to rethink the current video market and break down multiple camera module solutions into only a 2-lens compact system.
Let's go skydiving with friends from our living rooms, or experience underground ruins with family across the globe, or we can let everyone see what we’re doing on any adventure. 
Which is why we want to reward you for contributing to us at the start of our journey ...







$10  THANK YOU!
$25  T-Shirt + 10% Future Discount
$59  T-Shirt + 3 Cardboards 
$299  Super Early Bird
$349  Early Bird + 2 Cardboards
$399  LucidCam + Selfie Stick + 5 Cardboards + 5% Future Discount
$499  LucidCam + 3 mounts (3 clips, 1 cap, 1 chest) + 5 Cardboards
$599  LucidCam + Mobile Tripod + 8 Cardboards + Production Collaboration
$2,999  Domestic Travel + LucidCam + T-Shirt + Experience
$5,999  International Travel + LucidCam + T-Shirt + Experience




WE WANT TO REWARD YOU FOR HELPING US SPREAD THE WORD!


REFERRAL PROGRAM INSTRUCTIONS: 
In order for us to track your referrals, use the share options to the left of our story (while logged into IndieoGoGo) to create share-links that are custom to YOU! 
Use these share options to invite your network to check us out! Anyone using your link to purchase a LucidCam will show up in our dashboard as a referral from YOU!









How Your Money Will Help Us Grow ...We are asking for $100,000 to fund the ramp-up of manufacturing on LucidCams to bring our product to the mass market.  



Thank You from Our Tireless Team! 




We believe that VR belongs to all of us (not just big movie studios), because innovative content can only be created when the masses have access to it. Back our project and help us bring VR to everyone to unfold the disruptive power of Virtual Reality.

How You Can Help Us Further ...
Not everybody has the financial resources to support us, but even the smallest bit of contribution does actually count. Be our evangelist by driving our message on FACEBOOK, following us on TWITTER and asking friends and family to back us. 
Imagine a world with unlimited possibilities through VR and only we together can make it happen!



Design for Manufacturing Risk:We've done everything to reduce risks for manufacturing ramp up. Our team is aware of the challenges which will happen in mass production. Should we encounter risks, then it comes from design changes and feedback during the campaign which we want to build in. At the end of the day we just want to ship the best product to you.
Forecasting Risk:We’ve done our very best to forecast demand and create a solid production plan. We’ve learned a lot from the past, but sometimes forecasts don’t always hit the mark. Should we miss projections, we’ll let you know the reasons and fix it as quickly as possible.
Supply Chain Risk:We’ve built a very capable team who have worked for many years in the industry. However, component delays and unexpected shortages can occur. If this happens, we’ll be sure to keep you informed and work to quickly solve the problem.





What is the difference between LucidCam and the Oculus Rift?Oculus Rift is a VR headset which serves as a display device. LucidCam is a VR camera which serves as capture device. We want to help you CREATE the content that other devices help you view.

Why 180 degrees instead of 360 degrees?Capturing in 180 degrees has many benefits in regards to portability, storytelling, shooting, and scalability. Reducing a VR camera to 180 degrees makes it small and easy to fit into your pocket. With 180 degrees you still give the immersion, but limit the user to the right content and field of view. 180 degrees allows you to do normal point-and-shoot without capturing yourself or other things you don’t want to capture. Additionally, 180 degrees is scalable into 360, but 360 is difficult to reduce down in form factor.
What sensors does LucidCam use?Sony sensors similar to GoPro.
How big is the on-board storage?On-board storage will be 16GB and you can extend it with any micro SD to higher capacities.
General Industry Questions
What is Virtual Reality?Virtual Reality is an immersive video experience. Now you can watch 3D movies with a wide field of view. VR is a three-dimensional, computer generated environment which can be explored and interacted with. With LucidCam you can capture your own real environments and play it back in VR headsets.
Do I need a VR headset to watch the experience?All you need is a smartphone to experience motion tracking, a feature intrinsic to the VR experience. Our app in iOS and Android allow you to switch to 2D and still feel like you are there. However, to experience full VR immersion with 3D, a headset is required.

story:
REVORING from H&Y. Quite simply the world's most advanced step ring adapter ever made for a camera lens. Our cleverly designed and innovative variable blade technology gives any DSLR or Mirrorless camera system user the ability to use 1 single filter on multiple lenses, without the need for multiple step rings. So simple in its function, many have said: "why has this never been done before?". Well, now we are proud to say that it has been done! But, we are not quite there yet. We now need your help in backing to bring this amazing product to life.  

 

 Almost 3 years of research and development, along with extensive field testing have been applied to bring the REVORING that much closer to reality. Our manufacturing process ensures that the materials used match the quality that customers have come to expect from H&Y. We are confident that image-makers across the globe will fall in love with this new concept and the REVORING systems will quickly become an indispensable partner for countless photographers and filmmakers.

 

TIGHT GRIP

The major feature of the H&Y REVORING and REVORING Variable Neutral Density + CPL filter system is the ability to switch between lenses with a single filter; a simple twist, and away you go! However, when designing the variable retracting blades, we knew we had to match the strength of a regular filter attached to a lens. Coupled with the force of the retracting blades and independent threading, one final turn ensures that the REVORING is securely mounted onto your lens.

 GLASS & COATING 

Anti-Fingerprint & Waterproof Nano-Coating Technology has been applied to the REVORING Variable Neutral Density + CPL filter system to protect the glass from the unpredictable factors that all photographers and filmmakers face when shooting outdoors. The coating helps with beading and any excess droplets can be easily removed with a lens cloth without the fear of eliminating any of the coatings and without leaving stubborn smears on the glass.

The German Schott B270® glass also includes Anti-Reflective coatings, which virtually eliminate all flare and reflections from the front and rear surfaces. This helps visible light to pass through the glass by removing unwanted reflections, giving the user the best possible light transmission (up to 97%), optimizing images for the sharpest possible outcome. Whether shooting at 16mm or 400mm, the glass and coatings used in the REVORING Variable Neutral Density + CPL filter system produce sharp images, even at light reductions of up 10 stops.  

Each side of the REVORING's glass has 9 layers of the above coatings applied.  

ADDITIONAL FEATURES

As a result of continued tests and working on feedback from our ambassadors, we are excited that we can already announce the following features which will be included in the final product - check out the video below showing these new features

 

 Hard Stop - The Variable Neutral Density ring will feature a hard stop at “MAX” preventing the user from going beyond the 10 stop position on the ring.

 Guide Pin - In addition to the Circular Polarizer inner ring, the Variable Neutral Density outer ring will also feature a guide pin, for improved control and functionality

 Focal Length Guide - There will be a redesign of the Variable Neutral Density markers between “Min” and “Max" to better reflect focal lengths and stops achieved using different lenses

SAVING SPACE 

Space is a commodity for photographers and filmmakers! Let's face it, we are always on a quest for new bags and backpacks, with hundreds of pockets and compartments to carry all the latest gadgets and accessories launched every year. But, what if all you need to do is simply reduce the amount of gear you carry while achieving the same or greater level of productivity? The REVORING saves you the need to carry multiple filters and step rings, meaning you can pack lighter and more efficiently for your travels.  

SAVING TIME

 

The REVORING and REVORING Variable ND+CPL will save you time when changing over filters for that perfect shot. For example, you might start off by shooting with a 24-70mm lens, and decide to switch to a 70-200mm, both of which may have a different thread size. You would either have to switch filters or adapt your filter using step rings, and we've all experienced this frustration, especially if you need multiple rings, or worse yet, they get stuck! With the REVORING, you just twist and remove from one lens, twist and mount to the other, it's that simple! 

Our US Ambassador, David Akoubian, got to play with a handful of our REVORING samples and had fun in showing just how easy it is to switch between lenses, saving him time when out shooting.      

 SAVING MONEY 

Not only will the REVORING save you space and time, it will also save you money! You no longer need to buy multiple filters or step-up rings for all of your lenses. Instead, choose a REVORING suitable for your lenses, add 1 filter, and you are good to go!   

Philip Bloom has had hands-on with the REVORING. Watch his video, where he covers the many features it has, including just how much money it can save you!

 

DESIGNED FOR PHOTOGRAPHY & VIDEO

The REVORING Variable ND + CPL combination has the benefit of being an essential tool for shooting both videos and stills. Once you have attached the REVORING to your lens, you have a wealth of dynamic range at your fingertips, with the added bonus of a Circular Polarizer which features Japanese Nitto polarizing film - offering up to 99.9% polarizing efficiency. 

The REVORING Variable Neutral Density has a dynamic range of ND3 to ND1000, in photographic terms, this equates to 1.5 - 10 stops of light control!    

The following chart is a useful guide to help understand what each ND Rating will help you achieve. 

Below test images taken by Felicia Smith in Australia using the REVORING Variable Neutral Density + CPL filter system showing their impressive optical quality – even with lenses up to 400mm!!

Below Images taken by Luke Gardner in the UK using a REVORING Variable Neutral Density + CPL filter

Below images taken by Matthias Conrad in Germany, using the REVORING Variable Neutral Density + CPL filter

Below images taken by David Akoubian in USA, using the REVORING Variable Neutral Density + CPL filter

 

Testing, testing and more testing! We are our own worse critics at H&Y, always looking for ways to improve our products, especially the REVORING. Our ambassadors have also played an integral part in this journey. In fact, with their expertise and field testing, we have been able to make immediate, yet subtle design changes which have a big impact on the product's performance. One of those changes will be gapless edges, which can be seen below

But, it doesn't stop there. We are committed to reviewing all of your suggestions, and where possible, we will try our hardest to implement any of your ideas to help improve the REVORING.

 

 

 

The following shipping prices and visible locations show an estimate as to what will be charged in our survey after the campaign has ended. Our intention is to ship worldwide!

COVID-19 Shipping - During our continued research, we have come to learn a great deal about the temporary rise in shipping costs, and reduced services offered by 3PL and shipping partners as a result of COVID-19. The below prices reflect what it costs to ship a REVORING pledge today with an experienced crowdfunding 3PL partner we have in place. We will continue our research with a goal to improve the overall shipping cost, if at all possible.

VAT, GST, Taxes & Duty - In order for us to make the REVORING as competitive as possible, we have worked hard bringing the price down to what we feel is an attractive level, especially for the campaign. This does mean that while we would love to include the cost of Shipping, VAT, GST and Duty, we simply do not have the room to do this. At the moment, we are consuming a portion of the higher shipping costs, and so any further taxes and duty costs importing the REVORING will be at the cost of the backer. We will continue our research into other options, and if we find a solution, we will keep everyone updated. 

 

 

H&Y was founded in Hong Kong back in 2006, with the sole purpose of developing and providing high quality filter products. This quickly turned into H&Y becoming one of the leading choice of brands in ASIA.

Fast forward to the present, and you will see that H&Y continues to manufacture new and exciting filter systems at a competitive price point, through concept design and the continuous process of innovation being an integral part of the company focus. This has led to a unique approach to the development of the company’s product range, with the requirements of the user being a key driving force in the company’s ambition to deliver functional and beautiful, filters and accessories. 

The very first major breakthrough in technological advancements came from the launch of the K-Series magnetic square filter holder system in 2017. The sole quest for everyone at H&Y, is to produce the most economically advanced range of accessories for Photographers & Videographers and this was the first step!

 

Kenny, the chief and brains behind the design, has spent many waking hours perfecting the REVORING, but like all good product ideas, we have had to go through months of testing and design changes to reach this point! From the very beginning, we called upon our ambassadors to get involved in helping us manoeuvre through the slalom of fine-tuning the REVORING to make sure it was the amazing product it was always designed to be.

We turned to Kickstarter and Indiegogo for its historical success in brining new photographic innovations to life, and for the positive impact the backer community can have on a brand new concept and design.

 We have worked our way through many prototypes and samples so that we can perfect our design. Many new features have been added along the way, with more confirmed still to come! We are pretty confident you are going to love the REVORING!

story:
Hi guys, my name is Lex!

I am an overweight college student trying desperately to lose weight and inspire others along the way to both get healthier, but also accept their flaws. After being teased from the age of nine about my weight, I’m putting my foot down and saying enough is enough. I use YouTube as my media platform to connect with others. If you’d like to see more of me and see what I’m all about, my username is LexBiagini. Check me out!

Currently I am operating on an old, shitty camera that affects the quality of my videos. I am hoping to raise money to purchase a better camera for your viewing pleasure! With a better quality camera I can also diversify my videos more since I would be able to film things in greater detail.

If I don’t reach my goal of $2000 through this fundraiser, I will set the moeny aside until I have put away enough of my own money to buy a high quality camera. I assure you, the money will not be wasted nor spent on anything other than things to better my YouTube channel.

As I’m sure a lot of us probably already know, losing weight is hard and I have tried and failed many times, but with the support of all of my fans and followers, it will be much harder to give up on myself knowing that you all are pushing me forward. I promise to reward all of your support with lots of pictures and videos of my soon-to-be SMOKING hot body!

I understand that not everybody can afford to contribute and that’s okay! If you don’t have a few dollars to spare, you can still help me reach my goal by subscribing to me on YouTube, telling your friends, sharing this on Facebook, and publishing this on any blogs or websites that you have.

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and helping me out on this journey of a lifetime.

story:
Short Summary

Raising money to pursue a career in music photography. I am limited by the camera I currently have and would love to keep producing images that make band fans smile!

It's the only thing I'm good at so it means the world to me to keep pursuing my passion.

What We Need & What You Get

1 - Canon 6D Camera

You get many photo print options of photos I've shot, or photography lessons!

http://www.flickr.com/photos/47943102@N06/ <- my work!

And the satisfaction of helping a broke student out!


The Impact

Reaching my goal will make it so much easier for me to start schooling and touring. Which is my dream life goal in itself.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just wish me luck! 
I appreciate everyone regardless of a contribution. 

:)

Shipping Now!

How to use

===>  Click here

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1fjQWZ7e6xi1_q9tMSAVrhcMmbib0CPEj

We have filled Cap with all of the essential features that a 3D camera requires and more! You can use Cap to capture your life and then anyone with a VR headset can see what you see!

Cap is small and only weighs 114g, so it’s perfect for carrying around anywhere you go.

Cap’s battery supports 1900mAh, offering up to 120 minutes of continuous recording with a single full charge.

Thanks to its field of view, aspect ratio, and image distortion that are designed to match a VR headset, Cap is the first 3D camera to create footage that can be viewed through your VR headset on any existing platform, even if the platform does not support a 3D format. With other 3D or VR cameras, the images you export from the camera cannot be watched directly—you need special software to play it with the right field-of-view, aspect ratio, and anti-distortion calibration. If a platform does not support a 3D format, you cannot upload or live-stream on that platform. That’s what makes Cap special.

Cap can 3D live-stream directly to Facebook, YouTube, Periscope, Twitch, and any platform’s PC client, no matter whether the platform is 3D-enabled or not. Live-stream in 3D and start being different!

Cap can help you have a 3D video chat or 3D video conference. You just need to connect Cap to a PC and run your favorite chat software, and your friend can see you in VR, which is as vivid as if you were right there with them.

You can upload your 3D video or photo captured with Cap onto any existing platform. Relive your favorite memories as if you were there again!

You can download raw footages captured by Cap at this link:

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/14TnCioyMb0SRa0LIWETS3f0KrpMjQlH7

Cap is equipped with two lenses that are bionic and designed to match the distance between human eyes. The high 4K resolution can record every detail. It imitates how your eyes capture the world and creates vivid 3D vision.

Cap can transfer its view to your mobile phone from up to 65 feet away, so you can see what they’re seeing though a First Person View (FPV) vividly in 3D with a VR headset. Be your dog for a day, see life through a different view!

Cap uses two microphones to simultaneously record stereophonic sound. When one mic is heard through the left earphone, and the other mic through the right, it creates a pleasant sense of width that is absent in a mono recording.

With Cap’s time-lapse function, you can create time-lapse photography easily. Just set up the shooting frequency and Cap will shoot automatically. You’ll easily get phenomenal time-lapse footage.

With WiFi, you can use the Cap App to preview, control, download and re-play with your smartphone. It is available on both iOS and Android.

Cap can easily be mounted anywhere with any action camera accessories. You can mount Cap on a tripod, selfie stick, gimble, or head strap to create different effects and record from different perspectives.


 Help us by sharing MIX with your friends!   

How do you live-stream or video chat with Cap?

If you want to be seen in VR, you can connect Cap to a computer via a USB cable and choose Cap as the default camera, then begin your live-stream or video chat on the platform PC client. The audience can use an iPhone or Android phone on the platform at the same time and put the phone into a VR headset to watch.

Can I use a Mac to live-stream or video chat with Cap? 

No, Cap cannot connect to Mac for live-stream or video chat. But you can use Mac to upload the video or picture to a platform from Cap’s micro SD card.

What’s the video format of Cap?

The video format is MP4.

How big is the on-board storage?

There is no on-board storage, you should put a micro SD card into Cap.

What is the maximum supported Micro SD card storage?

128G.

Where can I download the app for Cap?

The instructions that will be shipped with Cap will tell you how to access the app.

Is Cap compatible with a standard tripod?

Yes, Cap is compatible with a standard tripod. It has a 1/4" standard screw hole for 1/4" universal camera accessories, so Cap can easily be mounted anywhere with any action camera accessories.

Can I set Cap to white balance?

There are five modes you can choose: Auto, Sunny, Cloudy, I Light (filament lamp light), and F Light (fluorescent lamp light).

What is the field of view for Cap’s lenses?

The field of view for the lenses is 100° diagonal.

Is Cap able to accommodate different light source frequencies?

There are two options for light source frequency: 50Hz & 60Hz. You can set it according to different situations to get a better effect. 

Is there a Power Saving Mode?

Yes, there is a Power Saving Mode. When you are recording, if you do not touch any button, the LCD will become black after 20s, 30s or 60s, according to the duration you choose.

 

Ways to Contact Us  

1. Back our campaign and leave a comment on our Indiegogo page.  

2. Send a direct message to us on Indiegogo.  

3. For further support, contact antvr.com@gmail.com  

4. Follow us on our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/antvrofficial/

 

Press Kit

If you are a member of the press and need more resources, please download our press kit or reach us at pr@antvr.com

 

Partner

story:
Vuo Is Selected As A CES 2018 Innovation Awards HONOREE!
 
 

 

 

 

Meet Vuo, the first 360° 4K video camera that truly mirrors human eyesight. Vuo is equipped with two pairs of 180° lenses that are placed 65 mm apart, which is the average distance between people's eyes. This design, allows you to capture 360° around just like your natural eyes would view the world. Relive special moments with unparalleled realism through 360 social media platforms (Youtube 360, Facebook 360, Twitter 360), VR binoculars or 3D television.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Vuo offers two distinct modes. When you begin recording, if you hold Vuo vertically, it will film utilizing only two lenses in "One-eye Mode." Essentially, this will film videos in the same way as other 360° cameras on the market. 


If you hold Vuo horizontally, it will record with all four lenses in "Two-eyes Mode." The embedded gyro sensor will automatically detect how you are holding Vuo. In "Two-eyes Mode" you will be capable of recording stunningly realistic 3D video. 

 

 

Control Vuo manually through its simple two-button shooting controls or remotely through the companion application. Once you are finished shooting, you can edit it into different modes (VR, 360° or 3D). 

 
 

 

Content shot on Vuo can be seen through an array of viewing experiences! Use a Head Mounted Display (HMD) for an immersive visual and audio VR experience. For a more casual and affordable experience use a cardboard VR headset to view VR content from your smartphone. For 3D video content, use 3D glasses or even display it on a 3D TV for images and videos that pop right out of the screen!

Share your content with friends or family on various social media platforms directly from the Vuo application. Sharing can be done instantaneously to Instagram or 360 compatible platforms such as Facebook 360 & Youtube 360.

 

 

Vuo is the world's first stereoscopic 4K 360° camera. Vuo accounts for the fact that your eyes are viewing an object from two different lines of sight. By accounting for this, the overlapping visual fields are able to gain depth perception which enhances the realism of the VR or 3D viewing experience.

The human eye is a very delicate organ that enables you to recognize elaborate three-dimensional views through the reception of external light. The human eyes are separated by approximately 65 mm, which is called a parallax. Your eyes naturally account for this separation when focusing on an object. However, this parallax has never been replicated in the VR functions of other 360° cameras.

While other 360° cameras boast VR functionality, they are only able to account for the separation between your eyes through an algorithm. Basically, other 360° cameras simply copy the same image and move it a set number of millimeters apart. Vuo is the first camera equipped with pairs of lenses to correspond to each eye, allowing you to capture your viewing reality precisely in the same way as your eyes!

 

 

 

Vuo is a top of the line 4K camera with a resolution of 3840 x 3840 @ 30 fps. Vuo is equipped with a 4K processor, 128 GB of internal storage, and a 2000 mAh lithium ion battery. 

Vuo will be offered in two colors (White & Black). Color selection will be done through survey before shipping.

 

 

 

 

We at Vuo have spent years developing the hardware and software to allow people to capture and create content from two different lines of sight, thereby mimicking human eye site. Drawing from our years of technical experience, we were able to create the world's first binocular 360 camera “Vuo”, Our goal with Vuo is to create value that bring about a better quality of life for people by capturing moments and memories as they were meant to be captured.

We at Vuo have spent years developing the hardware and software to allow people to capture and create content from two different lines of sight, thereby mimicking human eye site. Drawing from our years of technical experience, we were able to create the world's first binocular 360 camera “Vuo”, Our goal with Vuo is to create value that bring about a better quality of life for people by capturing moments and memories as they were meant to be captured.

 

 

 

Product Design V1.1
We release production photos of Vuo V1.1. The internal design of the mass production product has been completed. Now the components and the board assembly procedure have been entered. In addition, we are also developing firmware and software for the camera. As you can see in the picture, the distance between the left lens and the right lens is 65mm. Two 1/4 inch nuts are located on the side and the bottom of the camera that you can use tripod with it.

There are two colors of the camera, white and black, and we will make a survey that you can select colors before shipping. The material of the camera body may change slightly in the future –for example, matt material without reflection and the additional metal parts that can drain heat.-

The main board design has been completed as above. We will do our best to update the final specifications and the sample videos from Vuo. Thank you for your patience and continuous support.

story:
Short Summary


Rani Burnat from Bil'in Village in the West Bank, has been participating in and documenting the village's weekly protests against the wall and settlements for nearly a decade. Rani takes photographs and writes a summary of the protests and posts it online keeping hundreds around the world updated on Bil'in. Rani does all this in a wheelchair because he was shot by an Israeli army sniper during a student demonstration in Ramallah on the second day of the second intifada, September 30, 2000.

In recent months Rani's wheelchairs and camera have been broken during attacks by Israeli soldiers at the weekly protests. On June 7th 2014 Israeli soldiers attacked a group of journalists at the demonstration, including Rani, and broke their cameras. A few weeks later on July 14th, 2014, Israeli soldiers beat Rani again; this time breaking his last remaining 'backup' wheelchair. Rani's more suitable chair had been broken for a while, which has happened many times before, either because of attacks or because the village's rugged terrain is too rough on it.

Rani does not receive financial assistance due to his injuries though he needs and pays for care beyond these two wheelchairs. Along with his wife Hanadi he is also raising a set of 5 year old triplets, two girls and a boy, which leaves little extra time and funds for his own care. Their home is always a welcoming place for anyone coming to Bil'in from around the world and this campaign is a way of returning a bit of their generous hospitality. 

A group of friends has stepped in to ensure Rani gets the wheelchairs replaced ASAP but this time we need financial support to do this. We'd also like to see Rani's camera replaced and give him and his family further support as well. This would mean that at least in the near future and especially during these turbulent days they can have a little peace of mind and keep doing all the great things they already do.

What We Need & What You Get

Where your funding will go:

$3,000 will get Rani a new suitable wheelchair.

$1,500 will replace Rani's spare wheelchair.

$4,500 will replace Rani's camera.

$6,000 would allow Rani a better level of care and his family basic financial security for the next year or so.

$15,000 TOTAL

If the goal isn't reached, all the money raised (minus indiegogo and bank charges) will be spent in the order listed above: wheelchairs first, then camera (so Rani can keep working) and anything extra will go to cover ongoing medical costs and basic financial security.

Because of the time and costs involved in giving perks to funders we've decided to avoid them in order to ensure that the maximum percentage of funding goes right to Rani and his family. But, funders and supporters and encouraged to:

1. Email Rani at raniab281@yahoo.com and ask to sign up for his news updates.

2. Check out a website setup by friends for periodic updates at:http://friendsofrani.wordpress.com

3.  Visit Bil'in! Pay Rani a visit and you will undoubtedly receive generous hospitality along with a good laugh.

The Impact

As the economy and social assistance in Palestine is in shambles there are many Palestinian individuals and families in great need of similar support. During this time of Israel's war on Gaza we especially encourage you to support Palestinians there as well. Still, your support for Rani's young family will mean ensuring his health, mobility and employment. It helps further the family along the path to becoming self-sustainable, something that should be a given for everyone, without having to ask for help. That is exactly what Rani is working toward, along with the hundreds of people he updates on Bil'in Village's resistance and your contribution will keep him rolling!

Risks & Challenges

There are very few risks and challenges involved in this campaign because the friends of Rani who are managing it on the ground have completed all the necessary functions before. Also thanks to this platform all the funds will go directly into Rani's bank account once the campaign has ended, so there will be no need for complicated international funds transfers, and Rani can get on with his life as quickly as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize these are not the simples financial times for many, even outside of Palestine, so if you can't contribute please talk about this campaign with your friends, family and any other group you take part in! Please also share it online using indiegogo's share tool or just by copying and pasting where possible.

And finally, know your support and funding are both very much appreciated, THANK YOU!

If you'd like to contact us for any reason please send an email to: ronamerrill[at]yahoo.com or raniab281[at]yahoo.com

story:
How many times have you passed up a photo opportunity because you didn’t want to stop and take off your backpack to get your camera out? 

With the Rotation backpack, you can access your camera gear in seconds ­— without taking off the backpack.

 

Learn more about the details of each Rotation Backpack below.

Rotation 22L
 
Rotation 34L
 
Rotation 50L+
 
 
Mandy Lea at The Grand Canyon
 
 

The original Rotation180® Backpack has proven itself in the field, earning the accolades and awards to prove it. Now, this next generation Rotation backpack series features improved features and functionality, making it the most amazing photo-centric adventure pack on the market today.

Think Tank Product Designer, Joe Hanssen (Photo by Jerry Dodrill)
 
 
Andrea Johnson in Patagonia
 

 

Video Testimonial by Dan Carr — Shutter Muse

We invented rotation180 technology so that photographers can take faster photographs, to capture moments that otherwise would have been lost.

 

 

Simply rotate the integrated belt pack to the front of your body and BOOM! Your camera is at your fingertips. Snap the shot, slide the belt pack back in and you’re on your way!

 

Sometimes inspiration comes at an inopportune moment, like when you’re hiking with a group. You might feel some pressure to keep up with your friends and not make them wait while you stop to get your camera gear out… take a few shots… pack all your gear back into your backpack… then return to the trail.

With the Rotation backpack, you can instantly access your gear and get the shot before anyone even notices you’ve stopped!

The Rotation backpack is 2 bags in 1. It’s very easy to separate the belt pack from the backpack, so you can use it independently for a short walk-about or scramble to a precarious vantage point.

The Rotation backpack series features a 10-point adjustable harness system — including torso adjustment — so you can customize the fit to your body.

 

The Rotation backpack series features top quality materials that are rugged and weather resistant, such as high-density nylon, YKK Aquaseal Guard zippers, and a water-repellent coating inside and out. 

Numerous pockets and a large main compartment provide ample room for personal items such as a jacket, layers, hat, gloves, lunch, etc. Two rows of daisy chain and ice axe/trekking pole loops offer many attachment points for external capacity. 

Plus, a side pocket with stretch fabric and cord lock fit most large water bottles. 

 

Ultralight materials keep weight to a minimum while perforated high-density foam topped with mesh keep you cool, dry and comfortable on long days in the field.

 

ABOUT US

The quality of our gear has led many photographers to imagine a behemoth company of hundreds of staff with a budget of millions of dollars. In reality we are a small company with 19 employees that started in a garage 15 years ago. This homegrown team is the force behind the brands Think Tank Photo and MindShift Gear brands, creating the most inventive and effective solutions for all photographic situations. We go to great lengths to listen to our core customers and translate their feedback in everything we create.

Think Tank’s sister company MindShift Gear launched the original rotation180 Professional on Kickstarter in 2013 and we are excited to provide these special offers to the backers that made our company and the Rotation Backpack Series possible.

 

 

WARRANTY

We warrant our products against defects in material or workmanship for as long as you use the product. Our defect rate is far under 1% due to the highest quality materials and craftsmanship. On top of that, we replace small parts for free. Anything replaceable, any reason, shipped anywhere in the world. For FREE.

Simply rotate the integrated belt pack to the front of your body and BOOM! Your camera is at your fingertips. Snap the shot, slide the belt pack back in and you’re on your way!
 



Sometimes inspiration comes at an inopportune moment, like when you’re hiking with a group. You might feel some pressure to keep up with your friends and not make them wait while you stop to get your camera gear out… take a few shots… pack all your gear back into your backpack… then return to the trail.
With the Rotation backpack, you can instantly access your gear and get the shot before anyone even notices you’ve stopped!

The Rotation backpack is 2 bags in 1. It’s very easy to separate the belt pack from the backpack, so you can use it independently for a short walk-about or scramble to a precarious vantage point.




The Rotation backpack series features a 10-point adjustable harness system — including torso adjustment — so you can customize the fit to your body.
 


The Rotation backpack series features top quality materials that are rugged and weather resistant, such as high-density nylon, YKK Aquaseal Guard zippers, and a water-repellent coating inside and out. 
Numerous pockets and a large main compartment provide ample room for personal items such as a jacket, layers, hat, gloves, lunch, etc. Two rows of daisy chain and ice axe/trekking pole loops offer many attachment points for external capacity. 
Plus, a side pocket with stretch fabric and cord lock fit most large water bottles. 
 








Ultralight materials keep weight to a minimum while perforated high-density foam topped with mesh keep you cool, dry and comfortable on long days in the field.
 
ABOUT US
The quality of our gear has led many photographers to imagine a behemoth company of hundreds of staff with a budget of millions of dollars. In reality we are a small company with 19 employees that started in a garage 15 years ago. This homegrown team is the force behind the brands Think Tank Photo and MindShift Gear brands, creating the most inventive and effective solutions for all photographic situations. We go to great lengths to listen to our core customers and translate their feedback in everything we create.
Think Tank’s sister company MindShift Gear launched the original rotation180 Professional on Kickstarter in 2013 and we are excited to provide these special offers to the backers that made our company and the Rotation Backpack Series possible.





 

 
WARRANTY
We warrant our products against defects in material or workmanship for as long as you use the product. Our defect rate is far under 1% due to the highest quality materials and craftsmanship. On top of that, we replace small parts for free. Anything replaceable, any reason, shipped anywhere in the world. For FREE.

story:
NANO1 is the world’s smallest astronomy camera. The NANO1 brings the astronomy imaging experience to you by making it lightweight and simple to use. 

Forget DSLR cameras or heavy tripods - NANO1 is your perfect companion for astronomy exploration and capture. 

 

Foreword 

In 2014, I took a trip to see the night skies with the National University of Singapore. Growing up in an urban city like Singapore, it was my first experience of the rural night skies. The inky black sky was filled with stars and the Milky Way spanned across the horizon. It was an impressive sight for a city dweller like me and I wanted to capture and share it with my friends and family. 

As a professional photographer, astronomy imaging should be straightforward, but it wasn't. Astronomy imaging was difficult and complex, with technical concepts not common to “everyday” photography.  

With the help from local astronomers, I learned how to capture and process images of the night skies, and with their help I want to make a camera that simplifies astronomy imaging for you.

We created the NANO1 astronomy camera to make astronomy imaging small, smart and social. 

It uses an augmented reality star map to guide you across the constellations, astronomy exposure preset to simplify astronomy image settings and WiFi control and file transfer to share your images through your smartphone.

Back us to put the wonders of the night sky and exploration in the hands of everyone. 

- Grey Tan, Founder

As Seen On

 Astronomy sharing at TEDxUbud 

 

 Captured by NANO1

 Working prototype demonstration of features.

Milky Way shot using our kit lens in Mersing, Malaysia as part of our early prototype test. 

Images of the Moon and Singapore's skyline using adapted telephoto lenses. 

Collect light at 25x intensity by using the NANO1 in prime focus. NANO1 is the world's smallest astronomy camera, giving minimal blockage of the front aperture. 

Long exposures can be made in 1/25 the usual amount of time. 1 hour exposure reduced to less than 3 minutes.

Check here for more information. https://bit.ly/2QLtvIf

NANO1 is ultra-portable for an astronomy camera. At less than 100g (3.5 oz) with the kit lens attached and 63.25mm (2.49") on its longest side - NANO1 is easily the world’s smallest astronomy camera. Pair it with our mini-tripod and it tips the scale at 250g (8.8 oz) - well below the lightest DSLR or Mirrorless camera with a lens attached. 

 Augmented Reality Star Map 

 NANO1 guides you through the stars and constellations, with an augmented reality star map tethered through your smart phone. 

It also gives you the best image capture settings using our smart algorithm, for the best image quality. 

Patented Noise Reduction Algorithm

A patented noise reduction algorithm cleans it up further, ready to post on social media.

Dual lens mount system

The small black circle accepts small M12 lenses. The larger white circle in this prototype shows the C mount, for professional Cine lenses or adapted SLR lenses and telescopes. (PCB exposed for clearer view. Production versions are covered.)

Share your images instantly. NANO1 pairs with Android and iOS to let you share your images with your friends and family on social media. No computers, card readers nor pesky adapters required. 

  

NANO1 in Black/Silver Edition 

  

1.25" telescope adapter 

Canon or Nikon lens adapter 

3-12mm F1.4 M12 Zoom lens (16.5mm-66mm Equivalent) 

NANO1 Specifications 

Our Team 

CEO: Grey is a professional photographer who was inspired by astronomy imaging as an undergraduate, while studying in the National University of Singapore. He came up with the idea of TinyMOS after he realized that astrophotography is complicated and requires heavy and expensive equipment. With the cameras TinyMOS designs, he hopes to make astronomy imaging more accessible to everyone. 

CTO: Lih Wei is a graduate from the NUS Faculty of Engineering and was the Chief Product Engineer for Berner International while he was on the prestigious NUS Overseas College program. He has assisted in the design and launch of 2 nano-satellites and led the design and manufacture of IoT connected industrial systems. 

Head of Operations : Jeston is a Computer Engineering graduate from NUS. He was part of the design team for embedded systems and low-level system design in the gaming hardware juggernaut, Razer. 

TinyMOS main campaign video in Youtube 1080p

Campaign video credits:

Y&R Vietnam Y&R Singapore Marcus Rebeschini Beer Kittisak Poonnotok Dominick Nakpil Farhan Darma Lim De Neng Boon Tan Viraj Chouhan Kris Childress Grey Tan Lihwei Chia Jeston Teo Goh Raphael Vanessa Lim

FAQs 

  • Can you use it in the day?

Yes, the camera can be used for day to day photography. IR filter can be removed for better astronomy photography as well.

  • Why use a small sensor?

Small sensor means a smaller system size. A smaller sensor allows you to use a smaller lens and get more zoomed in. 

  • Can it do time lapse?  

Yes. It takes time lapse videos as well as a sequence of time lapse stills. The video mode is good for convenience. Time lapse stills are good for more advanced users who want to stitch their own time lapses.

  • Will it work in winter?

Mostly yes, it depends on where you are. It’s designed for temperatures of -10 to 55 degree Celsius.

  • Are your photos edited?

Yes, but the enhancements are built into the camera. You can disable them if you like.

  • Isn’t the point to star system already on the Play Store on Android and iOS?

Yes, and no. When the TINY1 and the NANO1 concept was designed, it was the only camera that has a star map with an augmented reality (see through camera) mode. It appears to be available on some mobile platforms now, but its great to be able to frame the shot with the preview visible and capture it.

  • Does it shoot RAW?

Yes, it shoots RAW. We've created a utility that will be made available, to convert the RAW file to DNG.

  • Further reading on NANO1 design https://www.tinymos.com/nano1/2018/10/19/nano1-astronomy

story:
Hi, my name is Adam Warner and I'm a photographer. In high school I took a photography class as a required fine arts credit, and I used a family members Ricoh 35mm camera... I was hooked. For the next 10 or so years, I played with more 35mm cameras, polaroids, 110mm cameras, dark room development and learning as much as I could. 

In 2005, I moved into the digital photography world and launched AAH Photography. I photographed flowers, landscapes, babies and children, models and weddings. In 2006, I launched Beholder Media where I photographed live music, bands and concerts. In 2007, I started photographing fashion models, runway fashion, marathons, sports and special events. In 2009, I changed AAH to simply Adam Warner Photography; the way it should have been from the start. In 2010, I took the leap to become a full-time photographer. This full-time endeavor brought a wide variety of clients, corporate portraits, bigger weddings, more live music, commercial photography, family portraits, landscape commission photography, and even some food photography.

Then in March 2012, a friend of mine was scheduled to shoot his first wedding and came over to get a wealth of advice. He also asked if he could use my Canon 70-200mm f/2.8L IS USM lens which I said was fine, I always like helping a friend. A few hours later he informed me that it had been stolen out of his car. I was devastated, it was as if I had just lost an extension of my body. The cost of replacing this fine piece of equipment, $2,200. This is where I need your help, without this lens, I cannot produce the amazing photographs that my clients, friends, family and fans have come to love. Even the minimum $10 donation helps me get that much closer to reaching my goal. Every single donation will get you an original 8x10 Adam Warner Photography print, plus other services depending on the level of your charity. Please take a look at the donations levels on this page and see if there is a way that we can help each other. Thank you very much.

- Adam Warner

story:
2) Submit the following google form to check the information.

GOOGLE FORM

3) Free gifts (Backdrop carrying bag & Mirror sheet) will go together when we ship out your reward.

 

 

 

Foldio evolving

Previously, we launched the Foldio projects to create a portable studio that allows anyone to take high quality photos. Thanks to your support, we successfully funded and delivered Foldio1 & Foldio2 to our backers.

From 3 years of experience creating the Foldio studio, we’ve learned that we have a lot of room for improvement. Now we are going to introduce our third Foldio project, the Foldio3 that’s upgraded immensely from our previous projects.

 

Keeping it simple

To improve the Foldio, we pondered on what the most important feature for our new project should be. We concluded that the portable studio should be uncomplicated and easy to use.

That is why we tried to make the Foldio a simple and neat tool for everyone, whether you are carrying it, using it or just keeping it at home.

 

 

Rewards

 

Features

Bigger, but more compact design

Current photo studios of similar size are designed to fold as a square shape. Because of this, they are difficult to carry around or store in a neat and compact way.

To overcome this issue, we created a new design for the Foldio3.


This design enables the Foldio3 to be compact when folded up whereas when it is opened, it transforms dramatically into a 25 inch x 25 inch studio.

  

 

Magnetic structure

Like our previous Foldio series, we applied the magnetic structure to Foldio3. This enables the setup to be in 10 sec. Not to mention that we use high quality magnets to hold the Foldio3 in a sturdy shape for extensive use.

 

 

Simple backdrop set up

If you have any experience using mini studios, you will know that it’s really cumbersome to fix the backdrop. This gets worse for bigger sized photo studios.

We designed a new way to fix the backdrop in a simple and easy way. You can just attach the backdrop at the bottom part of Foldio3 and unroll it up to fix at the top side.

 

 

High quality black backdrop

Foldio3's black backdrop enables you to take higher quality pictures compared to when you are using other black backdrops . With our backdrop, you will have a clear black color without any reflection on the background.

 

Upgraded lighting design

High performance triple diffuser LED device applied.

We focused on maximizing the lighting performance by upgrading functions of our lights and adjusting the location. As a result, it's designed to decrease shadows of subjects more efficiently than our previous Foldio versions.  

 

 

The Halo Bar

We created the “Halo Bar” to enhance your photography experience. Now create more amazing photos using the Halo bars.

The Halo bar is attachable, so you can fix the Halo bar on the side or bottom magnet spots of Foldio3 according to your needs. Set up the perfect lighting using the Halo bars.

Make better lighting conditions combining the Halo bar lights with the main lights of the Foldio3.

 

Or you can use the Halo bars separately to create a different atmosphere.

 

 

Dimming controller

Now you can control lighting of the Foldio3 by using the Dimming controller. This device lets you control all the lights of the Foldio3 and Halo bars in a simple way.

 

Create 360 image with Foldio360

You can create 360 images using the Foldio3 and the Foldio360 together. For objects that were a little too big for the Foldio2, the Foldio3 is the perfect match with the Foldio360 smart turntable. The Foldio3 widens the use of the Foldio360 for photographers, small business owners, bloggers, online sellers and many more. (More information about Foldio360)

Specifications

Process

Gallery

Foldio3 helps you take high quality photos for bigger subjects in an easier way. Now, start creating amazing work with Foldio3.  

 

 

 

 

 

 

About us

We are a creative, dedicated team with members in California, and Seoul. Our passion is finding new ways to harness and improve upon smartphone technology. So far, we have done this with three highly successful Kickstarter projects, the Foldio, Foldio 2 and Foldio360. We hope to empower photographers everywhere with simple, useful, and cost effective tools can be used everyday for business or hobby. We thank you for supporting our new project.

 

 

 

Press Kit

story:
Hi there! I'm Nika and I've been taking pictures at Dagorhir events for a little over a year now. During that time, I've been studying video and photography at Valley Forge Christian College. One of the really cool things about my program is that students are allowed to check out high tech equipment for short periods of time in order to work on assignments or personal projects.

However, I just graduated (yay!) and now I no longer have access to that equpiment. In order to continue taking pictures of you lovely people, I need a camera. Unfortunately as a poor college graduate with school loans to pay off, I can't currently afford the equipment that I need to keep taking pictures. 

So I've turned to you all. 

Provided I can get some donations and make this all happen, I'll be selling myself out at Ragnarok to take pictures of you, your friends, your dog, and whatever else you can think of. Take a look at the packages I'm offering, and decide what fits your vanity best! Or send me a message at nikacaelyn@gmail.com and I can create a package on here to reflect what you are looking for. 

Thanks for any and all assistance you can give!

Nika

story:
What is a Selfie?




About SelfieStar Monopod

Every Selfie has a story to tell!



How far would you go for a perfect selfie?
Lets admit!, we all love selfies!... in fact most of us are obsessed with selfies!

But how many times have we regretted by not getting that perfect selfie shot?


It's not the best smartphone or digital camera that gets you the best selfie pictures, it's the way you hold your camera that helps you to get the best shots!



SelfieStar Monopod is an effortless, simple and easy to use tool, which helps you to take breathtaking selfie images. 


Works with all smartphone of screen size 3in ~ 6.5in



We never know, when it is the best time for a selfie!

For Whom?

MUST HAVE TOOL for anyone who love Selfies.
In a Selfie obsessed world, there is no point mentioning for whom it is!
What we do know is that it's best for - Group Selfies!




This bike selfie was taken with SelfieStar Monopod:


And this one too:


What Makes SelfieStar Monopod Special?

  • Comes with a selfie timer - Bluetooth enabled
  • Easy to carry
  • Fits in your pocket! (ie; weighs 144grms / 0.3lbs & folded length is 18.8cm or 7.4 inches)
  • 180 Degree Rotateable
  • Fits best for 55-85mm phones / cameras (ie; any small, medium or large screen smart phone will fit in with ease. NOT RECOMMENDED for iPads or Other tablets).
  • Holds upto 680grams / 1.5lbs
  • Comes with standard tripod insert, you can install in any 1/4" tripod stand.
  • Works with all types of SmartPhones & Digital Cameras - Adjustable frame
  • Works on all Mobile Platforms - iOS, Android, Windows, BlackBerry .. everything!









Product Specifications




Components

We have used environment friendly, recyclable High-Density Polyethylene (HDPE, SPE 2 ) Plastic along with Stainless Steel to manufacture the unit. It is sturdy, reliable and not-so-easily breakable.




Current Status

Our fully functional prototype was ready way back in early 2014. 

We have also produced 400 units of fully functional devices as pilot, most of those has been shipped across to our pilot customers.

Please note: You may find similar products in the market, but SelfieStars are made of HIGH QUALITY material such as Stainless Steel and high grade plastic. Though it looks similar, there is a huge different in QUALITY and Sturdiness. 

We require your assistance to bring this to Mass production.




Fund Utilisation

Your fund will go into unit production, testing, packaging and shipping.  


Perks





Risks & Challenges

There are no challenges in production or testing or packaging. But we are yet to finalise on Shipping Partner. This can be done only once we have an estimate of the number of units we can ship to each location. 

Rest assured, we are here to deliver what we commit. So, even if we have to pay a little extra on the shipping, we will deliver the unit.


Other Ways You Can Help

In case if you do not wish to purchase, you might know someone who needs it!, please share this page via Twitter or Facebook or Instagram or Google+

Every single contribution helps!

This will enable us to bring this amazing tool to the market. 

Lets make some noise about it!


Questions?

Please feel free to mail us at hello@fezents.com


About Us

We are a division of Fezents Technologies LLP, based in New Delhi, India. We have a warehouse in HongKong, from where we will be shipping out all our international packages.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Andrew Pan. I am an aspiring fashion and portrait photographer from Greensboro, NC.
This campaign is to help me get a much needed camera upgrade. All the photos seen in the montage I have provided are taken with my first (and current) DSLR camera the Nikon D60 that I recieved as a gift in 2009. On January 26th, 2013, the camera's shutter died thus rendering the camera unusable. The cost of the shutter plus labor and shipping is not worth saving it, no matter how much I love it.

In fall, 2013 I hope to return to my studies in order to gain a degree in Commercial photography from Randolph Community College in Asheboro North Carolina.

This campaign will be used to upgrade to the camera in which I will be using for my schooling and work which will give me much better picture quality and will also provide a professional way of video recording which is a avenue that most photographers nowadays need to be familiar with (and an avenue that I am extremely familiar with!)

Having my funds met would allow me to continue my pursuit in this career and will also provide me the chance to better my self, my portfolio and my career. I am hoping that with this upgrade I will be able to shoot my undergrad and graduate portfolio(s). This will give me the best chance to move foreward in the education of this field. A link below will connect you to my online portfolio depicting all of my photographs and also other art forms I participate in.

http://www.flickr.com/photos/andrewmichaelgardner

What I Need 

A new DSLR.
I am not able to continue my work until I get a new camera.
The surplus I have put as my goal will go towards shipping, handeling and if there is any left over after that it will go towards needed accesories like a flash, microphone, bag, lenses etc. that are required for my courses.

The Impact

Having my funds met will allow me extreme releif. If this were to happen, I would be able to pull together the rest of my savings for tuition and other class expenses.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some other ways you can help is to simply tell your friends about me, what I'm doing and, if you're local, talk about my services. 

Like my facebook page here:

and thank you so much for your time, contributions and thoughts.

story:
Our Story

I have been searching for a descent standalone camera gimbal stabilizer for my camera gimbal.  I've tried using a number of products like the FY30 with average results because they were never really designed for the purpose.  Other purpose made products like the PicLoc are never in stock, and people have reported mixed results.


I've been a member on DIYDrones for a while so posted a blog offering a reward of $100 for the first person to write some code to make an ArduIMU into a camera gimbal stabilizer.  Other members on DIYDrones joined and offered to contribute.  Its getting hard to track the pledges so I have created this project.


The Impact

Other products like the PicLoc are always out of stock and people have had mixed results.


Some multicopter/autopilot systems have camera stabilization functions, however sometimes you just need a standalone stabilizer that mounts onto the gimbal.  For example a 360 pan gimbal would not allow a cable to run up to the multicopter without fouling the cables when the camera operator


I know that ArduCopter has gimbal stabilization code in it, however, its designed to work on the APM and isn't standalone.  I also know that ArduIMU is a standalone IMU which can drive servos and receive R/C signals.  So I thought if someone could migrate migrate and improve the ArduCopters gimbal stabilization code onto an ArduIMU, it would be a fantastic


What We Need & What You Get

Project backers will make sure that the programmer is rewarded to make this software.   The code will be released as open source, so as a contributor you will help make this happen.  Contributions upto $199 will go directly to the programmer.


Funders/backers will get to vote which programmer gets the money based upon the best app.


I have added some perks for people who are just too lazy to try to compile the code and assembly the ArduIMU.  Those who want a plug and play setup can contribute $200+.  $100 will go towards the programmer, the rest will go towards the hardware cost.


The Specifications of the Stabilizer

Mandatory requirements (programmer must deliver these):

2 x channel PWM in and out to control the camera gimbals roll and pitch using a standard R/C RX and servos

Stabilize the camera gimbal to maintain a level attitude/bank angle

Real time R/C channel or serial CLI configuration of servo endpoint and gain/PID

Settings stored in NVRAM


Desirable requirements (additional bonus paid to the programmer for these features)

Pan/Yaw stabilization and control on a 3rd PWM channel +$25

PPM R/C input option +$10

"3D" mode, where the attitude/bank/yaw angle is held when the R/C stick is at neutral +$50

Working source code by 10 March 2012 +$50

Ability to tell the unit to keep pointing at point/region of interest such as a GPS coodinate/altitude $50

story:
So, Lets All Be Honest Here:

A few months back, my lovely Neon was in a bit of a pickle, barely getting me to and from work.  I looked around, and the only thing that I could sell that would bring me any sort of money was my camera rig.  And, though my heart was yelling at me, telling me not to, I sold the whole rig.  

With the weather beginning to warm up, and actually having time off, I'm already feeling the itch of needing to go out and shoot - and continue working on a project I was working on prior to selling.

What I'd Like to Do:

So if by some miracle you're still reading, cool! Towards the end of my time with my camera, I found myself really getting into not only HDR photography, but photographing the City of Detroit.  Both it's beauty and it's destruction.  I took several trips to the Packard Plant, Fisher Body Plant, and a few other misc abandoned buildings in the city.  Most of these buildings were forgotten long ago by all but the artists who turned these walls into their canvases.

I want to continue on with this vision, and attempt to capture Detroit in a different light than it is generally portrayed.  I'd like to use a mixture of my love for the city and the wonderful process of HDR to bring to life the city that so many have forgotten.

Art is something I've always been passionate about - weather it be music or photography.  The thing for me with photography has always been the ability to tell an entire story, simply with one single image.  

So, Where's My Money Actually Going?

This is an understandable question.  There are a few things that I'll be purchasing with the funds.  All of the funds raised will go directly to the costs of the camera and accessories, as well as fulfilling the tier rewards and shipping.

  1. Canon Rebel T3i kit with 18-55mm lens
  2. Tamron 10-24mm Super Wide-Angle 
  3. Battery Grip with Spare Batteries.
  4. Camera Bag
  5. Camera Strap

Now, if we manage to pass the goal, I'll go with a newer/updated body. The Tamron lens is absolutely beautiful and was my go-to lense before I sold my rig, so that is the lense I'm going to be getting no matter what body I go with.  The other bits are dependant on what we raise.  The body and lense are the main concerns, obviously.

What Do I Get Out of This Other Than Making You Happy?

Well, first and formost, any single dollar that you can give will be so appreciated it's not even funny.  What I've decided to offer you are different prints from once I make my way into the city to shoot.  The higher up the tiers you go, the larger the prints are and the more shots you will get. 

Once I receive my camera and make my way out and edit, I will post all of my shots in a dedicated gallery for your viewing pleasure and for you to select which prints you want and in what size brackets.  I will be able to do everything from a 4x6 postcard type shot, to a full poster-sized canvas print.  All prints will be done at Kinkos, and that price is rolled into what the money will go to - because printing isn't cheap.  

But I can't afford to give you moneys right now! :(

That's okay! I completely understand that times are tough right now.  But if you are unable to donate any thing to this campaign, I totally understand.  I just ask that you share this page with your friends and family. Even having someone looking and seeing what it is that I'm trying to do gives me hope that I will be able to continue follow this dream that I have.

story:
GET A BODY CAMERA

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

How does the LTE work? Is there a monthly cost?

There's no monthly cost for LTE because Shonin provides only the connectivity, not the data plan. Backers will have complete control over their data by providing their own SIM card with a data plan.

 

Is there a cost for cloud storage?

Not for Indiegogo backers. You guys are in this with us from the start, so you will get 2 years of free 10GB. But normally yes there will be a monthly cost for the premium level of our cloud capabilities including higher capacity storage.

 

Does the camera only record to the cloud or can it record to an internal SD card too?

Shonin Streamcam will *always* be recording to an internal SD card (an 8GB card is included). The cloud-recording capability is in addition to this and, when activated, it will record to *both* the internal SD card and the cloud. This way you will always have access to the full video even if there is bad reception.

 

What is the maximum micro SD card can the camera use?

Maximum is 64GB.

 

What are the differences between the LTE and the Wifi model?

The Wi-Fi model and LTE models are exactly the same in all respects, except that the cellular model can connect to the internet without using a phone, if you provide a SIM with a data plan and insert it into the device.

 

What resolution is the video?

You will be able to stream or upload video to the cloud at 720p. At the same time you will also be able to save video to the internal SD card in either 720p or 1080p (30fps).

 

How does the camera connect to the cloud?

The WiFi model connects to the cloud simply through a hotspot on your phone, or by connecting to an available WiFi network. You can control this from the settings in the Shonin app.

The Cellular model can also use the phone's hotspot, but also has the ability to connect directly to the cloud by itself when you insert a SIM card with a data plan directly into the camera.

 

Will there be both iOS and Android versions of the app?

Yes, absolutely.
