story:
Ultra Violet (UV) filters have been around for long time from the old film days. Their original purpose is to block UV light that would cause hazing in old film photos. Even modern films before digital photography are immune from UV light, digital cameras are not sensitive with UV light either.

In the meantime, users believe having a relative inexpensive filter in front of their expensive lens could provide some levels of protection, thus UV filters today are still widely used as a protection filter and they are the first accessory to buy with a purchase of a new lens.

However, most UV filters and protection filters in the market are made from a piece of thin glass. They offer little physical protection since the filter glass is easy to be broken, as discovered by users who have dropped their filters by accident.

 

 

 

 

 

The PowerUV protection filters from Aurora Aperture are real UV filters that can truly protect. They are made from chemically harden glass that offers much stronger protection than normal glass.

 

 

 

 

We choose the Corning® Gorilla® Glass 3 for the PowerUV protection filter, as it is the most widely used cover glass today in smartphones and tablets. Chemically harden glass is a proven and matured technology, adopting it to camera lens filter is only a matter of time. 

 

 

To demonstrate the impact resistant capability of the Gorilla® Glass 3 based PowerUV filters, we conduct a drop-ball test. The drop-ball test is based on the ANSI Z87.1-2003 standard which is used in the FDA 21 CFR 801.410 regulation. The original purpose of this test is for eyeglass certification and has been used over forty years. All eyeglasses and sunglasses sold in the US must pass this drop ball test.

In this impact test, a 5/8-inch steel ball weighting approximately 0.56 ounce (about 16 grams) is dropped from a height of 50 inches (about 1.27 meters) upon the surface of test target, and the test target must not be fractured. 

 

 

First, we gather a few traditional UV filters and put them through the drop-ball test.

 

 

As seen from above, all these UV filters failed the drop ball test, including a few premium brand filters such as Kenko Pro1D UV and B+W XS-Pro UV. Some UV filters did not even pass the test with a smaller steel ball of 7g, or less than half of the standard weight at 16g.

 

 

There is no surprise for this, since these filters are not built as real protection filters from the first place. We just want to use the test to break the illusion of traditional UV filters can provide protection to camera lenses. 

Now we put our PowerUV filter through the same drop-ball test. Not only it passed the standard test with flying color, we tried to break it by increasing the weight of the steel ball to 2 ounces (56 grams) , our Gorilla® Glass 3 based filters still pass the test. That is up to 3.5 times of standard test weight and 8 times of certain ultra thin UV filter failed limit.

 

 

As a comparison, we also tested a Sigma Ceramic Protector filter which is made from clear glass ceramic and is supposed to be stronger than normal glass . Although the Sigma protection filter did pass the standard test at 16 grams, it failed at the weight of 56 gram. 

 

 

Next is a scratch test. We put the PowerUV filter with a bunch of hard objects such as small rocks, keys, and pocket knife into a container on a vibration platform. We let it run through 30 minutes of vibration time and the filter will be examined for surface scratch.

Again, the PowerUV filters survive the scratch simulation test with flying colors. 

 

 

Traditional UV Filter manufactures market their premium filters by emphasizing the use of high quality optic glasses such as Schott B270®. Does the chemically harder glass materials such as Gorilla® Glass compromise optical performance when comparing B270®?

For UV filters, the most important optical performance metric is the transmittance rate for the visible spectrum (390nm to 700nm). Untreated optic glass such as Schott B270® is rated at 91.7%. After anti-reflection coating is applied the transmittance rate can be increased to 98% - 99%. 

Raw Gorilla® Glass 3 is rated at 92.3%. After applying multi layers of nano coatings our Gorilla® Glass 3 based PowerUV filters can achieve 99.6%, just as good as those traditional premium optic glass based UV filters.

 

 

We also conducted thorough testings in resolution and color reproduction and we find the Gorilla® Glass 3 based PowerUV filters are just as good as high quality UV filters built with Schott B270® glass.

Another optical aspect of UV filters is its anti ghost capability. Ghosting is caused by light reflections between an UV filter and a lens. We conducted ghost tests with the PowerUV filters and found no particular issue with the Gorilla® Glass 3 material. 

The multi layer nano coatings not only help increasing the transmittance rate, but also repels water, oil, and dust. Contaminants can be wiped off from the filters easily.

 

 

 

 

UV filters frame design is very simple as there is just a metal frame housing a single piece of glass and yet we have seen many UV filters with thick frames that serve no practical purpose but causing vignetting in wide angle lenses. Our PowerUV filter frame design is simple and effective, even with our relative thick Gorilla® Glass to provide extra protection, the overall thickness of our PowerUV filter is only 3.6mm, thinner than many UV filters in the market.

 

 

The PowerUV filters are built from aerospace grade aluminum with CNC machinery for utmost precision and accuracy. They are anodized for durability.

 

 

With up to 8 times stronger than normal UV filters, the Aurora PowerUV is the toughest UV filter in the world*. 

Your camera lens deserves the same level of protection as your eyes.

 

 

 

The Aurora PowerCPL filters are also based on the Gorilla® Glass 3 technology, with the same polishing technique we used in our successful PowerXND 2000 filters.

 

 

 

 

With proliferations of digital cameras and photo editing software, many special effect filters are obsolete except a few specialized filters such as circular polarizer (CPL) filters and neutral density (ND) filters. A CPL filter is an indispensable tool that photographers and videographers should have. 

By using CPL filters in photography and videography, certain effects can be obtained that would not be possible by using software in post processing. 

A CPL filter can filter out polarized light, making a sky bluer and vegetation color more saturated.

 

 

Another CPL application is to reduce reflection from non-metallic surface such as water surface or window.

As shown here, by using a CPL filter, the rocks underneath the water can be seen once the light reflection from the water surface is removed.

 

 

 

Here is another example, a CPL reduces the light reflection from the background, thus making the main subject, a dragonfly sitting on top of a lotus bud “pops”.

 

 

 

 

The PowerCPL filters are based on Gorilla® Glass 3 for the extra strength, and they are multi-layer coated with nano technology.

One of most important aspects of our PowerCPL filters is its super optical quality which translates into high resolution and realistic color reproduction . By using proprietary polishing technique and rigorous quality control process such as using collimator to test CPL glasses, our PowerCPL filters achieve excellent resolution and color reproduction accuracy as shown by the test results from an Imatest certified lab. 

 

 

In the Imatest SFR resolution test, the reference resolution in this test setup is 2939 line width per (test target picture) height, the Aurora PowerCPL resolution is 2880 LW/PH, or 98% of the referenced resolution, slightly behind a premium priced CPL filter.

Here is a visual comparison of PowerCPL filter and a low price CPL filter (Green.L) , shot with a Nikon Nikkor AF-S 300mm f/4E PF ED VR on a Nikon D810 camera viewed at 100%. In the Imatest SFR test results, the Green.L resolution is only 80%of the referenced resolution and there is clearly visible blurring in the comparison image below.

 

 

 

 

The Aurora PowerCPL frame features an user friendly anti-lockup design to prevent “stuck filter” phenomenon common in thin profile CPL filters. Many slim profile CPL filters have a very thin fixed ring so the filter may be stuck on a lens and become very hard to be removed.

 

 

We increase the fixed ring thickness so putting the CPL filter on and off a lens is easier and less likely to get stuck. In the meantime, the overall filter profile remains the same so vignetting is kept to minimum.

 

 

The PowerCPL filters are built from aerospace grade aluminum with CNC machinery for utmost precision and accuracy. They are anodized for durability.

Wide temperature range lubricant is applied to the filter so it will have smooth and dampened rotation throughout the temperature range.

 

 

PowerUV 

  • Filter frame thickness: 3.6mm 
  • Glass material: Corning® Gorilla® Glass 3 
  • Transmittance Rate: 99.6% 
  • Available filter thread size: 37mm, 39mm, 40.5mm, 43mm, 46mm, 48mm, 49mm, 52mm, 55mm, 58mm, 60mm, 62mm, 67mm, 72mm, 77mm, 82mm, 86mm, 95mm (x1.0), and 105mm (x 1.0)

PowerCPL 

  • Filter frame thickness: 5.3mm 
  • Glass material: Corning® Gorilla® Glass 3 
  • Filter Factor: 2 (1 stop) 
  • Available filter thread size: 37mm, 39mm, 40.5mm, 43mm, 46mm, 48mm, 49mm, 52mm, 55mm, 58mm, 60mm, 62mm, 67mm, 72mm, 77mm, 82mm, 86mm, 95mm (x1.0), and 105mm (x 1.0)

*As July 5th, 2016

 

 

 

With the best impact and scratch resistant capabilities, we could have priced the PowerUV and PowerCPL filters at a premium. However, we would like to have as many photographers as possible to try out the toughest UV protectors and the high resolution CPL filters. Thus we choose to price our PowerUV and PowerCPL filters very competitively, at the level of filters without such capabilities. 

 

And we go one step further to make the PowerUV and PowerCPL filters available to Indiegogo contributors with 35% off the already competitive MSRP.

 

We provide perks of 18 sizes of PowerUV protection filter  and 18 sizes of PowerCPL filter. If you simply want to pledge one filter, either PowerUV or PowerCPL, just select the one you like.

 

 

 

For contributors who would like to have more than one filter, such as multiple UV filters or combination of UV and CPL filters, you can choose one perks at a time per transaction, i.e. you select another perk after order a perk already. 

If you are going to order several perks, say three or more filters, and do not want to place order one by one, please send us a message so we can create a custom perk specifically for you. The perk will be only visible to you.

 

Feel free to send us a message if you have any question: info@aurora-aperture.com

 

You can change your pledge such as different type or size of filters  before the project’s funding deadline. Please follow this How to Upgrade Your Perk article for instructions.

 

Worldwide Shipping is free.

 

 

 

Some of you missed our PowerXND 2000 project and express desire to order the filters with a special discount here. 

So we are going to make a special offer of the PowerXND 2000 filters to the supporters of this project at 10% discount. You can order the PowerXND 2000 filters in this Indiegogo InDemand page: PowerXND 2000 InDemand Order Page. Most sizes are ready to be shipped.

The sales special runs through this campaign for the month of August. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Both PowerUV and PowerCPL filters have been prototyped and tested. We are ready to start production once the funding is secured. We plan on shipping products in October or earlier.

Here is a video clip of our supplier factory tour made in May 2016.

 

 

Featured In
story_txt:
Ultra Violet (UV) filters have been around for long time from the old film days. Their original purpose is to block UV light that would cause hazing in old film photos. Even modern films before digital photography are immune from UV light, digital cameras are not sensitive with UV light either.In the meantime, users believe having a relative inexpensive filter in front of their expensive lens could provide some levels of protection, thus UV filters today are still widely used as a protection filter and they are the first accessory to buy with a purchase of a new lens.However, most UV filters and protection filters in the market are made from a piece of thin glass. They offer little physical protection since the filter glass is easy to be broken, as discovered by users who have dropped their filters by accident.
        The PowerUV protection filters from Aurora Aperture are real UV filters that can truly protect. They are made from chemically harden glass that offers much stronger protection than normal glass.  
      We choose the Corning® Gorilla® Glass 3 for the PowerUV protection filter, as it is the most widely used cover glass today in smartphones and tablets. Chemically harden glass is a proven and matured technology, adopting it to camera lens filter is only a matter of time.    To demonstrate the impact resistant capability of the Gorilla® Glass 3 based PowerUV filters, we conduct a drop-ball test. The drop-ball test is based on the ANSI Z87.1-2003 standard which is used in the FDA 21 CFR 801.410 regulation. The original purpose of this test is for eyeglass certification and has been used over forty years. All eyeglasses and sunglasses sold in the US must pass this drop ball test.In this impact test, a 5/8-inch steel ball weighting approximately 0.56 ounce (about 16 grams) is dropped from a height of 50 inches (about 1.27 meters) upon the surface of test target, and the test target must not be fractured.    First, we gather a few traditional UV filters and put them through the drop-ball test.   As seen from above, all these UV filters failed the drop ball test, including a few premium brand filters such as Kenko Pro1D UV and B+W XS-Pro UV. Some UV filters did not even pass the test with a smaller steel ball of 7g, or less than half of the standard weight at 16g.   There is no surprise for this, since these filters are not built as real protection filters from the first place. We just want to use the test to break the illusion of traditional UV filters can provide protection to camera lenses. Now we put our PowerUV filter through the same drop-ball test. Not only it passed the standard test with flying color, we tried to break it by increasing the weight of the steel ball to 2 ounces (56 grams) , our Gorilla® Glass 3 based filters still pass the test. That is up to 3.5 times of standard test weight and 8 times of certain ultra thin UV filter failed limit.  As a comparison, we also tested a Sigma Ceramic Protector filter which is made from clear glass ceramic and is supposed to be stronger than normal glass . Although the Sigma protection filter did pass the standard test at 16 grams, it failed at the weight of 56 gram.   Next is a scratch test. We put the PowerUV filter with a bunch of hard objects such as small rocks, keys, and pocket knife into a container on a vibration platform. We let it run through 30 minutes of vibration time and the filter will be examined for surface scratch.Again, the PowerUV filters survive the scratch simulation test with flying colors.   Traditional UV Filter manufactures market their premium filters by emphasizing the use of high quality optic glasses such as Schott B270®. Does the chemically harder glass materials such as Gorilla® Glass compromise optical performance when comparing B270®?For UV filters, the most important optical performance metric is the transmittance rate for the visible spectrum (390nm to 700nm). Untreated optic glass such as Schott B270® is rated at 91.7%. After anti-reflection coating is applied the transmittance rate can be increased to 98% - 99%. Raw Gorilla® Glass 3 is rated at 92.3%. After applying multi layers of nano coatings our Gorilla® Glass 3 based PowerUV filters can achieve 99.6%, just as good as those traditional premium optic glass based UV filters.  
 We also conducted thorough testings in resolution and color reproduction and we find the Gorilla® Glass 3 based PowerUV filters are just as good as high quality UV filters built with Schott B270® glass.Another optical aspect of UV filters is its anti ghost capability. Ghosting is caused by light reflections between an UV filter and a lens. We conducted ghost tests with the PowerUV filters and found no particular issue with the Gorilla® Glass 3 material. The multi layer nano coatings not only help increasing the transmittance rate, but also repels water, oil, and dust. Contaminants can be wiped off from the filters easily.     
  UV filters frame design is very simple as there is just a metal frame housing a single piece of glass and yet we have seen many UV filters with thick frames that serve no practical purpose but causing vignetting in wide angle lenses. Our PowerUV filter frame design is simple and effective, even with our relative thick Gorilla® Glass to provide extra protection, the overall thickness of our PowerUV filter is only 3.6mm, thinner than many UV filters in the market.   The PowerUV filters are built from aerospace grade aluminum with CNC machinery for utmost precision and accuracy. They are anodized for durability.   With up to 8 times stronger than normal UV filters, the Aurora PowerUV is the toughest UV filter in the world*. Your camera lens deserves the same level of protection as your eyes.   
 The Aurora PowerCPL filters are also based on the Gorilla® Glass 3 technology, with the same polishing technique we used in our successful PowerXND 2000 filters. 
   
 With proliferations of digital cameras and photo editing software, many special effect filters are obsolete except a few specialized filters such as circular polarizer (CPL) filters and neutral density (ND) filters. A CPL filter is an indispensable tool that photographers and videographers should have. By using CPL filters in photography and videography, certain effects can be obtained that would not be possible by using software in post processing. A CPL filter can filter out polarized light, making a sky bluer and vegetation color more saturated.  Another CPL application is to reduce reflection from non-metallic surface such as water surface or window.As shown here, by using a CPL filter, the rocks underneath the water can be seen once the light reflection from the water surface is removed.    Here is another example, a CPL reduces the light reflection from the background, thus making the main subject, a dragonfly sitting on top of a lotus bud “pops”.    The PowerCPL filters are based on Gorilla® Glass 3 for the extra strength, and they are multi-layer coated with nano technology.One of most important aspects of our PowerCPL filters is its super optical quality which translates into high resolution and realistic color reproduction . By using proprietary polishing technique and rigorous quality control process such as using collimator to test CPL glasses, our PowerCPL filters achieve excellent resolution and color reproduction accuracy as shown by the test results from an Imatest certified lab.    In the Imatest SFR resolution test, the reference resolution in this test setup is 2939 line width per (test target picture) height, the Aurora PowerCPL resolution is 2880 LW/PH, or 98% of the referenced resolution, slightly behind a premium priced CPL filter.Here is a visual comparison of PowerCPL filter and a low price CPL filter (Green.L) , shot with a Nikon Nikkor AF-S 300mm f/4E PF ED VR on a Nikon D810 camera viewed at 100%. In the Imatest SFR test results, the Green.L resolution is only 80%of the referenced resolution and there is clearly visible blurring in the comparison image below.      
  The Aurora PowerCPL frame features an user friendly anti-lockup design to prevent “stuck filter” phenomenon common in thin profile CPL filters. Many slim profile CPL filters have a very thin fixed ring so the filter may be stuck on a lens and become very hard to be removed.   We increase the fixed ring thickness so putting the CPL filter on and off a lens is easier and less likely to get stuck. In the meantime, the overall filter profile remains the same so vignetting is kept to minimum.  The PowerCPL filters are built from aerospace grade aluminum with CNC machinery for utmost precision and accuracy. They are anodized for durability.Wide temperature range lubricant is applied to the filter so it will have smooth and dampened rotation throughout the temperature range.  
  PowerUV 
Filter frame thickness: 3.6mm 
Glass material: Corning® Gorilla® Glass 3 
Transmittance Rate: 99.6% 
Available filter thread size: 37mm, 39mm, 40.5mm, 43mm, 46mm, 48mm, 49mm, 52mm, 55mm, 58mm, 60mm, 62mm, 67mm, 72mm, 77mm, 82mm, 86mm, 95mm (x1.0), and 105mm (x 1.0)
PowerCPL 
Filter frame thickness: 5.3mm 
Glass material: Corning® Gorilla® Glass 3 
Filter Factor: 2 (1 stop) 
Available filter thread size: 37mm, 39mm, 40.5mm, 43mm, 46mm, 48mm, 49mm, 52mm, 55mm, 58mm, 60mm, 62mm, 67mm, 72mm, 77mm, 82mm, 86mm, 95mm (x1.0), and 105mm (x 1.0)
*As July 5th, 2016    With the best impact and scratch resistant capabilities, we could have priced the PowerUV and PowerCPL filters at a premium. However, we would like to have as many photographers as possible to try out the toughest UV protectors and the high resolution CPL filters. Thus we choose to price our PowerUV and PowerCPL filters very competitively, at the level of filters without such capabilities.  And we go one step further to make the PowerUV and PowerCPL filters available to Indiegogo contributors with 35% off the already competitive MSRP. We provide perks of 18 sizes of PowerUV protection filter  and 18 sizes of PowerCPL filter. If you simply want to pledge one filter, either PowerUV or PowerCPL, just select the one you like.   For contributors who would like to have more than one filter, such as multiple UV filters or combination of UV and CPL filters, you can choose one perks at a time per transaction, i.e. you select another perk after order a perk already. If you are going to order several perks, say three or more filters, and do not want to place order one by one, please send us a message so we can create a custom perk specifically for you. The perk will be only visible to you. Feel free to send us a message if you have any question: info@aurora-aperture.com You can change your pledge such as different type or size of filters  before the project’s funding deadline. Please follow this How to Upgrade Your Perk article for instructions. Worldwide Shipping is free.   Some of you missed our PowerXND 2000 project and express desire to order the filters with a special discount here. So we are going to make a special offer of the PowerXND 2000 filters to the supporters of this project at 10% discount. You can order the PowerXND 2000 filters in this Indiegogo InDemand page: PowerXND 2000 InDemand Order Page. Most sizes are ready to be shipped.The sales special runs through this campaign for the month of August.          Both PowerUV and PowerCPL filters have been prototyped and tested. story:
Production Update

Mass production:

We’ve finished the production of all the Moka360 cameras and bundles.

To the backer who ordered Moka360 camera perk and Accessory Pack A, your orders will be combined and shipped as Adventure Bundle.

To the backers who ordered Ultimate Bundles, your orders will be separated to Adventure Bundle and Accessory Pack B.

The Accessory Pack B will be shipped separately, so please do not panic if you received only part of your order, it may not be delivered with the camera or bundle. The shipping has started, and we will finish the shipping of all current orders before mid September.

Packaging:

APP:

The Moka360 APP iOS version has been approved by Apple APP Store. You can search “Moka360”to download it. The Android version is ready too, and it  will be uploaded soon.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Frequently Asked Questions

General
Technical 
Payments and Shipping
 
 

General

 

Are you offering a warranty on Moka360?

Yes, we are offering a 1-year warranty. Warranty is only for exchange of a defective unit. No returns for refund.

 

Are you hiring?

Yes, we have several positions available. Check them out and apply here.

 

The price is very low for a 360 camera compared with other brand such as Nikon or Samsung. Why is that?

Our dream is to make the innovation cameras accessible to everyone. We have worked long and hard to create cameras that are not only affordable, but also made of quality components. To help us bring Moka360 to reality, you can get an exclusive 50% discount off MSRP.

 

Have you fulfilled the Mokacam4K orders?

We’ve fulfilled over 99% of the confirmed (survey answered) Mokacam4K orders. The rest are mostly new orders or returned orders due to unsuccessful delivery or custom reason.

 

Technical

Will there be an Android App?

Yes, there is an Android and iOS APP. The APPs are ready for operation and will be released before the shipping.

 

How do you know how much power is left in the batteries?

You can see the battery status on the screen, or in the App.

 

How do you know how much memory is remaining? 

You can see the remaining storage status on the screen, or in the App.

 

Does Moka360 come with a memory card?

No, we are not including a memory card with your order.

 

Will a charging cable come with Moka360?

Yes, each package will include a Micro USB for charging.

 

What are the ratings for the waterproof case?

135 feet/40 meters with waterproof case, could work with or without the back battery.

 

How many hours will Moka360 last if only used for taking pictures?

There are many factors and conditions to calculate this, but generally the battery life should last you for more than 1 day.

 

Can Moka360 connect to a microphone through a 3.5mm mic adapter?

Moka360 does not have a 3.5mm port because we are trying to keep the camera as small as possible.

 

Can Moka360 handle extreme temperatures?

Yes, Moka360 has been tested to work at -20C degrees.

 

Is Moka360 compatible with a standard tripod?

Yes, the base of Moka360 includes a standard 1/4 inch screw slot.

 

How long will it take to completely charge the internal camera battery?

This depends on the type of charger you are using, but generally it will take 2 hours.

 

What is the Battery Life (estimated time) of Moka360?

Video recording is estimated at 1h 30m.

 

What is the WIFI range?

WIFI range is about 10m - 20m.

 

Is the focus automatic? Or is that done also through the screen?

Focus is automatic.

 

Moka360 can charge on 100-220 volts right?

The Moka360 should not be charged on 100-220 volt, it should be charged by a Micro-USB cable, which means it depends on the USB adapter in your region.

 

Is it possible to use a Bluetooth remote?

Moka360 provides remote control via 2.4G, which is more stable than Bluetooth.

 

Can Mokacam be controlled by Mokacam4K's remote controller?

Moka360 can only be controlled with the wireless Moka360 remote control

 

Payments and Shipping

How confident are you that you can deliver on time?

This is the 2nd campaign of Team Mokacam; we have built closer relationships with our manufacturing partners and the fulfillment vendors. The prototype of Moka360 was ready months ago and extensive testing has already been performed. The molds for Moka360 are much simpler compared with Mokacam4K, which was designed to be SplashProof, and the molds are super complicated and caused the delay. We are confident in our ability to meet the timeline. Although unforeseen obstacles can arise during any manufacturing process, we intend to run everything efficiently, transparently.

 

How much is shipping?

We ship worldwide and the cost is $20.

 

Can I pick the camera up in Mokacam office and avoid the shipping charge?

Sorry, we'd love to meet you, but the cameras are shipped from our manufacturing partners by air. We have to pay shipping on every camera. 

 

When does it ship?

The estimated shipping date is March 2017.

 

Who is responsible for any additional taxes, duties or VAT?

The backer is responsible; please check your country's import duties before purchasing. It should be 0% in the US and varies internationally. You can check this comprehensive list to get started.

 

Can I get a refund?

Please refer to IndieGoGo's policy here.

 

Risks and challenges

While we're doing a lot of the work ourselves, obviously we have to rely on others (manufacture, shipping) to provide their end. We're confident that these parts will be no problem, as we're talking to established companies here. We will also go to China ourselves to oversee production, and Shuo has worked with the factory we wish to use before, so communication between us and the factory will not be an issue. But talking to other people who have run Indiegogo, there is always something that comes up, be it customs, shipping, the manufacturing not being up to scratch or any other of the many things that can delay the process. We will do our best, and hope to deliver on time, and whatever happens we will keep you updated every step along the way.

We will definitely deliver a great product, and hope to do so on time!

Thanks from the whole team :)

 

Legal Disclaimer

"Delivery of rewards/perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed."

story:
Trifecto Infinity – With the World’s Smallest Tripod; an All-in-One Pen, Stylus, and Phone Tripod!  Trifecto Infinity is also available in an alternate configuration featuring the Flashlight Tripod, or with a magnetic swivel assembly that attaches to your cell phone or iPad.                   

“Thanks for stopping by! We hope you'll pledge on our Trifecto Infinity and follow the progress of our latest Kickstarter project.  This is the perfect gift that you can get right in time for Christmas!” - Peter Gantner and Len Kensey, entrepreneurs who have followed and pledged on more than 150 projects.

Designed For Everyone!

Thank you for checking out the Trifecto Infinity project. The all-in-one pen, stylus, and tripod are the first of its kind and today we are excited to launch our project for the world to see. Trifecto Infinity is a simple and obvious solution inspired by the way we work, play, and use technology.

The Perfect Stocking Stuffer - Get it in time for Christmas!

That's right - we will have the Trifecto Infinity in your hands before Christmas.  We are well along the way in the process - having already completed the prototype, and have everything ready for mass manufacturing!

Want it specialized for your special someone?  Spend an extra $5 to have a name printed on the pen or flashlight!  Want to place a company logo on it?  Only $10 extra, with the png file you send us!  Want to buy a large amount of decal pens?  Choose the 20 pens option, and we'll give you 50% off of cost to have something printed (must be the same script on all) on your pens!

We Love Quality Built Gadgets

The Trifecto Infinity tripod is designed for stability on most surfaces to securely hold smartphones. Whether the pen or flashlight, the Trifecto Infinity is easy to carry wherever you go—in your pocket or in your purse.

The Trifecto Infinity is manufactured from quality materials with the tripod stand being made from high-quality aluminum. Our patent-pending pen's integrated tripod design allows you to seamlessly use the tripod with almost any smartphone, the stylus with any touch screen and the pen wherever you like!

Real Life Uses of the Trifecto Infinity!

Now, more than ever, most people have smartphones. How many times have you found yourself looking for a place to set down your phone to take pictures or record a video? You prop it up against something hoping it will work while most of the time getting a poor picture or video. You look around thinking like “MacGyver” trying to find the best way to place or balance your phone so it hopefully works just right.

You'll never believe this.  We can't make it up!  Inventor of Trifecto Infinity, Len Kensey, and a friend were walking out of a restaurant - and stumbled upon these girls taking a photo of themselves...or at least trying to!  This was when Trifecto Infinity was in the beginning stages, and gave us confirmation that we were on to something!  True story!  We saw these girls in the city stacking their purses to get this shot...oh the things we do to get the photo we want!

Sadly, nothing (other than risking your purses being stolen) has worked... UNTIL we designed the Trifecto Infinity pen, stylus, tripod!

Everyone has a Smartphone - Now what?!
Cell phones are part of our everyday lives and EVERYONE has one. Creating LIVE videos on Social Media has been a struggle with figuring out how to prop up and balance the phone for the best angled recording. 

Now, with the Trifecto Infinity, you can hold your phone or SLR camera in a simple hands-free way. The tripod, stored inside the pen, conveniently holds your phone or tablet upright while in use!   

Trifecto Infinity is the helping hand when you need to hold your phone or tablet while chatting, video conferencing, reading, taking selfies, watching videos, and so much more.  

It includes the multi-purposed options of pen, stylus, and tripod - all in one!  Pledge today - and its in your hand by Christmas!

Choose The Pen, or the Flashlight with the World's Smallest Tripod!
Trifecto Infinity is more than just a pen! One configuration (while holding the tripod) is the pen/stylus option.  Available in a second configuration, (included with tripod), is the Trifecto Infinity  flashlight option. After struggling to see what he was working on in the dark, Peter with Len designed the Trifecto Infinity Flashlight Tripod, along with the Trifecto Infinity Phone Tripod.   And look how far the design has come!

Check Out The Early Designs
The Trifecto Infinity has come a long way from the initial prototypes and the new flexible leg design makes the Tripod amazing!

Working tirelessly on the perfect design for our gadget, the Trifecto Infinity tripod we've created provides the perfect hands-free solution for holding a phone or tablet.  The work we've done up to this point, allows us to get it to you by Christmas!  The perfect gift for family or friend!

Perfect For Phones or Tablets           

The Trifecto Infinity was developed with the desire to make cell phones more convenient to use. We have tested and designed the smallest possible tripod capable of holding almost any cell phone with cases. For bulky thicker cases the magnetic mount and round adhesive plate work perfect.

With the Trifecto Infinity pen, we're introducing the past and present to the future!  Now, going from paper to screen is easy. The tripod can be used completely separate from the pen allowing you to easily use the tripod to hold your phone while using the stylus pen on your phone or tablet.  This all-in-one pen is super cool and works extremely well!

We invite you to pledge on Trifecto infinity right now and enjoy hands-free access to your phone - receive it by Christmas 2017!

Here's where we are today - 11/2/17!

Check out these pictures below!  These are actual manufactured pens and flashlights that we are so very close to getting in to your hands (by Christmas!)

 
There's a video of the tripod legs moving.  (note - they still need to anodize the aluminum top!)

Check out that flashlight!  Sturdy and a nice beam!

And here's the magnetic adaptor - we love this addition!

 

Trifecto Infinity... it's more than just a pen!

We hope you'll pledge on our Trifecto Infinity and follow the progress of our latest Kickstarter project.  This is the perfect gift that you can get right in time for Christmas!” - Peter Gantner and Len Kensey, entrepreneurs who have followed and pledged on more than 150 projects.Designed For Everyone!Thank you for checking out the Trifecto Infinity project. story:
Featured in


                                  


We want to present you our new little Fun Gadget for smartphones.
This is a small helicopter in pen form which allows pictures or videos to be taken from a height of up to 10 metres in HD format from all possible perspectives.

Why we came up with the idea?

During a party, we wanted to take a few photos but not those that you would normally take .... some from different angles.
But we were too stupid to know how to do this. So we were climbing on furniture and walls and anything else we could find which could have been dangerous
and breaking things in the process.

We had been thinking about a simpler and safer way of doing this.
A look on the internet revealed that there are various options in the form of small helicopters or multicopters but these were very unwieldy.
Finally  we  came up with the idea of designing a small Pocketcopter in pen form which  can be taken with you as a small gadget in your pocket anywhere you go
 and easily connect to your Smartphone to take pictures and videos wherever you are.

Inspired by this video

This video is in german but it shows why we came up with this idea



For who is this gadget is useful?

Well, this question is easy to answer. For Everyone! Anyone who loves to take pictures or videos can take advantage of and enjoy the extra dimension offered by the Pocketcopter.
The Pocketcopter is very versatile. Whether for holidays, parties, business or just for fun.
And  if you want to use it other than in flight mode the rotors can be folded in and the device used as a hand held camera or attached to a helmet.

Taking Pictures or Videos and Sharing on Social Networks

The Pocketcopter gives you many options for taking pictures or videos and allows you to share to your favourite social network.


How does the Pocketcopter work?

The Pocketcopter itself is powered by a 12V battery (rechargeable or replaceable) and is controlled via the touch screen of your smartphone.


The connection is via WiFi (similar to the remote control of the GoPro) or Bluetooth.
Due to the fact that, although the rotor arms are fixed one above the other, each spins in the opposite direction to the other thus achieving stability
 and ensuring quiet recordings.

Should the Pocketcopter lose the connection to the smartphone it automatically floats slowly to the ground.

The software interfaces will allow the pictures or videos taken to be instantly shared directly on social networks like Facebook, Twitter or Instagram.


Specifications

  • Height about 19 cm
  • Diameter about 4.5 cm
  • 12V rechargeable
  • 3D HD camera
  • Range about 10 meters
  • Rotor blades removable
  • Previous tests showed that the running time of a fully charged battery is about 6 hours (camera) and 25 min flight time.
  • Storage Medium: Micro SD card

Blue, Yellow and Black




Cool Things You Can Do



Our team

  • Thomas, 37 years old, Mobile Application developer, creator and team leader.
  • Mike, 39 years old - micro-electrician, humourist and entertainer
  • Ricardo, he refuses to tell his age but we know that he is 33 years old - designer, photographer and traveller.

Why do we need your help!

We are at a standstill and cannot continue without financial support. Because we are just in normal employment and have families to support we have no further means of funding this project and therefore ask for your support.
The money is needed for hardware as well as for the creation of the case.

Where will the funds go?
  • Engineering
  • Hardware
  • Manufacturing
  • Shipping

Prototypes: Currently we don’t have a fully working prototype, the photos in campaign are computer renderings of what we envision the device to look like.

How else can I help? Use the links above to share our campaign with your friends and followers.

When is it possble to complete the Pocketcopter?

With your help, we can bring out the first working prototype by the beginning of next year.
The official completion should be, May 2015.

FAQ

Does the Pocketcopter work with all smartphones?
At the moment we are working on the Android version. But the aim is that the Pocketcopter will work on all phones (iOS, Android and Windows).

What will the finished Pocketcopter cost?
According to our research and anticipated development costs the Pocketcopter is expected to cost € 99.

Can i use the Pocketcopter in any weather?
We don't expect the Pocketcopter to maintain its position in stormy weather. However, we will make the Pocketcopter water resistant.

Can the battery be replaced?
Update: We have to use a stronger battery and this will not be replaceable.

story: We would really appreciate help in getting this for Julia's Christmas present. We all know how much Julia loves photography it's a shame her camera walked away. :)

story:
The perfect camera accessory to capture unique angles, giving your film that cinematic look!

 

  

  

  

  

      

 

Introducing Wiral® LITE - the first affordable, easy-to-use cable cam system for filming with smartphone, action cameras and mirrorless cameras up to 3.3lb (1.5kg). 

        

           

  

        

  

    

   

  

 

Wiral® LITE comes with an intuitive attachment system, making it easy for anyone to set it up in less than 3 minutes.

 

   

  

 

     

   

 

The possibilities with Wiral® LITE are only limited by your creativity. Look at our showreel to get inspired.  

 

  

 

   

 

     

 

 

We love drones! However, they have some limitations. With Wiral® LITE you can get close-up film in challenging and narrow places such as the woods, indoor and in crowded places where drones are difficult or even illegal to use.          

 

 

 

 

   

  

Feedback from athletes, filmmakers and explorers helped us bring this product from great to awesome.

  

  

     

 

 

    

 

   

 

  

   

 

Bring Wiral® LITE to your favorite location.

      

Our patent pending Quick Reel™ makes Wiral® LITE as easy to set up as it is to take down.

      

 Get those perfect dynamic shots anywhere with no distracting sounds.

 

Capture stunning motion time lapses with Wiral® LITE.

   

  

     

   

    

 

 

 

 

 

  

  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

    

  

 

  

 

   

 

 

   

  

 

     

 

 

 

 

 

 

                              

This project is promoted by Jellop, a direct­ response online advertising agency specializing in Kickstarter campaigns on Facebook Ads and Google AdWords.

story:
I need your help.

My name is Max (I also go by @protocollie) and I do a lot of AV work at a lot of conventions. This particular campaign is regarding FA:U, but I also volunteer a lot of my time for FM, AC and run the NYFB. I've been involved in the community for well over a decade now and have made it a policy to never ask for anything of the group as a whole, but right now I feel the need to reach out and ask for everyone's help.

Our event hotel is screwing us.

I hate to put it in such blunt terms, but that's what happened. If you were at FA:U, you might have seen this happen - during Fox Amoore, Matt Ebel and Pepper's concert, I was holding Freezeframe's donated camera (a sony NEX-FS700U), shooting footage of the event. As I walked backwards (carefully, I might add) I stepped onto a piece of the stage that hadn't been properly secured by the hotel's staff - it rolled out from under my foot, slamming my leg into the side of the stage and knocking me off the stage and onto my back. I was generally okay - my leg was pretty banged up, and it hurt to walk, but I was able to walk it off. The camera was not so lucky.
On the spot, the hotel actually admitted fault in the incident. They said that the stairs should have been fastened and that they weren't - this was entirely a situation of their making. They referred us to their insurance company, who then spent nearly a month running us in circles before denying our claim outright. Our adjuster is a really, really nasty woman who said directly on day one of the claim that she was likely going to deny it, on no basis whatsoever. When the insurance company contacted the hotel, who'd previously said they'd deal with it through insurance, they said they had no knowledge of the incident and we are likely liable. This means that right now the camera's repairs are still not paid for over a month out from the event.
We tried claiming against our event insurance; they don't cover this sort of loss (apparently, most event policies don't.) So we're out of options.

This could get very messy.

Right now, I'm investigating legal action that I can take against the hotel. I don't know what our chances really are - this will require legal counsel, which could cost more. I do not have specifics, but understand that FA:U runs on thin-to-no margins, and we don't really have the money to float a near $2500 repair bill for a donated camera, as much as we'd like to. This is why I'm reaching out to you.

Freezeframe is seriously, like, the nicest guy.

The camera was donated by Freezeframe, who is one of the most devoted and dedicated videographers and con staff I've ever encountered. If you've ever seen beautiful steadicam footage from a major con or event, there's a good chance Freezeframe was the operator. He brings absurdly nice cameras to events, for free, so that we can capture them for later and to make them overall better. He shows up, works incredibly hard, is always smiling and is a source of good energy on any crew that he's a part of - even now, he's been incredibly kind, patient and understanding with what is a considerable mess for him. He gives a huge amount to the fandom; I'm just asking that we all help him out.

I'm doing this on my own.

Freezeframe hasn't asked me to do this. I haven't cleared this with Dragoneer, FA:U or FA. I'm doing this because I really think Freezeframe deserves to have this weight off his shoulders. Con staff dedicate a lot to events and ask very little; many take vacation days to work really hard to put on events for you. If you've ever been to or enjoyed a convention, consider chipping in even a dollar. When we put on these events, we take on a considerable amount of personal liability and risk. There are no for-profit conventions in this community - they're all non-profit/not-for-profit and tend to run on thin margins year over year, floated on the credit cards and bank accounts of the people that run them for your enjoyment. Rarely, bad things do happen to us, and often there's little or no safety net. This is one of those times.

If the hotel does pay out...

In the end, we know the hotel is liable. This isn't a question in our minds. If we can prove this, and do get paid out, I'd like to ask your understanding in that I don't have the time or bandwidth to personally divvy up the funds we receive and return them. Should the hotel pay out, I'll donate any money in excess of what we need to cover the camera repairs to FA:U's favorite charity, the NJSPCA.

How will I contribute?

Right now, the money is going straight into my Paypal account, which means I can't actually directly contribute through the site. Indiegogo takes a fee of about 4% for collected donations, or around $100 for the whole kit and caboodle. I'm going to cover this fee to make sure Freezeframe gets the full amount.

Thank you in advance.

It's really humbling to have to come and just ask for money. If I had infinite funds, I'd pay for this out of pocket, but I can't. Under normal circumstances this is something that I would never do. I also incurred a huge loss (my laptop was stolen, that was around $2,000 of my own money) at the same event and I would never ask for people to chip in for something like that. I really, truly believe that Freezeframe deserves your support, and I thank you in advance for helping me set things right for him.

How will I contribute?
Right now, the money is going straight into my Paypal account, which means I can't actually directly contribute through the site. Indiegogo takes a fee of about 4% for collected donations, or around $100 for the whole kit and caboodle. I'm going to cover this fee to make sure Freezeframe gets the full amount.
Thank you in advance.
It's really humbling to have to come and just ask for money. If I had infinite funds, I'd pay for this out of pocket, but I can't. Under normal circumstances this is something that I would never do. I also incurred a huge loss (my laptop was stolen, that was around $2,000 of my own money) at the same event and I would never ask for people to chip in for something like that. I really, truly believe that Freezeframe deserves your support, and I thank you in advance for helping me set things right for him.

story:
My camera equipment was stolen out of my car on Dec 3, 2014... and thanks to the love and support from those around me, I was able to replace the gear! 


Insurance paid for everything because I found a crazy loophole in my mother's insurance plan. This means your donations are no longer needed! 

Indiegogo will not grant me access to your donations until Feb 1. They also take 10%. Which means I can only offer 90% refunds and for this I apologize. 

EVERYONE'S PHOTOSHOOTS ARE STILL COMPLETELY VALID. 

Email me to plan your shoot! 

Chloetry@gmail.com

story:
QooCam is the world’s first 4K camera that combines the most innovative features of both 360° & 3D stereo filming technology. Thanks to its unique 3 lenses, IMU stabilizer, and cutting-edge depthmap tech, QooCam features shake free, after-shooting refocus, 120 FPS, and time-lapse capabilities. 

Doesn’t matter if you are a professional or just getting started, you can freely direct and edit all your moments like a pro with QooCam’s Master Editor app.

 

 

QooCam is designed for recording 4K videos and photos with a full 360° range. Thanks to its 4K with full sensor readout, you can record the memorable moments in great details and create high quality 360 videos on the go.

PS: 360º 4K means the entire 360º video or photo is in 4K resolution. However, since you can only view the 360º video or photo in the different field of view and not the whole image, the content quality you’re watching on the traditional sized screen is going to be less than 4K.

 

Relive your moments as if you were there again with its amazing 3D 4K videos with a 180° wide angle. Capture and relive your moments like how you really experienced them the first time.

 

 

Using the latest and most revolutionary depth-based technology, QooCam allows you to refocus photos after shooting them. When shooting in the 3D 180º mode, QooCam can estimate the distance of the subjects in the frame and generate a depth map for special effects post-filming. 

Now, you can edit your photo and choose which the main subject of the content after shooting.

 

 

Tap on wherever you want to focus in. You will be able to create a bokeh effect, to enhance the subject in focus while giving the picture a fine background at the same time.

 

Stop compromising when creating high-speed action shots, with the built-in IMU sensor plus the real-time stabilization software technology, and in-house algorithm, you can achieve shake-free shots and smooth videos even without a physical stabilizer.

 

Qoocam’s stitching free feature automatically combines the images of both the lenses into one 360° spherical image. Thanks to its real-time optical flow stitching algorithm, you can directly get the perfect stitching on your 360° photo or video with just your smartphone.

 

You can capture the 360° VR or 180° 3D video at 4K/60fps and 2K/120fps. You can easily create the highly used slow motion effect. There are endless possibilities for you to create with.

 

 

With the time-lapse function, you can create time-lapse photography easily. You can set up the shooting frequency and QooCam will shoot the 360º or 3D photo automatically. Get the phenomenal time-lapse footage with ease.

 

Enjoy a full 4k experience with QooCams’s three wide-angle lenses with a 216° field of view (FOV) and a f/2.2 aperture. Also with Sony’s CMOS sensor, the camera definition and battery life are improved, making it better than ever.  

 

Built with a full aviation-grade anodized aluminum alloy body and CNC machined, Qoocam only weighs 170g; making it durable and good for cooling. It’s lightweight and durable body is perfect to carry around anywhere you go.

 

Built to last longer, Qoocam’s battery supports 2600mAh, offering up to 180 minutes of continuous recording with a single charge.

You can use the external Micro SD card to expand the camera's storage up to 256GB. You’ll have more freedom to shoot and record without the fear of storage shortage.

 

With the Master Editor app, you can easily reframe and create 2D edits to your panoramic content with a simple tap and drag between the different points of views. Set the keyframes in your 360° videos and the app will automatically pan or zoom the 360° video to let you direct like a pro.

 

 

With the smart track feature, you can keep track of your focus point’s every movement in a 4K 360° video. Just select the object or subject that you want to follow and the camera will do the rest to keep the object the center of the frame. 

PS: This function will finish its final testings after August.

 

 

You can transform your photo or video into something out of this world. With one click, you can change the 360º images into cool tiny planet photos. You can even start a new trend craze on social media with these tiny planet selfies.

 

  • With its Easy Share function, share amazing videos with your friends on your favorite social media platform.
  • Live stream 360° videos to show your friends your whole surrounding while you talk to them. QooCam supports USB and WiFi live streaming.

        PS: This function will finish its final testing after August.

 

QooCam is compatible with Android 7.0 and IOS smartphone. You can monitor and edit your videos with its Editing app in real-time via Wifi.

QooCam can simply be mounted on anywhere with any sports camera accessories. You can mount QooCam on a drone, bike, or selfie-stick to create different effects and record from all different perspective.

QooCam has won 4 of the biggest design and innovation awards in the world. We’ve worked very hard to create the QooCam. The awards serve as recognition for QooCam’s highly respectable design and Kandao's consistency in high-quality designs.
 

 


 

 

 

 

 


 



 

You can download more video or photo footage at these links:
https://1drv.ms/f/s!Ai4CYQJ0ryg7gZl_i4_EhSgDwXjVKg ,
https://bit.ly/2Kl8s8w
 

 

 
We’ve revealed and introduced the QooCam and Obsidian at the CES, SXSW, NAB and IBC show. We have received much positive feedback and rave from people from all over the world during our tech convention reveals because of its unique design and innovative technology.
 

 

It took us more than a year to design and test the prototypes and samples. We’ve currently just finished the hardware testings and designs. We will continue to work towards finishing the software to improve its performance.
 

 
We are Kandao, a geek team specializing in the virtual reality technology. We believe the VR tech will totally change the recording life’s way of everyone. We want and push VR to become the part of our life.
We founded in 2016 and dedicated to providing high-end professional imagery software solution and hardware manufacturer for VR/AR content creation. We had built 3 professional grade VR cameras which were highly recommended in the industry, the Obsidian R named as one of the best VR cameras.
We want to this time, the consumer grade camera can bring you a better VR recording experience.

story:
It's simple. We engineered an action camera that puts pro-grade results within everyone's reach. Here's a confession--we don't plan to fight any great white sharks or skydive into a volcano any time soon. We're normal people...who are tired of having to choose between super expensive and poor quality when it comes to action cameras. And we think you are too.

This ain’t our first rodeo folks. We’ve been at this action camera thing for a couple years so we know what we’re up against. Some call it luck that we’ve been able to make an affordable camera with such high quality, but we’ll call it long hours, elbow grease and ingenuity.

So, just how does the Gen3 ViDi action camera stack up against the competition? Well, most cameras out there in our class cost 2 or 3 times as much. I mean, how else are they going to pay for their corporate heads, their global retreats, or their marketing? You know the answer: it's built into the cost of their products. We decided to take our money (what little we have) and put every last cent into the guts of the camera. Well...we DID save a little for the cool design too. 

We want to take the People's Action Camera to as many people as would like it--but going into major retail distribution is expensive. That's why the big brands can do it, but the small brands can't. So, here we are on Indiegogo--where all that goes out the window. We need your support to take the ViDi LCD camera to markets around the world. Since this is the first time the Gen3 ViDi is available to the public, we’re skipping the middle man and bringing it to you for way less than retail.

Underwater Sample Footage

Filming underwater is one of the main reasons that people buy action cameras. The ViDi LCD has a built in High Def CMOS Sensor with Low Light Resolution that increases underwater clarity especially when the sun is not shining.

The New ViDi LCD vs the GoPro Hero

Check out the side-by-side comparison video featuring the ViDi LCD and the GoPro Hero. We have a pretty amazing camera, but you don't have to take our word for it. You be the judge.

The ViDi LCD comes with so many extra features that the GoPro Hero doesn't come with. Here's a list:

  • Rear LCD Display Screen (This alone is freaking amazing! The only way to make sure you got the shot you wanted, is to watch the footage.)
  • 4GB Micro SD Card (Pre-installed)
  • Extension Pole (For all your selfie stick needs.)
  • Plugs into the Computer (To easily remove/edit your footage.)
  • Time Lapse Video
  • It Floats! (Seriously it does)
  • 1 Free Month of Shred Video (An easy drag & drop video editing software).
  • Did We Mention All This Was Under $100!

Still Photography Samples

Lots of People Are Talking About ViDi

Our new ViDi LCD camera comes ready to use immediately. Whether it's for a last-minute adventure or surprising someone on Christmas morning, your ViDi comes charged out-of-the-box, and ready to roll--accessorized with what you need to start shooting right away.

Every ViDi LCD Camera Kit Includes:

  • ViDi LCD Camera
  • ViDi Waterproof Case
  • 4GB Micro SD Card
  • Selfie Stick
  • Micro-USB Charger Cable
  • Charged Battery
  • Quickstart Guide
 
         

 Photo Credit: Carolina Sanchez-Monge

Spencer Taylor is a father of five and an entrepreneur dedicated to building real value. 

After struggling to find a quality action camera for himself and his kids to use that was also affordable, Spencer decided to see what it would take to develop a camera that brought as much quality as it did value. He's since amassed some of the best talent in product development, sourcing, and other fields to help make ViDi a reality. 

So, ViDi was born out of the search to create an action camera for the people. It was a long road, and many obstacles had to be overcome, but it's finally finished and ready for its debut... and it's happening right here on Indiegogo. 

The ViDi LCD is ready for the People.

Thanks again to all the supporters!


FAQs

What are the dimensions of the camera?

Camera: 2.65" W x 1.85 H x 1.2" D 
Camera with Case: 3.75" W x 2.58" H x 1.6" D

What is the weight?

Camera: 1.9 oz (54g) 
Camera with case: 4.7oz (133g)

Does it have image stabilization?

You betcha it does!

Does it have a removable battery?

We like to keep things simple so we built the battery in the camera itself. You can use a portable USB battery pack like the ones for your phone to charge it on the go.

What are the battery lifetime and specs?

Assuming the typical user will use the camera 3-4 times each weekend, the estimated battery life is 3-5 years. If being used more often, then the life will be reduced accordingly.The 1 year mentioned earlier was if the camera was being used every day for an entire year. The battery is a 700maH Lithium Ion (Li-ion) battery, the same type of battery Apple uses in their iPhones, just a smaller version.

How deep does can it go while remaining waterproof?

Our waterproof casing is good up to 40ft.

Does the camera fit a standard camera mount or does it require a special mount?

We build this camera with you in mind. Our camera, case, and accessories works with your standard camera mounts! No special mounts needed!

Can it fit any existing gopro camera mount?

GoPro mounts use their own proprietary system. We do have a connection that makes our camera compatible. We are looking into this more. Please stay tuned.

Where can I see sample videos?

Check out our website at vidicameras.com/video

How is this camera different than the older ViDi's mentioned online?

The ViDi mentioned on Amazon and other blogs are some of our older models. We've improved the camera, sensor, technology, and accessories and releasing the new model on KickStarter. It's even better than before at a killer price!

Is there an app to sync with your smartphone?

Unfortunately, we won't have an app that will sync with your smartphone. We have made the ViDi super simple. You can see and change all the settings from without taking it out of the waterproof housing!

Can it take photos as well as video? What additional features does it have?

The ViDi has both camera and video mode. It also has loop-recording, time-lapse, delay timer, and HDR modes.

What kind of time lapse settings can ViDi shoot in?

With our time-lapse, you have the option to record in 0.5s, 1s, 3s, 5sec, and 10 sec shots.

What kind of loop recording can ViDi shoot in?

It loops in 3 min, 5 min, and 10 minute options.

Does it come with a warrranty?

We stand behind our products! Our camera comes with a 1 year warranty. If there's a problem, feel free to contact us and we will take care of you!

story: Everyone knows I love taking pictures at all the shows I go to. I go to as many shows as I can for the music, but there are also great friends that come along with that music. Have been going to big venues for national acts since I was a sophomore in high school, but after my divorce a few years ago, I got real big into the local music.So many amazing musicians just around the corner and even more wonderful people with them. I started taking the good camera I bought to capture the precious moments of my kids growing up to the shows with me. Turned out to be good at capturing the bands I love and the new friends I make all the time and saving these moments forever. I also share these moments that I captured with everyone so we can all enjoy and remember what a great time that show was. Well...... on Friday the 13, the image sensor went out on the camera and I managed to tear up the lens gears trying to get it to work. Only got 2 pictures that night before the show even started. Went to 5 shows that weekend and everyone was asking where my camera was. I was lost without it and felt like I was not doing my part for the metal community that I am proud to be a part of. I had that one for 8 years, so there is no warranty left and repair costs are close to the cost of a newer model camera. I am going to stick with the same series of camera as it is the best pocket camera I can get into any show with and not need a press pass to use. There were several musicians that mentioned having a benefit show or starting a fundraiser so I can replace my camera and continue to capture amazing images of my friends and the wonderful bands some of them are in, as well as the national acts that come through. Of course I will continue to share all of these with every one of you. I try never to ask for money from people and you all know I would do absolutely anything I can for any of you if I am able. Since the divorce and foreclosures, I just have no extra money at all and I am just barely getting by and proving for my kids. There are 2 different cameras in this series that I am looking at. The 1st will come out in a couple of weeks and has a newer processor that will be better at the low light shots and it has a newer image sensor than my last one, so that problem will not happen again. The 2nd one is last years model, but the image sensor is 3 times the size of the 1st one. The processor in that one is also last years, so it is not as fast as the new one. But with it being 3 times bigger, it has it's own advantages. With that size comes a cost though. The 1st one is about $600 and the 2nd one is about $800. I have set my goal at $900 to cover fees on here and shipping and tax or anything else that comes up.

story:
a MUST for GoPro!

--------------------------------------------------------------

Introduction

中文   |   Español

SLOPES Black is a multi-function instant stand for GoPro camera in its housing. 18 handy angles and the plug & play quick deployment make it a Must-Have GoPro accessory. Moreover, features like 360 panorama shooting and LEGO attaching make your GoPro a more versatile camera.

Compatibility

SLOPES™ Black fits into different GoPro in their housings. It is compatible with:

  • GoPro Hero5  Black
  • GoPro Hero4  Silver/Black
  • GoPro Hero3+  Silver/Black
  • GoPro Hero3  White/Silver/Black (in housing of hero3+/4)
  • GoPro Hero / GoPro Hero+ / GoPro Hero+LCD

 

--------------------------------------------------------------

Features

 

18 handy shooting angles!

SLOPES™ Black has an unique cradle that allows Gopro to be installed in 4 different ways, (portrait or landscape, forwards or backwards) and a 5-facets polyhedron bottom that provides five positioning angles. The cradle plus the bottom endows GoPro with 18 handy angles for shooting. For a super wide angle camera as GoPro, these 18 angles are enough to fulfill almost all your needs in different circumstances.

It can dock your GoPro in four orientations, settle at any of five angles,

totals to 18 ways to point Your GoPro!

 

Speedy Deployment

The Plug n' play nature provides you the unrivaled deploying speed. All the positioning set-up could be settled in two seconds. No messing with the screws and positioning arms.

Plug and lay down in seconds. Farewell to screws now!

Slope degrees are marked at the top and easy to identify. Never been confusing you!

 

Ultra Slim

 Ultra-slim body makes SLOPES™ portable and enables using in narrow spaces. It can free-stand on any flat surface, like footstep, windowsill, and closet top, makes the whole world your tripod.

From ground to ceiling, achieve the ultimate possibility

You can place it on narrow beams and ledges easily

Use SLOPES Black to find interesting viewpoint you've never tried

 

Waterproof / Dustproof

Different from traditional tripod, SLOPES™ Black was made through one-step injection molding process, therefore it is natrually waterproof and dustproof. If it is soiled, just rinse with water to clean it up. Neither rain nor snow, nor dirt Can Stop You.

Filmed in heavy rain

Filmed towards flying sand

Filming skiers on snow ©Neil Lande

 

Joining with LEGO

There are some ribs at the bottom of the SLOPES™ Black. This design is not only strengthening the product, you can also having fun by joining SLOPES with LEGO bricks to extend its flexibilities, such as making a camera truck. Besides, these ribs will provide good grip on sand and snow.

 

The underneath ribs of SLOPES™ Black can clip with LEGO bricks

 

360° Panorama

SLOPES™ Black comes with a cubic NodeAnchor for 360° panorama shooting.

Insert GoPro horizontally and ensure its lens following the direction of  the arrow sign carved on SLOPES™ Black. Having the node cave trapping the NodeAnchor from four orthogonal directions and take one picture at each of the 4 positions. Then you can use Panorama Studio or PtGui or any other Panorama stitching software to connect the 4 shots to a 360° cylindrical panorama.

NodeAnchor keeps the location of GoPro's lens unchanged

Four panoramic images captured on SLOPES Black could be stitched to a seamless 360° panorama easily

 

--------------------------------------------------------------

Technical Specs

Material

The main body of SLOPES™ Black is made of ABS through one-step injection molding process. The NodeAnchor comes with it is made of alloy.

Weight

Main body: 23g

NodeAnchor: 1g

Dimensions

Main body: L*W*H=73X66X32mm

NodeAnchor: L*W*H=9X9X9mm; 1/4" screw hole

 

--------------------------------------------------------------

About the Perks

SLOPES™ Red edition and Pano5+1™ are also included in our perks.

SLOPES™ Red edition is an instant stand for naked GoPro.
Click HERE for more info about SLOPES™ Red.

 Pano5+1™ is a photography head for GoPro to shoot 360° panoramic photos.
Click HERE for more info about  Pano5+1™.

 

--------------------------------------------------------------

Timeline

 

--------------------------------------------------------------

Who is talking about SLOPES Black

 

 

 

--------------------------------------------------------------

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

We are constantly adding more SLOPES™ Black edition FAQs here, please check for the latest information / questions on SLOPES™ Black edition.

Does SLOPES™ Black work on GoPro Hero5?

Yes. It works perfectly on GoPro Hero5. See below.

When will I receive my order?

For international air mail, it will take around 10-15 working days to arrive. Most of the early bird backers are estimated to receive our product before mid Nov. Please contact us if you don't receive your order after that.

Does the NodeAnchor come with each of the SLOPES™ Black?
Yes.

Does SLOPES™ Black come in any different colors?

SLOPES™ Black is only offered in black. We also sell SLOPES™ Red, but they are not the same version. SLOPES™ Black is for housed GoPro while SLOPES™ Red for naked GoPro.

 

 

--------------------------------------------------------------

Retailers/Dealers

Want to sell SLOPES™ Black edition at your store? Just email us with your info.

w.fung@rogeti.com

 

--------------------------------------------------------------

About ROGETI

Created by professional photographer ZHOU Ruogu, ROGETI is dedicated to producing interesting and unique equipments, extending the fun of photography. We are a tiny team and our partners come from different places around the world. However, we have created some imaginative photography tools like SLOPES Red and Pano5+1.

 

 

Follow Our Campaign On

story:
Going South

For the last month I’ve been training for a new position as an electronics engineer with the British Antarctic Survey (BAS), it’s something I’ve always wanted to do, and I’m really looking forward to see the world from literally a new angle. My old camera needs to be repaired, and isn’t quite up to the job of capturing the sky, ice and wildlife (mainly penguins) down there. I would like to share some of the excitement of the next year of my life with the world at large. Help me out a little and I’ll reach out to you in thanks with a taste of life down there.


What Camera I’m Ogling at

The funds raised will go towards a new Canon 60D and the range of lenses (hopefully two of them) needed to take photos there, in such a different environment.

Freezing Cool Perks (That was really corny, wasn’t it?)

I think you’ll be excited, I can do something simple like send you a postcard from as far south as I can, or you can get a personalised photo from there, Think “Greetings Sheldon from Antarctica”, or whatever message you like. For a few special people out there, I’m going to be doing a personalised tour of life near the south pole. Check out these, and other cool perks on your right. And no matter what you choose remember to leave me an e-mail address for your Penguin Hug from down south.

Spread the Word

Thank you for even reading this far, and even considering sending a little something my way. Please pass this on to others, the wider the net the more chances you can help make me a penguin paparazzo.

story:
Christoph Untersander is a product developer and photo enthusiast, Jens Krauer is a Fujifilm X-Photographer and together we designed the wooden camera grip for the Fujifilm X-T2 camera.

 

Both based in Switzerland, we are united by a practical approach to photography gear and a fascination for natural high quality materials. Wood as a complementary material to artificial material camera bodies provides a different feel when using your device. Improved ergonomics, low weight and the use of natural materials have been the focus of the development.

The oiled natural material absorbs humidity from the users hands and thereby guarantees a more secure grip than conventional camera grips. Wooden grips don’t cool down or heat up as extreme as metal/plastic ones, which provides more comfort in harsh weather conditions. In order to improve daily use, a battery access has been incorporated into the design without compromising on stability or durability. During daily use, each grip will grow in character and become a personal item and develop an individual patina that will tell the story of your photographic journey.

We produce in Switzerland to guarantee the best quality. The wood used is carefully selected and quality checked and then partially machine crafted for the cutting process and all the other processes are handcrafted. Therefore, beyond the signs of personal use, each grip is a unique item and will further become one as you use it.

 

After six months of development we seek your support for this all-natural product in order to fund and start the production. We believe in the concept of a sustainable product. 

 

What we offer

 

Our funding goal is calculated for buying raw material and upgrading machines for future production. The material we need also includes wood for the grips, packaging and different tools for woodworking. In exchange for your support we offer some cool perks such as:

  • Signed postcards by Jens Krauer
  • Wooden hot shoe covers
  • Early supporter Jens Krauer edition Holzgriff
  • Package consisting of Jens Krauer edition Holzgriff and hot shoe cover
  • Development of Holzgriff for different camera model

 

We need a critical mass to buy materials in decent amounts and to upgrade our machines and tools. This will also allow us to work on production optimization. If we don’t reach our set goal, we will use the collected money to try to produce the promised perks. 

 

Impact

 

By supporting this project you become part of  a commitement towards sustainable and enviromental friendly product development in the realm of camera accessories. We believe that the future lies in the combination of technology and natural ressources not only from a design point of view but also from a "touch and feel" point of view.

Previous versions and editions of the woodgrip (for different camera models) have been succesfully designed, produced and distributed locally and the feedback we received encouraged us to further work on the key features to improve the overall product and to present it to a larger audience. Please check out www.holzgriff.ch to gain an overview of the small edition production that have been the predecessors of this project. 

 

Help us reach our goal

If you don’t own an X-T2 or don’t need a grip right now you can still help us. Please share this campaign with your friends and all people you know, who are interested in photography and might want a grip. Also don’t forget to follow us on Instagram @holzgriff.ch or facebook @holzgriff  for more work in progress and update shots.

More information about us:

www.holzgriff.ch

www.jenskrauer.com
